1.description: Basic nail salon in South Shore where you can get a quick mani/pedi done. You can also get facial waxing and eyelashes... if you are into those services.  Some technicians are better than others, be prepared for a wait and a $1 charge if you use a debit or charge card.

2.description: I come here often because there in my neighborhood, they do an excellent job each & every time. I have had acrylics, pedi's, mani's, eyebrow waxes etc & I have never left disappointed. Every technician in here is that good. While it's a lil cramp & not spa like, its a very good nail salon & always packed anytime of day so that should say a lot.

0.description: So everyone who gets their nails|feet done knows the struggle of getting a really good service somewhere, and then not being able to go back because you move, your person left, etc. Since moving to the South Shore area I was a bit skeptical on getting a pedicure at a new place because my last place was incredibly good at them and they were cheap. I called around and got some prices, and this place told me a pedicure was $22, I was used to pay $16, but my feet needed to be done so I went for it.I showed up as a walk in and they were slightly busy. I took forever choosing a nail color because they didn't have the shade of red I wanted, but eventually I chose something. I waited for about 30 minutes before I was serviced.There were 3 men in there getting their feet done so it made me feel a little more confident that they'd probably do a good job because men usually have ATROCIOUS feet. I'm not sure of the woman's name who did my feet but she did an AWESOME job, probably the best or 2nd best pedicure I've ever had in my entire life. She actually did my feet like she would probably want someone to do her own. I was highly satisfied with my service, and I would definitely return.Please note there is a charge for using debit. It's only 1 or 2 bucks.
Great atmosphere, nice barbers/stylists on duty. Clean well maintained place of business.
This is close as your going to get for a core group of guys having an adult conversation, which come with  the best hair cut as a bonus for the price if $15 dollars

3.description: This ALDI is so great. DEFINITELY worth the price, and even cleanliness and easiness of shopping, advantage over Treasure Island if you're just looking for basic grocery store goods. I got 6 packs of bacon (6 lbs, 120 strips), 4 packs of waffles (40 waffles), and syrup for $25. Damn. By far best prices I know of in the area (which is, admittedly, hard-pressed for grocery stores).In the day time, I felt completely safe in the area. Minus one star for the fact that it's sort of inconsistent for some goods, because, you know, it's ALDI, it's not great at much more than the basic food stuff. I felt like I maybe could have found better prices for apricots and definitely better prices for chocolate bar at Trader Joe's (PERHAPS Hyde Park Produce), but after the time and cost of transit... generally a good bet. Just be prepared to go to a different store if you have really specific needs.Speaking to the safety of the area... it's seriously so fine. People from Hyde Park who feel in danger here I think are mostly awkward nerds who don't know how to interact in grocery stores without pissing people off. I try to go before sunset, but taking the bus I may go later.

1.description: Surprisingly, this store was well maintained, stocked full of variety, and clean. The cashier was pleasant and courteous to my wife and I. Counter space was plentiful to bag your groceries and people shopping weren't loud and ghetto. Definitely A+ in my book. I recommend Aldi on 67th and Cottage....I didn't give it five stars because, well, it's an Aldi!

2.description: I like this Aldi a lot!It's new, it's clean and open, it has friendly staff, and it has cheap groceries.This is not the closest Aldi to me, but it's one of my favorite Aldi's.Their produce (fresh and frozen), milk, canned foods, and frozen pizza are a great deal.

0.description: I'm a Hyde Parker and this is one of my regular grocery stores, along with the Marianos on Clark and 18th street and Hyde Park Produce.  I pick up my staples here (milk, flour, dark chocolate (!), etc. )  As others have said, it is super cheap and clean.  Lines can be a bit long if you come at a popular time, but move quickly   I'm often the only white person there, which is surprising given the large student population close by.

58.description: Some of th WORST bbq I've ever had!! Rib Tips were not seasoned well, which is a MUST for good bbq. The meat should be able to stand alone w/o drowning in sauce. Definately not the case here!! The meat was rather tough, sliced paper thin, & the sauce tasted like a mixture of grease & vinegar w/a bit of sweetness. Where they do THAT at?? And I went on a Saturday Nite, around 8pm, when it shoulda been ON POINT!!! Will NEVER go back. I'll stick to the westside for good bbq@Wiley's.

56.description: Perhaps the best BBQ ribs I have ever had anywhere - definitely in Chicago at least. They have a good sauce and nice smoky flavor. I will rent a car when I am visiting in the city just to go to this place! A bonus is that they are open late. Don't bother with any other BBQ place in the area.

29.description: I found out about Lem's by complete accident. I was staying at an AirBnB down the street and Lem's was shining like a beacon in the night. They were open till 4am and they were the only business open. Best BBQ sauce I've ever had. Try it with the short rib tips. They put your ribs on top of a bed of fries and they pour their delicious sauce over the top. I still have yet to have ribs as good as theirs.

42.description: Best rib tips and hot links in the city!!!  There's something for the whole family as the fried foods (wings and shrimp) are good as well.  The mild sauce is special, smoky with a hint of vinegar, just to add a little kick!If you are not from Chicago and a little leery of a jaunt to the South Side of the city (i.e. Afraid of black people), push those fears aside and get some great "cue"!Take out only!

23.description: If I could give a negative star I would.I had never had Lem's before, but after hearing such amazing things about it my husband and I decided to try it. Worst mistake ever. The rib tips were burnt and tough. The hot link was under cooked. The chicken was disgusting and the "mild sauce" was unlike anything I have ever tasted (and not in a good way). We wasted $27.00 today to learn a valuable lesson....never ever again.

47.description: Had Lem's while in town this past weekend.  First time for my boyfriend to try Chicago Rib Tips....he was a bit skeptical too being a huge fan of ribs (done right of course).  Thanks to you, he is now a rib tip convert....and prefers them over ribs.  Unfortunately for us, Texas doesn't understand the concept of rib tips so we will have to find alternatives until we return to Chicago.  Delicious tips and the sauce was right on point.  Thank you.

8.description: Sweet baby mother of how-can-these-be-so-good rib tips. This was one of those life-changing meals that sets the bar higher of all future BBQ experiences. If you love vinegary-smoky-well-done-crunchy BBQ, this is the place for you. The surprisingly-lean rib tips are chopped up into smaller pieces before being put on a bed of french fries and smothered with sauce. Give it 10 minutes to cool down and juices to spread out and you have a masterpiece. I'm never going to get this out of my head, and can't wait to go back.It's not the safest neighborhood, so consider going during daylight. Everyone was nice when we were ordering. Read Matthew W.'s review for some key pointers.

31.description: Visited Lem's for some late night grub, and what a great experience!Rib tips were very good, a little on the dry and tough side a very tasty. Mild sauce had a nice little kick.Spice rub and smoke factor seemed right on. Will definitely visit again when in Chicago, and try the chicken and shrimp as we'll.During this experience, it was probably more like three and half stars.

34.description: The best ribs in Chicago...If you enjoy fries you may want to ask for another order because they don't give you many.  But the meat is always good!  And the vinegar based sauce is great!

16.description: I went here on a whim late Friday night. Apparently this place has some amazing bbq. To be honest, I'd never heard of this place though I'm a resident and consider myself to be familiar with Southside spots.When I got to Lem's the place was packed! The tiny parking lot was full of cars and there were also cars lining the street. Inside is very small and there's nowhere to sit. There was a 30 minute wait for rib tips but it turned out to only be 20 minutes. Needless to say, it was worth the wait. The ribs were perfect, not too tough, very flavorful and not drowning in bbq sauce. I was so impressed with the food that I didn't care about the location, or the wait. Will def be back.

13.description: Even though I live on the North Side, I'm a South Side boy at heart.  I grew up coming here and, over the years, have converted several lovers and friends.  In the hearts and minds of many South Side Chicagoans, Lem's isn't just a restaurant; it's an iconic culinary institution.  So it goes without saying that every now and then, we get a taste for Lem's and before we know it, we're in the car headed South to 75th.  Tip 1:  know what you want when you step in the door, or prepare to make instant decisions when called upon.  Many an uninitiated individual has incurred the wrath of the spectacled woman that runs the show, takes orders, and doles out the chow.  Just like Teddy Pendergrass'll holler at you, this woman will too, and I've seen it.  I typically go for the Rib Tips (cut small, $.50 extra) and Link combo or the Center Cut Ribs, both with hot and mild sauce, which tends towards the vinegary side of the BBQ sauce flavor scale.  Fries and bread accompany, and part of the magic that is Lem's is having the sauce soak both the bread and fries, so that all may be consumed indiscriminately.  With this tip, I'll also state that, in both cold and warm weather, lines can be lengthy, so if you're close enough to see the menu board, you're close enough to make executive decisions.Tip 2:  Cash only.  From the looks of the place, the savvy individual can easily determine that a credit card machine is as welcome here as a new car is among the Amish.  Don't behave in the manner of the uninitiated and stand, mouth agape with credit card in hand at the register.  Just imagine the sassy, spectacled woman's reaction to this error, and remember your mother's gentle childhood scoldings, urging you to "make better choices." Bring cash with you or be prepared to hit the Chase ATM in the Walgreens at 75th and the Ryan.Tip 3:  Resist all temptation to consume any of this in your car on the way home.  I've tried, with varying levels of success - sometimes on the expressway while piloting a vehicle - and have ruined several articles of clothing for my efforts.  Wait until you can get it home, throw down some newspaper, and decend into beast mode.Tip 4:  After you eat:  return and repeat.  The food is good, the prices are reasonable ($14-22 for rib/rib tip/chicken/hot link combos), and if you're a North Sider like me, it's a great excuse to take a ride and see an area of the city most only read about in the paper for its ills.  Expand both your mind and your waistline!

11.description: Lem's is still awesome, they are open late and they do accept credit cards. I usually get a small rib tip chopped small, sauce on the side. The staff is great and the customers are crazy, but not in a bad way. Keep up the good work yall.

39.description: The hot links was full of fat and cartilage very unhealthy. Years ago that was ok but people today are health conscious. The ribs in Chicago are all the same , it's the sauce that separates the restaurants and when I ordered the ribs tips they were almost dry so the ribs were tasteless. They need a healthier Hot Link for sure. I went to Kinney's Ribs and the links beats Lem's hands down! Times have changed from years ago when it was ok to serve fatty food.

37.description: The family enjoyed it but they complained about not having enough sauce on the ribs.

0.description: If you're anywhere between 72nd-76th and St. Lawrence-Dan Ryan... Take a deep whiff of that yummy Lem's smoke in the air! My grandfather owned our family's building a couple blocks away from here, so my mom grew up off of Lem's and has been a loyal customer since they opened in the 60's. She still can't go a month without it. She passed the craving on to me, as I have literally been enjoying Lem's since I was a baby. I'm serious. My brother's wife jokes that our mom used fries dipped in spicy Lem's sauce as pacifiers. She's about right. It's no frills. Speak up so they hear you through the bulletproof glass (don't be bougie, if you're on 75th you know what this is!) Know what you want or let someone go ahead of you. The workers won't have a lot of time to answer questions. If the line is out the door you have to deal... 7-8 people allowed inside at a time. I wouldn't suggest you try to skip the line.  Order the center cut, tips, or shrimp. Get an extra order of fries because they'll only be like 10 hiding under the meat. They call the sauce "mild sauce" but it's just a name; don't expect the same flavor you get at Harold's or Taurus Flavors. It's spicy, tangy, just too good for the disservice of being called barbecue sauce. It's ok to get the sauce on the side but I get it all over.My brother now lives out of state, my mother sent him some sauce and he said it actually brought a tear to his eye

38.description: Really, this is a 4.5 star review. Here's the deal: you will drive up, you will walk in, it will smell amazing, you will order, receive your order in a paper bag, pay in cash, leave, and eat some of the best BBQ in your life. If you're in a car, drive over to Promontory Point or one of the other nearby parks to eat. The hot links are AMAZING - definitely the best I've ever had. Ribs are also amazing. Great thick, flavorful sauce, with the classic south side white bread and fries. Don't expect fancy sides or, well, fancy anything. This is all about the meat and the sauce.

51.description: Changed my mind.  These tips are the work of an angel. The crappy fries are still annoying but damn they soak up that sauce well.

27.description: POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!! My husband likes their wings. They're ok, I can live without them. I've had the rib tips, not sure if it's the sauce or the meat, but it's greasy. I'm really trying to support businesses on the south side but when you think it's ok to yell at customers and ask if they can read because they are in the phone is just plain ole GHETTO. Did you stop and think for a second I might be getting the persons order because I'm not a regular and don't know the menu. It's ok, because I never plan on going back. Considering I eat out 5 days out the week , you could of had a regular customer but I don't tolerate bad service especially not disrespectful bad service:) carry on!

32.description: The food here is good I went last night got a large tip got home I get to eating  it's good as usual but maybe five minutes later I got the worst pain in my stomach from eating their food What a waste of almost 14.00 dollars because I threw it in the garbage I'm sad because I love lems. Oh also when I was there two employees were arguing and cursing at each other at least if you're going to argue go somewhere that your customers can't here.

54.description: Solid rib tips, and only a 10 minute drive from UChicago.  $13 for the large portion. I could finish about half, and I'm a shamefully big eater.

48.description: we boughtbeef tips - juicy fatty and incredibleribs - ok, dry compare to the tipshot link - very crunchy, meaty and nicely seasonedwill come back for the tips!

24.description: Went to Lem's to get a large order of tips. The first thing I notice was the new menu with an outrageous price increase.  I understand they have not increased their prices for quite some time, but this is a bit much.  When I got  home, the tips were dry and overcooked or old. To say  I was disappointed would be an understatement. I went at 3:00, so they had not been open that long. The quality of the food is very inconsistent. One day the food is spectacular, the next visit it's inedible. If I want to gamble, I would go to Harrahs. If you want to take a chance, go  for it. Sadly, I'm done with Lems. At least it wasn't a total waste of money, my dog seemed to thoroughly enjoy the tips.

7.description: Sadly we don't have really good, notable barbeque on the north side (other than Smoque...) So it's worth the trip down 94 to Lem's on the south side. It's a small place with nowhere to sit, but they're always crowded and the wait is truly worth it.What makes them stand out is that you can taste the smoke flavor of their meat. They definitely know bbq and how to do it right! Orders come with bread, fries, and their vinegary sauce which you can have on the side, or drenched on your food. Either way, Lem's is the real deal. Love that they're open late, too!!I highly recommend the rib tips. They can be a bit on the fatty side, but they are delicious. (You may want to order a bucket if you're sharing or want some for later.) Fantastic!

49.description: if you want authentic south side bbq, go here, im convinced jesus came back to work the pit here because the food is that damn good, i flew to chitown from ga, and the first place i stopped at was lems,and they were closed for the thanksgiving holiday, i cried harder than chris brown at the bet awards. best choice: the tips or hot links....and if your smart, add the mil sauce

40.description: It has been forever since I've made a bbq trip to the south side. I've been dying to do such a thing, so I figured Dark Lord Day would be the perfect excuse. Now, understand, while the North Side has some good BBQ, the South Side has great BBQ. And Lem's is most certainly great BBQ.Since I was splitting the food with several friends, I loaded up. I went with a half order of fried shrimp, hot links, and a full order of rib tips. With all of these came fries and some of the best sauce I've ever had. The fried shrimp were delicious. Granted, everything was delicious with the sauce added, but these were fried perfectly and I was regretting(at the time) not getting a full order. The hot links were on the dry side, but they really brought the spice. The main show however were the rib tips. ZOMG these were awesome! Smokey and juicy, these were worth the trip alone. The full sized order was massive too. My two friends and I assumed it would be relatively easy to share a full order, butnahhhhh. They weren't joking when they called it a full order. While it took us a while to finish it, it was absolutely awesome the whole way. Lem's is flat out killer BBQ. It's cash and takeout only and is well worth the drive there. I'm still smiling just thinking about what I had and what I will get the next time I go.

53.description: Not your typical run of the mill BBQ sauce. I got the 1/2 chicken white, with sauce. At first, I thought the sauce was weird tasting and I didn't like it, but the more I ate it, the more I started to like it. The place gets crowded quick, and they pretty much ask you what you want as soon as you step in the door. Your food comes with fries and THREE pieces of bread. Holy batman that's a lot of carbs. The wait wasn't too long, and we paid $20 bucks for the 1/2 chicken and my boyfriends ribs.What I can say is this place doesn't touch Uncle Johns BBQ on 69th, but if they're closed, this is a good 2nd option.

30.description: I used to go to Uncle John's but they have closed.  This is a now My BBQ spot. The food is to die for, I'm a tip girl and they don't disappoint.  The meet is pink pink, which means great flavor.  Run don't walk to this place.

46.description: You know, when I am spending MY money, I dont expect to be treated like a Queen but I do expect RESPECT...I went here for Labor day and man oh man!!! The service is ridiculous!!! This was the set up....Stand in line (which is understandable) someone comes outside with pen and paper and writes down your order...If you make it inside and the lady has not went in and gave them your order you have to wait, they will not take your order inside and when she gets back just CROSS IT OFF THE LIST!!!! So I waited patiently because I wanted some BBQ...When I get my order , it is not what I ordered.  I nicely tell the cow behind the glass that I only wanted...the lady writing the orders down, jumps in and says "no you didnt you said....", I said well I only want....then one of the cooks jumps in and says, "what did you order, what did you order". I politely say, I just told you.  The lady writing orders gets to waving her hands, "that aint what you said again and again..I am not saying a word just observing, I say never mind just give me back my money and I leave and take my 35.00 order to Uncle Johns!!! Get some damn customer service skills My Brothers and Sisters, no need to get irate just get the order right apologize or dont but dont loose a customer over the order being just a little mixed up. OMG. But hey I found another hidden GEM!

1.description: Very good ribs even without the sauce.Nice and tender.Hot links okay....not super spicy.Sauce somewhat greasy......but tasty!

55.description: Good barbecue. I'd rate it 3rd in the city behind Smoque and Sweet Baby Ray's in a tie for first (note: haven't been up to RUB). Thought they used a bit too much sauce and some of the tips were too fatty but overall, very tasty. I like the authentic feel too.

9.description: Nice big shrimp, clean, open on time, everything that was on the menu was available (unlike the now defunct George's).  This is my new go to BBQ place.

26.description: Wow. Ok, just... Lem's how DARE you serve me so much delicious meat! I can't believe I ate the whole thing. Large tips, mild sauce, the epitome of Chicago cuisine. This BBQ is indescribable. I'll let others try. I'm still stammering. The service was also impressive! The line was out the door (the joint is small), but even so, I was out the door in like 10 minutes. Exceptional establishment. WARNING: you may soon need to buy bigger pants.

25.description: I'm back again reviewing -- they've updated their pricing and might I say it's quite a change. Everything has increased by $1.00-4.00 difference. The order I placed had me paying more money and they gave me less food. I see that today is the last day I will eat here. Nothing wrong with changing prices REASONABLY but not when you lessen up on the food that comes with the purchase. No thanks.

12.description: Some of the best bbq in the city hands down, but I would love to see some brisket and pork but...

21.description: Even though I live on the North Side, I'm a South Side boy at heart.  I grew up coming here and, over the years, have converted several lovers and friends.  In the hearts and minds of many South Side Chicagoans, Lem's isn't just a restaurant; it's an iconic culinary institution.  So it goes without saying that every now and then, we get a taste for Lem's and before we know it, we're in the car headed South to 75th.  Tip 1:  know what you want when you step in the door, or prepare to make instant decisions when called upon.  Many an uninitiated individual has incurred the wrath of the spectacled woman that runs the show, takes orders, and doles out the chow.  Just like Teddy Pendergrass'll holler at you, this woman will too, and I've seen it.  I typically go for the Rib Tips (cut small, $.50 extra) and Link combo or the Center Cut Ribs, both with hot and mild sauce, which tends towards the vinegary side of the BBQ sauce flavor scale.  Fries and bread accompany, and part of the magic that is Lem's is having the sauce soak both the bread and fries, so that all may be consumed indiscriminately.  With this tip, I'll also state that, in both cold and warm weather, lines can be lengthy, so if you're close enough to see the menu board, you're close enough to make executive decisions.Tip 2:  Cash only.  From the looks of the place, the savvy individual can easily determine that a credit card machine is as welcome here as a new car is among the Amish.  Don't behave in the manner of the uninitiated and stand, mouth agape with credit card in hand at the register.  Just imagine the sassy, spectacled woman's reaction to this error, and remember your mother's gentle childhood scoldings, urging you to "make better choices." Bring cash with you or be prepared to hit the Chase ATM in the Walgreens at 75th and the Ryan.Tip 3:  Resist all temptation to consume any of this in your car on the way home.  I've tried, with varying levels of success - sometimes on the expressway while piloting a vehicle - and have ruined several articles of clothing for my efforts.  Wait until you can get it home, throw down some newspaper, and decend into beast mode.Tip 4:  After you eat:  return and repeat.  The food is good, the prices are reasonable ($14-22 for rib/rib tip/chicken/hot link combos), and if you're a North Sider like me, it's a great excuse to take a ride and see an area of the city most only read about in the paper for its ills.  Expand both your mind and your waistline!

17.description: The bucket of tipsare delicious.Especially with lemon and pepper sauce.You all should try it.It is very convenient.

10.description: Lem's is always worth the trip. Growing up in the South, I've been consistently frustrated with the BBQ available on the north side. Although Rib Tips weren't a common sighting where I'm from I've grown to love them, mainly through the experience at Lem's.Lem's is a perfect example of the 'aquarium smoker' type smokehouse. It's simple, delicious and no nonsense.

5.description: Pretty good. I like Lems because it has a backyard BBQ type of taste. But my god it's expensive. Maybe overpriced. Large tip and link $20. The market rate is more like $14-15. But the place is always packed.

3.description: I'm glad they start accepting cards and not just cash. Food has been excellent for years. But not that thwy have different forms of payments, it's even better.

35.description: Just finished off half a chicken and tried some of my friend's hot links and tips. Oh wow. Wow wow wooooow. That was the best heart attack and a half meal I've had in some time. Definitely worth the trip. Also - Their sauce is so delicious I could drink it by itself. Only downfall is there is no place to sit and eat.

19.description: Wow. Ok, just... Lem's how DARE you serve me so much delicious meat! I can't believe I ate the whole thing. Large tips, mild sauce, the epitome of Chicago cuisine. This BBQ is indescribable. I'll let others try. I'm still stammering. The service was also impressive! The line was out the door (the joint is small), but even so, I was out the door in like 10 minutes. Exceptional establishment. WARNING: you may soon need to buy bigger pants.

28.description: very good rib tips and hot links.  this is one place that stands behind what they serve.  outstanding.motorcycle Vern from indiana

45.description: Wow. By a mile, the best rib tips I have ever had. Ribs are awesome too. This is the best ribs in Chicago IMO.

33.description: I'll NEVER patronize this business EVER again! The service here is extremely Mean, Vulgar, & Rude! I've been here a few times because my Dad loves BBQ and this place is the closest. However, The counter lady named Lynn has one of the WORST attitudes I've ever experienced as a humble customer of any business! It appears she's always mad at something...She snatches your money, throws your change back, and shoves your food through the chute. She roughly and nasty handles your food. She once took some Chicken out the grease and let it drip directly on my fries. When I questioned it, she berated me and basically told me to leave... I think the place is popular on the southside due to its longetivy, instead of service and good food. Going in its a closet size small space that squeezes customers in.The food is Ok. I'll give it a basic 5/10 rating. The ribs are a hit and miss. One day you might get a good meaty rib, the next you'll get a dried out skinny burned piece. The chicken wings are very small. The sauce is kinda tangy, but manageable.Overall, I won't patronize this business ever again nor will I suggest this place to any of my friends... Hope they get better service!

2.description: This is the BBQ you've been seeking. It is kind of hard to quantify just how wonderful this BBQ can be. Smoke is the flavor. This isn't that slow cooked, super soft stuff that you get at most places, this is fast smoked, so the smoke flavor is in the crust on the meat, it is in the meat, it is on the other side of the meat. This BBQ is so good, that you can enjoy it without any sauce on it, and that is really saying something. As a matter of fact, get an order of rib tips with sauce on the side next time you go, and just nibble them tips for a while. If there is something I don't like about Lems it is the super-limited menu. They could be smoking turkey breasts and veggies in there, not just ribs and tips.  And then there is the fact that you could fit more people in you car than customers can fit in that store.

18.description: Yesterday went to what was my Favorite BBG house, Lems. What a disappointment! The rib tips were too salty and the entire order was full of burnt meat. I guess I will have to drive to I-57 for good ribs. I must say that Lems sauce is still the best. Flavorful with just enough kick. I guess that you can buy a gallon of sauce and put it on I-57 ribs!

41.description: Good ribs & tips! They use a vinegar based sauce instead of a tomato based sauce, and I LOVE IT!!! Carry out only. No good side dish options other than fries.

52.description: Scary at first but worth the journey.A large rib tips is 2 meals and worth buying 2!Sauce is just like Russel's sauce.The fries on the bottom and bread on top of the ribs was a awesome bonus.The Char on the ribs was thick n smokey and amazing and is now my fav bbq joint in the world.sj from the burbs

50.description: Lems has become my go to place when I want ribs and don't want to drive out to Gary Indy  to my favorite place. I like that they are fast and pretty much consistent with their food. Would love if they took credit cards.

4.description: Like most folks who grew up eating Lem's, I'm probably a bit biased. While most people seem to prefer their bbq slathered in tomato based sweet sauces, I prefer Lem's spicy vinegar based sauce. Against common practice, Lem's doesn't ascribed to the low n' slow method. Their ribs are cooked quickly in high temps, but somehow develop championship quality smoke rings and tender meat. People usually love or hate Lem's, as you can see I'm a fan.

6.description: Best place for BBQ in Chicago (my opinion). I don't eat poem as much as I used to but when I have a taste for for a treat this is my go to spot!  I used to be a regular and I've been going for all of my adult life.

22.description: I went here on a whim late Friday night. Apparently this place has some amazing bbq. To be honest, I'd never heard of this place though I'm a resident and consider myself to be familiar with Southside spots.When I got to Lem's the place was packed! The tiny parking lot was full of cars and there were also cars lining the street. Inside is very small and there's nowhere to sit. There was a 30 minute wait for rib tips but it turned out to only be 20 minutes. Needless to say, it was worth the wait. The ribs were perfect, not too tough, very flavorful and not drowning in bbq sauce. I was so impressed with the food that I didn't care about the location, or the wait. Will def be back.

15.description: If I could give a negative star I would.I had never had Lem's before, but after hearing such amazing things about it my husband and I decided to try it. Worst mistake ever. The rib tips were burnt and tough. The hot link was under cooked. The chicken was disgusting and the "mild sauce" was unlike anything I have ever tasted (and not in a good way). We wasted $27.00 today to learn a valuable lesson....never ever again.

57.description: When I was eating red meat, I enjoyed tips and short ends from this place. There are a couple women that work here or are owners, or something that ruined the rating for this place because of their bad attitudes, but I've always had great service from the men. Good job guys. It is a Southside joint that people should pop in for ribs with an interesting sauce.Small tip, hot, chopped small for me, please! (Aw damn, I've given up red meat.) Oh well.

20.description: Wow, today is just not my day. Just purchased the crappiest slab of ribs ever!! So bad that I threw half of them in the garbage. Flavorless, old, meat with dried out ends. Your better off getting a McRib, and I don't even condone that mystery meat. Go away Lem's.

36.description: So, went here last Saturday afternoon with the gf and two others.  Nice day for a motorcycle ride, and we figured this was as good a destination as any.  Walked in and figured we'd just order a variety, so I got the tips, links, shrimp, 4 wings, 1/4 dark chicken, adn 1/4 white chicken.  Didn't do any math in my head, that just felt like $60-70, and when the food came it was $44.  $44.  Ridiculous.  Everything came with fries and bread.  We barely touched the fries, the bread was great for wrapping the links and sopping up the sauce.  Speaking of the sauce, stupid me ordered extra which was COMPLETELY unnecessary since everything came swimming it in.  The sauce was glorious.  So much so that I did one of the extras as a shooter.  How was each food item?-Tips - pretty good, decent smoke flavor, definitely benefitted from the sauce.  Not as tender as I'd have liked.  I want to try these again to see if I got their best effort.  -Links - good but the are the one thing I would drop next time I go.  Good smoke flavor, firm, dense, but I would prly go elsewhere to satisfy my sausage craving. -Shrimp - good but nothing better about these than any other non-chain fried shrimp I have had.  -Wings - great, crispy skin, sauce hung on nicely, super juicy.-1/4 dark and 1/4 white - actually my two favorite things.  Great skin, lots of nooks and crannies holding sauce, meat was hot and juicy.  For me, the highlight of the meal.  Next time we go, I'll just tell them to hold the fries on all but one or two things.  The fries are just filler.  You go to a place like Lem's for the meat, everything else just gets in the way.  Suggestion:  There's no seating.  Take your food due east to the lake and eat there with a nice view.  Strong suggestion:  Bring a roll of paper towell or a thing of wet naps,  You are not given nearly enough napkins to handle the sh!%ton of sauce on the food.

14.description: Went this past  Sunday before NBA finals got in and out quickly. I've patronized Lem's my entire life and it didn't disappoint probably top 5-7 out of all my visits over last 35 plus years. We ordered Large rib tip cooked perfectly tender saucy tips, Center cut ribs very good drenched in sauce, and chicken not the best but was good. Mad love and respect to Lem's!! A must try if you haven't already it's worth it.

3.description: Customers using their credit card are charged a $1 fee & there is an $8 minimum. Located next to the YWCA

1.description: In  and out. It seems the owners have frequent customers as she knew it was my first time there. Very good job on my eyebrows. I will be back for more services.

2.description: They have bedbugs and the polish chips in two days the same day the warranty runs out! Terrible!

5.description: Horrible customer service. The shop "opens" at 10:00am no one is ever there before 10:30. Employees are rude, rude, rude. Will NOT be going back.

6.description: Had a no chip manicure here and it was the worst no chip I've ever had. My polish chipped in two days had to go back. The guy told me that I would have to pay if he ever have to do it again, Even if it wasn't my fault I would have to pay to have it to have a polish redone. And the cheap polish didn't even look good on my nails It was a no chip polish that I had never heard of. And they were so nasty when I had to go back. I don't think I'll ever be going back to this salon ever for anything again. They are lucky to even get one star!!

7.description: Horrible!!  Please don't complain abt anything.  The nail techs jump up and shout over you drawing so much attention to you.  They push work off, telling you to come back tomorrow.  So sad they in a place where people have no other place to go to be treated as if they appreciate you being there.  Dude left my nails out (havin no chip done) as he took several cell phone calls.  Never ever going there again.  Fell sorry for those who have no other choice.  How you are treated there is so not how it goes.

0.description: I forgot to mention that this shop they're a great shop but they seem like they don't ever know how to answer their phone when you try to call them the number that's listed here on yelp is not the right number here's the number to g nails 773-752-4234

4.description: My very first and LAST time at this nail salon! WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!! Went in for a pedicure and an older lady was assisting me. When asked could she cut my toenails down a little more, she told me no! At first I thought I heard wrong so I replied "excuse me" then she said "you come back in two weeks and we'll cut down some more" I told her "that's unacceptable" she proceeded to continue on my feet and when I tell you she did NOT even attempt to cut my toenails shorter! So I stopped her informed her that I did not want her continuing on my feet" I asked another younger employee there if there was someone else who could continue servicing me because she was rude and incapable of giving me proper service... Well that comment must've enraged the rude employee because she jumped up and said "you pay now and get out!" I could not believe what was going on and if it wasn't happening to me I probably would've laughed. Just to iterate, I am not or ever will be a difficult customer I highly despise people of the sort. I informed her she will not disrespect me by yelling at me! She then said she was going to call the police on me if I didn't pay right now!(never you mind the only thing that had been done was polish removal and improper toe nail clipping) I told her go right ahead because I refuse to pay anything to her at all! The younger employee came over and was apologetic about the other lady's behavior(yet nothing was said to the older lady) and she finished me up. The younger lady did a wonderful job but no one has to endure that type of lunancy from any person you're paying your money to for service! Of course she never called the police because I'M CERTAIN they would've hauled her off with her erratic and bizarre behavior! I know people ask "well why did you stay?" At the time, I had an important event to attend and time was critical and not on my side but believe me I will never ever go back there again! I suggest no one does!!!!!

1.description: I'm was on the phone holding on from 147st all the way here & when I got here told the lady about it she asked me with an attitude why would you stay on hold so long. Dumb bitch  hung up on me

0.description: Hit or Miss location. Sometimes you can tell that the chicken/fries are old or you'll call in for pick-up and still have to wait in an empty restaurant while they make it. The main cashier is nice and will remember and converse with frequent customers.The only thing that bugged me is that a 4-piece is basically $7 and until now they only took cash.

12.description: Ordered for the first time today through Grubhub. Delivery time estimation was 2hrs. SMH! After receiving my order, the food was extremely cold and my delivery was delayed. Overall, the food was good after microwaving it. I'll probably order again but it will be a pickup or dine in.

7.description: I returned and had BBQ tips and an horchata. The tips were tender with a slightly sweet sauce. Fries are included. They were good. The horchata was okay. They are worth trying if you have a hankering for either.

3.description: It is always good to find a good shawarma plate on the bitty Southside. I was very impressed when I came across Bonfire. I ordered the rib tips, chicken shawarma and a cobb salad. The salad is huge for the price and they give you a good amount of chicken. My fiance enjoyed the chicken shawarma and the rip tips...sorry to say, but I have had better. Lem's is the way to go with the tips. No competition for me right now. I will try them again. I heard the burgers are awesome, so when I am in the area again. I will give them a shout.BUT on a side note. please get some awnings for patio umbrellas. Standing in the heat to order can be difficult. Other then that very clean on the outside.

1.description: Ordered breakfast off of Groupon, first time. I ordered at 930, didn't get my food til almost 12. Called and receive a rude employee tell me that they was waiting in a driver to deliver my food has been ready for some time. I said ok as long as my food arrives warm. He then stated ok, it was a mess. I spent close to $50 for  Coffee that was disappointing. Only options for pancakes gluten-free and wheat, horrible.Scrambled eggs rubber-like. I'm quite sure the food is good if it was warmed. Very disappointed.

2.description: So this is my second time ordering, my first was over a year ago.Last time it took 2 hours...read that right, 2 hours to get my food.  I had to call 3 times to get a straight answer.  Mind you I live 5 blocks away.This time we were given a 1 hour estimate, took hour and a half.  We called only to get the typical, although true, "we sent it out."  The food arrived cold, the fries soggy, and the meat mostly dry and overcooked.  All the BBQ sauce in the world can't mask how dry the rib tips areThere are so many more options available that are better than this.  I mean, I'd rather go to McDs and grab chicken nuggets than eat this...at least they will be hot.Again, avoid at all costs for delivery.

9.description: If you like fresh ingredients you will love Bonfire Grill Chicago. Everything is made fresh. There are huge windows you can see your food being made while you wait which is always good. My favorite thing there are the homemade sauces, from the tangy BBQ sauce to the homemade hot sauce Bonfire Grill Chicago has you covered. It is a great place for vegetarians and meat eaters. We usually get the veggie burger or the porteblla burger, which are both awesome.Bonfire Grill Chicago does grilled food cooking right. Cheers,Jordan & Marks

10.description: We had our food delivered. We're about a 15 minute drive away and our food still arrived hot. It was well packaged to prevent spilling. Everything we ordered was delivered. My husband had the BBQ pork rib tips, which he loved. Our 3 - year-old mowed through her hot dog and asked for more. I built my own burger and IT WAS DELICIOUS!  The handmade sirloin burger was thick and flavorful. If I had a complaint it would be that the bun wasn't sturdy enough for the awesomeness of the burger. We finished off with a donut. It looked and tasted like it was made fresh. We wished we had more.

13.description: REALLY good burgers but extremely slow delivery

16.description: What a great find. My daughter has to have gluten free food and they have an extensive gluten free menu. My daughter loves this place. We will come back. I wish it were a dine-in restaurant. I can imagine it might be cold standing outdoors during the winter attempting to place an order....lol

17.description: Quality food at a fair price.

15.description: Catchy name but far from great food and service. Came to the Resturant looking for the entrance and couldn't find it, realized it was a walk to a window and order your food type Resturant. Great way to get robbed as a customer. I placed my order and literally took 40 minutes to get my food. I ordered a chicken shawarma and and it was nothing what it sounded like from the menu. It wasn't even a shawarma sandwich it was a sloppy chicken gyro with curry seasoning. I also order a hotdog Chicago style. The bread was hard the hot dog was char grilled and burned and no where near Chicago style. This was my first time and my last time there. I didn't eat the food that I purchased. Not something I would recommend. Especially waiting 40 minutes and your the only customer. Worst thing I hate is bad service,  I work hard for my money and I felt uncomfortable ordering when people soliciting and asking me for money while I'm paying for my food. I also hate throwing away food, what a waste of time and money.

0.description: Delicious and conveniently located. I had the lamb burger and I've had the hot dog. Don't order side of fries if you order those hahaha I did and then I noticed they both came with fries :)

5.description: Bonfire Grill is one of those hidden treasures that needs to be explored.  I would have given it 5 stars but there are a few things that need to be improved but trust its not much.When I first started my journey to Bonfire Grill I was thinking breakfast but we got there too early around 8:45am and they don't open until 9:00am so my daughter and I decided to take a walk and come back in 15mins.  When we got there they still weren't open but it wasn't the fault of the owner there was a very bad accident on the highway so my daughter and I left and decided to come back.  When we came back we were very excited to get breakfast but it was a little pricey.  The Omelets were comparable price 7.99, the Denver Omelet and 5.99 for a 2 egg Omelet with cheese then if you want to add veggies .49, meat 1.39, if you want to make it Egg Whites it's 1.99.  They also have a 2-2-2 Special which is 2 pancakes, 2 eggs and 2 bacon/sausage for 6.60...so we decided we would visit another time maybe for lunch.I have heard so many good things about this place so I knew I wanted to come back and I'm so glad I cam back today. This time I brought my girlfriend and we had the opportunity to talk to the owner Pam; she was so sweet and so excited about her business.  She spoke to us like we were VIP I mean straight celeb status.  What made me want to come back more than anything was her positive passion for her business and the food.She allowed us to taste the Alabama Bonfire Pulled Turkey for 7.99 and it is so worth it because she uses real turkey that is slowly smoked or roasted(IDK and I don't care which one it was all I know is it was soooooo good)  If you like Turkey I say TRY THIS!!! You won't be disappointed and the Alabama BBQ sauce is delicious.  Please note even if you like cheese don't mess up this fabulous treat with cheese Enjoy it as is!What can I say about the freshly ground BYOBB(BUILD YOUR OWN BURGER) made to order Sirloin Burger?  What can't I say?  I wasn't expecting the mound of tasty and flavorful beef to touch my tongue and marinate with my taste buds in such away that I savored each bite as I bit into my sandwich.  If you check out my pictures you will see why it's worth 7.99 and the add-ons are from .49 to .99 not a bad deal at all.  I added mushrooms, Bonfire Smoked Cheese and bacon(make sure you say you want your bacon crispy) I also added the marinated red onions for free.This is one of the reasons I like the Owner Pam so much because although the Turkey Burger was good it wasn't great.  The flavor on the turkey was on point but because they are made then frozen it took away from the amazing burger and when we told her our opinion she didn't give us an attitude she actually listened and took what we said as constructive criticism. For all my Turkey Burger Heads let Pam know you are willing to wait for a fresh burger with a great price and good flavor I know she will appreciate it.They use all fresh ingredients nothing canned...I think that's what set her apart from other places as well.  She runs or has a community garden where they get there fresh veggies for the salads.Don't worry if you are a Vegetarian or you know someone that is because they have a variety of fresh items for you as well like Grilled Portabella Sandwich, Tofu Wrap, Bonfire Veggie Burger, Tofu Omelet and Salads. A plus is the Vegetarian items are cooked on their %100 Vegetarian Only Grill!!!They also serve Maxwell Street Style Food, BBQ and soup.They no longer serve the turkey tips at this time but we can cross our fingers that they come back.We also tasted the Shaken Lemonade and Ice Tea very good and a large is only 1.89.She also thinking about having a soul food day on Saturdays...I hope she does because she was saying the green would come straight from the garden...Yum!You WON'T FIND any  fried chicken, fried catfish, mozzarella sticks, etc. it's all about the grill and freshness.  They do have French fries though...lolIf you can't tell I love the food and I think the owner is great and I think we need to support this place because the owner cares about her customer and has a passion for her food!!Give them a chance and don't forget too....Enjoy!!!!

11.description: Hands down the best rib tips on this side of town. We had the order delivered to us and to my surprise, everything was nice and hot. I was nervous about the french fries being soggy/cold upon delivery, but they were perfect. We had the homemade donuts for dessert and were not disappointed at all. Everything was absolutely perfect and delicious!The ONLY reason why I'm not giving this a 5-star review is because the driver had a sh*tty attitude. If I were basing this review on food alone, it would be 10 stars.

8.description: I've ordered from Bonfire a handful of times now. They're always quick and the food is hot. Great price and their veggie burgers and veggie philly are both amazing! It's definitely one of the cheaper places to order from, too. The only hang up is sometimes the paper bag smells like weed... Ha. I don't really mind too much, but it is kinda gross. Whatever the delivery guy does on his own time is fine with me, but the smell is kinda annoying. It's not enough to keep me from ordering though!

4.description: I wish that I could say how amazing their food was unfortunately that is not the case. After ordering food on a Friday night it took me two hours to get my food! After calling several times to see exactly what was taking so long no one could give me answers, I will not even get started on the customer service and how I had to be the one to call for follow ups after the manager told me she would return my calls and I we don't get a full refund because we refused to drive 20 mins to return a bag of cold food! The whole ordeal was completely unacceptable.

14.description: Just happen to find this restaurant while heading home. Noticed the kids line so i decided to try..(If teenagers like the food...thats usually a good sign :) I was quite surprised. i ordered the Tofu Wrap (I'm no vegetarian but i do occasionally enjoy veggie dishes)...I was IN LOVE. The marinated tofu was definitely a taste created by the owner (..i asked)  overall i will be back. but i would like more soup choices.

6.description: I finally decided to check out the restaurant since I heard they have pretty good food. If my food wasn't cold by the time it got to me, I could actually vouch for them in that department. I ordered my meal a little after 5pm. I check my email and the estimated delivery time was between 6:40-6:50pm. I was fine with that. Soon, I get an email stating that the delivery would arrive at 6:55. Again, it wasn't a big deal. I wait and the food didn't arrive yet. So I get in contact with the restaurant, I get another time change. This time it's 7:05, 7:05 comes, I get a another time for 7:14. That time comes by, it's 7:29. Once 7:29 pops up on my clock, next thing I know I get a message stating that they're on their way. My food didn't arrive until 8pm. Plus I told them to have the delivery driver text me when they got to my apartment...... He didn't even have the decency to come to the door! I had to walk out and find his van. To top it off, the restaurant knew that this guy in that green van took forever to drop off my food. It would've been nice to get a warm meal since I waited that long. Bonfire, my food was cold. I ended up throwing it away. Dude didn't even give me all of my change. You guys are tripping. If I could leave a review without that one star, I would.

58.description: With an abundance of nail salons in this city, I wasn't overly impressed with Nail 2ne1.  I recently went there for the first time and had an appointment.  I finally received service after almost 20 minutes past my appointment time, which was annoying.  The actual mani/pedi itself was just fine, very pleasant in fact, but I also don't like their drying area.  It's awkward b/c it's the same place as the counter, so while you're sitting there drying you're also face to face with the employee at the counter so it's just a little weird.  Lateness is one of my biggest pet peeves, which is why I'm only giving this place 2 stars.  There's a nail salon also near me - Pinky - and I will go back there instead.

56.description: This is one of my favorite nail places in Chicago.  I'll go ahead and list the reasons why.  1. Jin gives great manicures.2. The place is nice and clean3. I like the products they use- lotions and oils4. They give you hot towels. Not every place does that and I really like hot towels for a manicure.5. They give great hand and back massages included in the cost of your service.I could go on and on, but I hope you get the idea.  I like this place and it's starting to become my regular spots.  They have great colors available, each person that goes there has a set of nail tools dedicated to them.  It's an awesome nail place, if you're looking for somewhere new in this neighborhood I would check it out.

29.description: Favorite nail salon in the West Loop. I was going to a big parade and wanted nail art and they gladly accommodated which is tough to find. All the employees make you fell so welcome and their mini massages after your service doesn't hurt a bit! Nails lasted over a week! Money well spent.

42.description: they give you great, full attention. they do not rush when they are with you! they have a great special mon-wed for a mani/pedi... even without the special i would still go to this place over any other salon on west loop!

23.description: Everyone was professional and sweet, but within 24 hours three of my nails had chipped, and within 48 hours it was a disaster of a manicure. I have manicures regularly elsewhere without this problem and they used the same OPI i always have, so apparently the problem is with them. I just moved office location so ill be looking for another nail spot in the area.

47.description: I went here with a friend to use our travelzoo certificates - mani/pedi for $25 I think.  I agree with everything the other reviewers have said: the staff was very friendly and attentive, the quality of work met expectations, the place was bright and clean and I also appreciated the nice touches like the choice of scented soaks for the manicure and the shoulder massage at the end.  The only thing was that my pedicure and manicure seemed rushed relative to my friend's, who started at the same time but lasted way longer.  But overall, I would recommend it.

8.description: I've been to a thousand diff nail salons, but would honestly say that this is the best one yet. Everyone is super friendly and most of all, COMMUNICATION IS KEY. if you tell them that you are in a rush, they will work quickly. if not, they will take their time. Sometimes, I am a "picky customer" and I ask them to reshape or recolor some of my nails, and they do it without hesitation. I also love that when my nails get chipped, I can always come back for a quick fix for no extra charge! I like the environment inside too; very modern. I think the price is decent, esp because you get a free massage during the pedicure, manicure, and at the end when you're at the drying station. Not to mention the hot towels! My nails always look my best and I trust them with it!

31.description: This place is great! I recently moved to the area and was in need of a clean, good nail salon and I found it at Nail 2NE1. They have a mini fridge full of water and soda for their clients and all of my manicures and pedicures have lasted with no chips for a good amount of time. The techs are all friendly and they give a nice back rub too.  I would defintely reccomend going here for your nails.

34.description: I wish I could give no stars to this place. I went there a few times because it's really close to where I live. The first time they did ok. The second time, one of the ladies  there started working on my nails. It honestly looked like it was first day at work...ever. Se was just filing my nails so slowly and looked like she didn't know what she was doing or what to do next. I think another one must've noticed because she took over and did a decent job but definitely not great. Last time I was there, the girl who did my nails was so bad it was almost unbelievable. You could literally see the layers of a thick nail polish. I told her that I thought maybe the nail polish was too thick but she just looked me like I wanted her to pay for my mani. I guess third time isn't always a charm. My suggestion? Go some place else or...do your nail yourself. I GUARANTEE they will look better.

16.description: Horrible. Took them almost 30 min. To remove a no chip, I asked for a manicure she "pretended" to cut my cuticles. They are visibly not. all my nails are filed uneven and in different shapes. When I complained I was not offered to make it right, or for my money back.  I was told this is how they do it. Worst service ever and horrible way to conduct business.

13.description: I've stopped in here on lunch hours a few times, and it's been nothing spectacular, but convenient. Today, however, was BAD. I opted for the deluxe spa nail manicure.  It states $22.00 on their rate card that is at the manicure station, but after the manicure lady and the front desk guy got in an argument, it ended up being $25.00.  Fine, I don't care.  But it was probably the worst manicure I've ever had.  I felt like the manicurist was in a bad mood, she shoved my hand around like I was in a meat packing plant, and basically rushed me through the entire process.  It clearly states that  10 minute shoulder/back massage is included.... I asked for that, pissed her off, and she maybe gave me a 2 minute massage.  I got home this eve, looked at the nails and have all these dried cuticals, hang nails, etc.  NEVER again.... staff there (except for the guy at the front desk) all act like they are pissed at the world!Again, I have been there a few times because of convenience, but never again after today!

11.description: I went to this salon based on the below reviews....however I have to wonder where these people have been going because Nail 2ne1 Spa is not even close to even a mediocre nail salon experience I have ever had.   It was nice that I got in right away....however the foot baths were not clean, the chairs were old, the person who did my nails was pleasant but didn't pay much attention to detail.  I had a nail that was cracked and I had to point it out right before he applied the polish.   The foot massage was more like a delicate skin rub.   The staff were pleasant but the environment wasn't as nice as the many other places I have experienced.   It was only 45 for both manicure and pedi....thank god it was cheap....it was worth just getting my cuticles trimmed and callouses softened for a bit....I will have to change my polish tonight as they sent me away with a smudged big toe from the Saran Wrap that they put on my toes and a nail tip that didn't get full coverage of the color.

39.description: Very friendly service and great attention to detail.  The hand, leg, and back massages were amazing, too!  My one criticism is that a few nails are filed a bit crooked - but you have to really look to notice.  Regardless, I'll be back!

37.description: I can't say enough about this place--they really go above and beyond and take the time to make you feel pampered. Exactly what getting a mani/pedi is supposed to be! Great service and a very nice environment.

0.description: This is my go-to nail shop in Chicago. I moved a year ago and this location is no longer convenient, but I still make the trip. Here's why:-everyone is super nice and TALENTED - they all do a great job so I never worry about who I'm going to get-take their time with the extras (massage during pedicure, warm towels, etc.)-very clean and comfortable -great color and brand selection-bonus shoulder massage at the end (they always ask first, so if you don't want it you have the opportunity to say no thanks)-street parking always available-pedicures last forever -no chip manis last forever (I've had at least five from them and none have chipped before I needed to have it removed because of nail growth - two weeks or so)The only thing I'm not a fan of is the $5 charge for removal of no-chip manis unless you're getting a new no-chip at the same time (regular manis don't count). This is a new policy. I understand that they should be reimbursed for the time and effort it takes though, so I'm not too upset about it. Happy mani/pedi-ing!

38.description: I come here on lunch breaks because I always know how long it is going to take for a  mani-pedi (1.5 hours) and it's affordable. I love treating myself to this place.

51.description: I love everything about this place! Nice, modern, and super clean. They offer you a decent range of refreshments right when you walk in. You get incredibly pampered from start to finish, and they will make sure that you do not have to do anything that might ruin your nails. The technicians all very warm and friendly, and they talk to you just enough to make you feel welcome, but not too much that you can't get some quiet time if you want it. Definitely going back!

27.description: I live in the neighborhood and I've been to this nail spa many times and had many different technicians do my pedicures (and a couple manicures). They always accommodate me quickly, do a stellar job and provide friendly service. One thing I love is there is no toxic smell that you find in some nail salons. On your first visit they create a little box with your name on it where they keep your personal collection of tools--very cool! The place is very clean, they have great massage chairs and they even offer free bottled water or soda. I'm very happy with their color selection, as well as their magazine collection!  My polish always lasts so long--longer than any other place I've been to--and it's always perfectly done. To top it off, they provide a nice shoulder massage while your nails are drying. I think it's a good value--you can get a cheaper mani or pedi, but it's worth a few bucks to have a great experience like I always have here. I will admit that once or twice I've felt a little rushed, but I'll give them a little leeway.

32.description: This place is great! Friendly staff, great massages, clean, and all around great service. They offer you a drink and even a back run after a pedicure or manicure. You never feel rushed but I would recommend to make an appt if you want to come during peak times like Fri afternoon.

54.description: The Hubs and I came here to get our mani/pedis that we bought via travelzoo. So, readers beware, the price does effect my review.  I love that the place is clean, the staff is nice, and that they seem to take their time with you.  I never felt like it was rushed, and I love the little extras they do.  Hot towels on your legs and hands, the extra scrubbing and lotioning during your pedi, and the 5 min massage you get after your mani is done.I'll definitely go back, though probably sooner if there is another groupon type deal!

48.description: Warning: this place is much more expensive than you think... Because you'll want to give a huge tip! Customer service is their number one priority, and man does it go a long way. They make sure you are comfortable and take care of your phone, shoes, and beverage while you're being pampered. Within 2 minutes of my arrival I was sitting in the massage chair with a refreshment and 3 magazines. They also open a new, sterilized set of nail tools for you, so you don't have to be wary of anyone else's germs. They're friendly and super helpful during the whole manicure and pedicure, and to be honest I'd return for the level of service alone! They really try to go beyond your expectations, 3 of them gathered on the floor to get me into my shoes without ruining my pedi! Superb, I really appreciate these guys and they know what they're doing. You'll leave here knowing that they deserve everyones business since they work so hard!

44.description: Love this place.  Very clean, precise, professional.  You even get a massage while your nails are drying.  Especially well-priced if you go on their Specials days.

24.description: The space is lovely, and so is the staff. My friend & I took advantage of the $39 mani/pedi special. The pedicure was great, but my manicure was kind of a joke. I had a chip the day after, and my nails were filed unevenly. My friend went with the no-chip. Luckily hers seems to be holding up as it should. The shoulder massage was a nice touch, but I don't think I'll be going back. I can do my own nails and have it last longer.

7.description: I went to this salon bc it was close to my house. I think my nails are worse off now than before I went in. The tech rushed and did a very poor job. I will not be back!!

49.description: I was looking for a place to go get a pedicure. I'm a fan! The staff is very friendly and they do a great job. I called a day before to schedule an appointment for a pedicure. They have nice  chairs to sit and relax while you get your pedicure done. Although  I don't know the name of the lady who did my service she did an great  job.

40.description: I found this spot on Yelp, and I have to say that the Yelp reviews did not disappoint! I really enjoyed this spot. Great pedicure & no-chip mani.  They really took their time.  I will be making this my regular spot.

53.description: My first visit was fabulous!  I've already been back and taken a friend!!  Pluses...the customer service is outstanding! They would not let me lift a finger.  They even put on my socks and got the door.  Its nice and relaxing in there, unlike some uber busy nail salons, here you dont feel rushed and the music is tranquil.  Its clean, they have hot towels and its a good deal.  Love the mini back massage at the end and the drying counter with the peep holes for hands and feet is cool.

30.description: I've been coming here ever since I moved to Chicago 6 months ago. They always do a great job and have reasonable prices on their no-chip gel manicure, which is a must for me. It's very clean and the staff are friendly and wonderful.

46.description: Really worth it because of the great service. They give u a quick massage while u dry and offer free beverages.

1.description: I came in to this place with a friend who recommended it. I just wanted a pedicure, not for the color, but because I have bad callous on my feet. Boy was I disappointed! To clarify, if you like a massage and a hot towel, this place is great. The polish looks great. But the actual purpose I went in with for my pedicure was not accomplished. Now my feet are just a more colorful and slightly more massaged version of their former selves. The balls of my feet are okay but my heels look awful. Sorry. Maybe my expectations were too great, but I did not leave a happy camper. Oh, and the price point was a bit high too. Oh- customer service- they were attentive when I mentioned it but the problem remained. The girl who worked on my feet was kind too. Hope that helps!

55.description: Made a quick pit stop during the holidays at this little nail salon and was shocked at the value and kindness of the place! I don't know about you, but I always feel a little out of place at nail salons with the stuffy clientele and the bitter staff, but this place was calm and relaxed. The staff was nothing short of kind and very inquisitive about the job they were doing asking "is this okay?", "how do you like the length?" etc.For $15 you can get a great manicure and a short shoulder massage. My nails are perfection without a bubble or a bit of polish left on my finger surrounding my nail. The only downside of this joint is the color selection. It's kinda bare bones so I would suggest bringing in your own color especially if you are interested in nudes or grays. High fives on the incredible service.

9.description: The place was nice and clean, and minimal wait on a late lunch break without an appointment.  Color selection was great, and in fact I am in LOVE with the OPI color I got today.  However, $30 for a pedicure seems really high.  I've never paid more than $23 with better service.  It's good and convenient if you work in the West Loop but the price will have me looking for another spot.

26.description: this place had such reviews, but i'm not so sure about it.got a spa mani pedi - the mani was great. well done, lasted a while. the pedi wasn't that great. they didn't file away my calluses, and i still have to pumice my feet when i got home. the mud mask was really nice though.prob good mon-wed when they have their $39 deal. if my feet need more tlc, i will be going elsewhere

25.description: This is a reliable neighborhood nail spot that I frequent when I need a manicure after work. Its a little more than I pay in Lincoln Park, but only by a couple dollars.  All of the ladies give a great manicure that lasts. They have all the new, best colors, and they give you a little back rub at the end. I'm always happy with their work and will continue to give them my business!

12.description: BRING CASH FOR TIPS!I got a manicure here during lunch. Really nice! It's was $15 for the manicure but it comes with a hand massage and a shoulder massage while your nails are drying. Even though it was noon on a Friday I didn't have to wait at all to have my manicure, and I just walked in. They have about 100 OPI & Essie colors to pick from, I got a red Essie color in the spirit of the holiday. The only thing I feel bad about is that I couldn't put a tip on my credit card. :(Otherwise I will definitely be going here again for my lunchtime manicure/pedicure needs.

59.description: Great new salon - clean and calming environment, contemporary decor, friendly staff, complimentary coffee/water/etc...and a neck massage following your mani - does it get any better than this?! Easier to get in M-W.

21.description: Friendly, was originally the only nail place close by... But the worst gel manicure I've ever had it was so thick and fell off in 2 days. The manicure is ok- do not cute cuticles. New place opened so I won't be going back

17.description: There's nothing super special about this nail salon, but it's a good option in this fairly limited neighborhood. Pros: The prices are decent, the salon is clean, and the staff is friendly.  This is the biggest plus as they are WAY nicer here than the staff over at Pinky Nails on Des Plaines by Jewel.Cons: My pedi took a really long time and I am not sure the guy knew what he was doing.  The polish went on so thick that it started to smudge and peel off much more quickly than a salon pedi usually does.  Also, bring your cash-- they do NOT want you to pay with a credit card here.

10.description: Decent and conveniently located to downtown/ west loop area. I don't know if my technician was having a bad day, but she rushed me out pretty quickly and didn't pay a ton of attention to cleaning up my nails. She rushed through the paint job and my nails started to bubble up and chipped pretty quickly. The place seems clean though, and it might have just been that one experience.

5.description: I gotta say came here weekend of July 4th and back 3 weeks later worst service had to complain and make them redo my nails today both times was supposed to get neck and shoulder massage w pedicure did not receive any the tech seemed pissed off as stated by another review. Time to look for new nail salon its a shame.

3.description: I typically find this salon to be above average, but today I was very disappointed. I had a no-chip mani last Thursday and by Monday I already had 2 significantly chipped nails, today it was up to 4. For the record, I have never had a no-chip last less than two weeks. That's why I pay $40 for the service. If I wanted one week nails, I would've paid half the price for a regular manicure. When I came in this afternoon, I was immediately greeted and promised repair. What I didn't expect was a rough buff job, and several coats of paint applied over the top of my existing no-chip on every nail. I've been out of the salon for 15 minutes and one of the "repaired" nails is already lifting on one side and ALL of my nails are two-toned. They might've kept my business if they had simply redone the chipped nails. Never again.

35.description: I came in here as a walk in on a Saturday afternoon after being turned away from other places for not having an appointment. Very nice technicians and good service. Prices were reasonable too and I got a nice little shoulder rub after my pedi! Bonus!! I'd definitely go back here.

19.description: I love this place so much that it pains me to bring them down to 4 stars. I still think it is hands down the best nail spot in the area. Everyone is so nice and it has a warm atmosphere. They autoclave the tools and you can have a personal box for a nail file, buffer, etc. I never feel like they are just trying to get me out of there as quickly as possible. That being said, there has been multiple times that I have been with someone super slow or have walked out of there with crookedly filed nails. I've also had a few issues where they didn't record my appointment or I haven't made an appointment and the 10 minute wait ends up being over 30 minutes. They also have started using these "weapons of torture" for the shoulder massage at the end. I think the key to success at this place is to always make an appointment, find someone you like, and avoid the shoulder massage!

28.description: There's nothing super special about this nail salon, but it's a good option in this fairly limited neighborhood. Pros: The prices are decent, the salon is clean, and the staff is friendly.  This is the biggest plus as they are WAY nicer here than the staff over at Pinky Nails on Des Plaines by Jewel.Cons: My pedi took a really long time and I am not sure the guy knew what he was doing.  The polish went on so thick that it started to smudge and peel off much more quickly than a salon pedi usually does.  Also, bring your cash-- they do NOT want you to pay with a credit card here.

45.description: As yelp says "woohoo! As good as it gets!" I have been to a lot of nail places since I moved to Chicago a few months ago and this place by far beats out the competition.  It is extremely clean, the staff is seriously SO nice (a major bonus compared to other downtown nail salons), and the work is METICULOUS.  They spend time massaging your legs, arms, hands during the pedicure and manicure and then they give you a quick shoulder massage while your nails are drying.  This is definitely my new regular spot.  They also have a great deal, mani & pedi for $39 Mon - Wed.  Lunchtime pampering, here I come! Someone mentioned a lack of nail color choices in a past review ... that must be pretty old because they had a huge selection including new collections from both OPI and Essie.

33.description: Standard run of the mill Chicago nail salon. The cleanliness and new space is the only thing that distinguishes this salon from others. This will not be my go to spot since the technician did not file my nails evenly.

43.description: My new favorite place! Shortly after moving to Chicago, I wandered into this little shop. What the previous reviews have said is true: it's very clean, the staff is friendly and nice, the attention to detail is flawless, and the price is right. I had one manicure with Jin and was extremely pleased. I went back to see her when I decided to get rid of the acrylic nails I'd worn for several years. Jin took extraordinary care in this process. She is gentle, thorough, and meticulous. The shoulder and neck massage at the end of the manicure/pedicure is such a bonus! This is no ordinary nail salon -- it's a mini spa.

2.description: Joe is the person to go for! The salon was quiet and almost empty when I entered around 4:30pm on a Tuesday. But people started pouring in soon. I got a manicure and pedicure for $39 deal. The salon is clean with a huge range of colors and Joe was very attentive. The massage and hot towels and the whole experience was very good. I am definitely going here again.

18.description: I live in the neighborhood and I've been to this nail spa many times and had many different technicians do my pedicures (and a couple manicures). They always accommodate me quickly, do a stellar job and provide friendly service. One thing I love is there is no toxic smell that you find in some nail salons. On your first visit they create a little box with your name on it where they keep your personal collection of tools--very cool! The place is very clean, they have great massage chairs and they even offer free bottled water or soda. I'm very happy with their color selection, as well as their magazine collection!  My polish always lasts so long--longer than any other place I've been to--and it's always perfectly done. To top it off, they provide a nice shoulder massage while your nails are drying. I think it's a good value--you can get a cheaper mani or pedi, but it's worth a few bucks to have a great experience like I always have here. I will admit that once or twice I've felt a little rushed, but I'll give them a little leeway.

41.description: I'm a visitor to Chicago, and needed to find a good local nail salon.  I found this place on Yelp, it had good reviews so I went.  It's the first time I have used Yelp to find something while in another city, and I'm so glad I did!!  They did an excellent job on my nails and the massage was great too!!

52.description: This is my go-to nail salon, and not just because it's convenient for where I live!  The service is excellent, the staff has always been kind and not extremently busy- I always just walk in and only twice in the two years I've been going there have they not been able to take me (and I go about twice per month!).They offer free drinks (bottled water, cans of pop, keurig coffee/tea) and just like the other reviewers mentioned, a quick 3-5 minute massage at the end of your visit! I think they are pretty competitively priced...manice is $15, although for $10 you can get a "polish change"  which includes just about everything except for the cuticles (filing, hot towel, hand massage). You also still get the back massage!Very relaxing atmosphere- music ranges from quiet classical to contemporary but never loud or irritating. I always feel great walking out!
