50.description: The staff was very welcoming and accommodating. If I still lived here, I would make this my nail place. It was very peaceful and they made sure we were always comfortable. Ask for Brian, he's the best.

4.description: This place is...fine. Some of their nail techs are great. Some are terrible. In the span of 2 weeks I've had one of the best manicures of my life here and today, one of the worst. Unfortunately after the messy, sloppy, painful hack job I just received, I won't be returning. I'd rather get my weekly manicure at a more consistent establishment

6.description: Went in for a quick pedicure. The staff was courteous and obliging to take me in almost closing hours. Only negative effect is I paid 75$ without tip for a pedi and mani. And was supposed to be a no-chip manicure. Apart from the selected limited shades for no chip, mine chipped literally the next day! So frustrating!

22.description: I found this place here on Yelp and needed to find somewhere close to work so I could pop in for a quick no-chip manicure on my lunch break as my regular salon I visit was already booked. This place was GREAT! HUGE facility, super clean, and tons of room which is so nice to not be sitting right next to someone when you are getting your nails done. It is nice and quiet and the technician was EXTREMELY meticulous, working on each nail very carefully. I love the color I got, but am not too much a fan of how short my nails were filed down. The shape is a little off as well, but other than that, a great manicure. Somewhat pricier than what I'm used to, but you get your hands wrapped in a hot towel and you also get a massage at the end. I'm definitely glad I found this place and will probably come back to supplement when my usual salon is booked.

15.description: Went her on a Saturday and the place was empty, which for me was a huge plus because it was calm and quiet, and I was able to be seen right away. Because they are located in West Loop, I'm guessing the weekdays are jam packed especially during the lunch hour and after 5pm.  The place is very clean and has great chairs for pedicures.  Another plus is that you can reserve your own box for your own file and callus buffer free of charge. At the end, they also give a quick shoulder massage which was a nice touch. One downside was that the cuticle clean up wasn't the best. The overall experience was good though and I will be going back.

57.description: I bought a voucher for a mani/pedi through travelzoo and made an appt when I needed it... and I really wanted to like this place.  I walked in, and the whole staff was smiling and really  nice.  I picked a color I loved.. and my girl pretty much zipped through the pedi - and didn't fully clean my toenails.  Unfortunately, the NEXT day, 3 of my fingernails CHIPPED!  I was bummed considering I had taken time off of work to get my nails done.  If my nails hadn't chipped the next day, I would have gone back for the warm atmosphere.. but I will definately not be back.

20.description: Great, local spot. My manicures always last from this place. Plus, free water and pop and a good back massage.

36.description: I wanted to love this place, but it fell short a bit. The staff seemed to work meticulously, but when I got home I noticed that they didn't polish evenly (there were streaks on my finger nails) and there are small bumps like maybe nail file shavings that were painted over on my toes. The staff was kind and I felt pampered but I wish I was happier with the results. I will probably try it again because people seem to love it there, maybe I just had a bad technician.

14.description: I'll start with the positive.  Upon walking into the salon, you'll notice how up to date and clean everything is, it's refreshing.  Everyone greets you which is also nice.  Once you sit down, a toasty neck warmer is placed around your shoulders (in the winter months) and the nail tech gets to work.  They do a fantastic job cleaning, filing, and trimming.  They take their time when polishing your nails (i've only had the no chip).  The hand massage is wonderful and so is the complimentary neck massage.  Everyone is extremely friendly and appears to go out of their way to make you feel comfortable while visiting their salon.Now, onto the negative points which, unfortunately, are biggies.  I've been there 3 times in the last month all because the "no chip" starts chipping in under a week.  I had a few nails of polish come off in one easy snag.  It is completely unacceptable for a no chip manicure to be chipping within a few days and on multiple occassions.  I'm not sure what they're doing differently here but I've been to other salons and my manicure has lasted almost a full two weeks.  Further, their color selection is a bit weak and dated.It makes me sad because I really like the cleanliness of the facility and how friendly everyone is here but I cannot keep going back.  Their no chip manicures chip badly and within 3-5 days after the manicure.  Honestly, I would have given them one star but everyone is so nice, I felt bad only rating them with one. I will say that they were very friendly when I returned to have them fix the manicure.  The first time it peeled, I went back and paid for a new one without mentioning how badly it chipped and how quickly as it could have been bad bulbs or polish.  The second time, however, was when I made the phone call and alerted them of the issue.  They were very accomodating and happy to fix my nails.  I went on Monday, December 23, and my thumb had a chip on it yesterday.  Wah-wah.

1.description: The young lady at the counter was so sweet and had such a lovely smile. Service is great! Steak tacos were recommended by an associate and so...of course, I ordered them! They were a slight different from the norm in taste...but in a good way! Tacos were filled to the tilt!

2.description: Love this place! Food is always made fresh to order and they give u a lot. Also they have a lot of items to choose from so if u and your mate can't agree then this is the spot!

0.description: First time ordering from Papa's. My gyro was delicious. Cheese sticks, fish sandwich, onion rings, and bacon burgers were amazing.  Best of all - the chicken tenders. Best ever.  Delivery service was super fast. The prices are excellent.  I will be back. This is definitely my new favorite go-to for delivery and takeout.

3.description: If you're craving delicious seafood, but you don't have time to prepare it yourself and you don't want to spend too much money; Fisherman's Island is definitely the place you'd want to try. There hasn't been one time that I've been disappointed with the service nor the food. This is for sure a staple for seafood on the South side of Chicago.  Try them and you will see.

1.description: Honestly, it is extremely addictive. The area may not be the best but the staff is nice and I have never waited on my food for more than 15 minutes. The food is nicely seasoned. It was nice to find a place where it was closer to my home and to also find seafood in an area where most things are fried, it was nice to eat fresh seafood. I will be a continuous consumer.Updated on 2/29/2016: still love this place but I am taking a star away for parking, how on Sundays it says that they open at 11am but don't open the doors until noon (don't know how it is on other days) and one time when I ordered a snow crab platter they gave me all claws. Sometimes the food can come overly seasoned. But the good outweigh the bad.

2.description: Today is my first time trying THIS particular spot, we have a few of these kinda places here in Chicago. I had the pan with the crab leg cluster, shrimp, broccoli, red potatoes and ear of corn. Everything in the pan was a bit too salty for my liking but it was tolerable. The shrimp n broccoli were overcooked (rubbery shrimp n mushy broccoli). The potatoes, crab legs n corn were ok tho. The thing that grind my gears about this experience was the grit. Anyone who's had scallops that weren't throughly cleaned knows exactly what I'm talking about. It's REALLY hard to enjoy food when the chew isn't smooth. The only thing I can think of that being is uncleaned seafood. I have a twisted frown face as I post this. Will I return? I think not!!!

5.description: Every time I visit Fisherman's Island I'm always impressed with fast service and delicious food . I've tried just about everything and I can truthfully say it's probably the best Seafood with Cajun flavors on the Southside. The only reason it gets 4 Stars is because it's connected to a Gas Station! LBVS

6.description: The customer service is terrible!!!!!! The food is decent but I would love to rate them higher but they are just so rude I can't deal I prob won't come back here I love to support local businesses but I can't support this place.

7.description: Went today and not only was the service prompt (less than 10 min wait) the food was delicious!!! Best Seafood on the South Side!!!!

0.description: This was my first visit but it certainly will not be my last! The food was delicious, I can't wait to try everything on the menu! 4 stars because of the parking.

4.description: I placed my order yesterday at 6:00 pm and was there about 6:30pm they told me 15 minutes my order was ready! I really enjoyed every bite me and my son OMG o will be ordering on Fridays I'm in love

3.description: I have lived in the neighborhood for years. I have watch this store transform into a fantastic place to find all types of spirits. The atmosphere is enticing.  The owner is on hand to help you satisfy your taste. There are always sweet deals. Love to attend the tastings. Its like a night out on the town.  You must visit..

1.description: My experience exceeded all expectations!!! From the wine tasting, to the mixing class, all the way to the counter of friendly staff... everything was exceptional. The shelves were fully stocked, I was introduced to new liquors I had never tried, shown how to properly hold a wine glass and even educated on the origins of cognac. Wow! All while talking, laughing, nibbling and sipping... I loved it. The owner was very hands-on and the staff was wonderful. See you guys next week...

2.description: A great place to support in the Chatham community.This place gives you a beverage experience. The owner is phenomenal with tons of knowledge and expertise. If you are looking for wine, beer or alcohol and your not quite sure about which to choose this is the place to gain a little knowledge, while possibly tasting a little something new. Explore your taste buds and your community.

5.description: First of all this is not a liquor store its a liquor boutique very high class, wine tasting, beautiful cashier and give aways if you don't no now you do head over to A & S and get great service. Eddie is a master at teaching about wine ask for him if you have any questions.

6.description: I have always been a fan of Kenwood Liquor but A & S, was a nice surprise. They help you with wine selections and even give you a wine tasting.  It's clean, organized and really cool. Its in the "Hood" but its NOT dangerous at all.  They didn't have no Plexiglass for the exchange, it was open and relaxed. I will be back!

0.description: I can't believe I hadn't been to this place before now. I was looking for a specific wine that isn't widely distributed. While going to the brand of wine's website for locations near me, A & S was listed. I called to make sure they had the wine in stock, and they said they did. So I took a trip with my husband to pick it up, and found out that this place sells A LOT of rare finds. Not only that, the owner is very personable and took the time to get to know us and our taste. We found more wine to try and are thrilled that we know a little more about how wine is made. Hidden gem for sure. Definitely will return.

4.description: Well what can I say? They have EVERYTHING you want! This is not your average liquor store they are a liquor boutique, nowhere in this neighborhood will you find this selection of wine and spirits, being a conseuer of wine, I can find everything for every palette! Not just moscato!!! Which is for novice wine drinkers, Come to A&S liquor Boutique and be amazed by the selection and the price!

0.description: I find Locs by Kerry to be on-time, give great customer service, and knowledge about Locs. I just wish I could pick them up and move them on the Northside, but I make the trip everytime. I would recommend them to anyone who wants quality service.

3.description: I don't have anything Good to say unfortunately. Placed an order online because of the jerk chicken salad pictured here on yelp. Requested ALL white meat on salad in the instructions box and received literally ALL scraps tossed about with bones (salad was not eaten). Perhaps this occurred because of the late evening order. Very disappointed, but I'll wish them well.

1.description: I would have given 5 whole stars but i went for salmon salad and they didn't have it, was told to try back later. I ended up trying the jerk chicken salad and OMG...it was delicious...fresh ingredients right amount of avocado and onions, tomatoes yum...i did add my own cucumbers when i got home. I will come back for the salmon salad: overall very good flavor and good heat. The lady at the counter was nice very strong accent...she wasn't happy when i took pics of menu board though lol she said no need to take pics I'm giving you a menu haha

2.description: Ok the food is pretty good I must admit! Especially for the price. $10 for a large jerk dinner is a pretty good deal.. My only problem is that my food took 2 hours to arrive and wasn't hot, the cabbage was actually very cold! The Mac & cheese looked like they tried to doctor up some box Kraft Mac & cheese, it didn't look homemade. I usually only buy jerk dinners from Jerk Villa on 79th but they don't deliver and I wasn't getting out of bed so I tried this place. In would probably order again on another desperate night.

5.description: This was definitely a DO NOT REPEAT experience.  The food took two hours.  The woman that answered the telephone stated that Grubhub sent the fax late (even though they  confirmed on time).  After being late, the food was cold but not just that the plantains had been sitting in someones fridge for an unknown amount of time.  They were little plantain shaped bricks.  The callalloo was missing.  The pink ting was regular ting.  To top it off the food had been thrown in the bag so that all of it was situated in the side dish portions of the container mashed together as if someone had been playing softball with it.  Sloppy juice all over everything including the sodas and bread. To add insult to injury the food was not even good enough to classify as a joke.  Steamed cabbage?  The only seasoning there - water.  Beans and rice?  Incredible amount of sugar and again seasoning- water, maybe a bit of salt.  None of those wonderful herbs you see in Caribbean foods at the other restaurants, just plain bland.  The shrimp I ordered?  Thought I was getting jerk but it turns out I was getting jerky; another item that had been way overcooked and stored in a fridge somewhere.  Then someone had the sweet and sour sauce from a low end Chinese place and dumped it on.  This place was a super hot mess.  I hate throwing food away but I tried to give one of the plantains to my dog and he chewed it like a chew toy.  Did I mention the drivers attitude?  No? Well I think you can guess.

0.description: I purchased a Groupon because it was close to home and I'd never tried this spot. The first time I came here, they didn't have the jerk wrap available, which was one of the items posted on the window as a specialty. I also peeked over at someone's jerk tacos and they most certainly are tiny... Not at all like a "Jerk Taco Man" type of taco.. They also didn't have plantains that day. I left that day without purchasing anything. I came back about a month later and they seemed to be more prepared. As a test I asked if they had the jerk wrap and she said yes. I ended up ordering a 1/4 white. The chicken was good but I didn't like the sides. Cabbage was too liquidy and Mac and cheese was dry. Yams were good though. I have another Groupon to use so I guess I'll be trying it again.

4.description: I've been here two times and I'm not impressed by each time I visited . The last time i went I purchased the Jerk Tacos and they were not good at all . Firstly they were very small, cold , there was little to no chicken and there was more Jerk sauce than chicken. When I came the first time the food was better but not great.There is nothing spectacular about this place there are better jerk spots in the area.

12.description: Customer Service Is Everything & You Won't Find That Here.!!! How Could They Get Mad Because THEY Didn't Have Jerk Sauce.?? How Could You Not Tell The Customer That You Don't Have Sauce BEFORE I Ordered? I Will NOT Order From Here Again They Are Too Damn RUDE. Got home to eat the food & it was just OK.. Cabbage was plain as idk what, rice & beans tasted like Zataran's (from the box) smh & my lobster tail was tough .... Not a good visit for me.

7.description: I'm addicted to this place!!! The food is amazing!!! Best to phone your order in or be prepared to wait 30+ minutes.

3.description: I tried the jerk lobster tail, it was pretty tasty, if you like lobster you should try it. Because it is jerked it is a little savory and spicy, so you will need water, it is not too hot but definitely more savory. The place is really small so don't miss it.

1.description: Got 1/2 chicken(white )with shrimp ,and tilapia . ALL of the selections were good but spicy without the sauce.. (I like it like that) but others may not. The sides were average I had cabbage ,beans and rice and she had Mac n cheese and cabbage . The only gripe I had was the food wasn't as hot as it should have been temperature wise like it had been microwaved .

2.description: Polite, good portion sizes, sides are very good, just not the best sauce.

9.description: The food is good but customer service was really lacking . That's half the battle of any successful business .. And I really want to see my black owned businesses do better!

10.description: I should have left when i walked in and there were no Jamaicans!!! I dout these people have ever even visited an island! The food was dry, cold, and in now way jerk. The cashier had newports on top of the register and on the counter  behind her there was everything from coffee to cleaning products! The absolute WORST; they should have closed before they ever opened. New and hot??? New and nooooooooot!

13.description: This place is a true GEM in the "hood"!!!! The lobster was fantastic and the jumbo shrimp are actually prongs!!! Now where are you going to get lobster tails and prongs in the hood...for $25.0???!!!! We HAVE to support this place!!! I'm STUFFED!!!

16.description: Well I had to try this place after seeing a lot of people on social media saying it was the better than jerk villa. I knew it was too good to be true. First off I went on a day where the temperature was in the low teens. It was absolutely no heat in the waiting/ordering area. Ok cool I guess I could deal with that as long as I get good jerk food. I paid close to 15 dollars for a 1/4 chicken with two sides. The chicken was super dry with barely any jerk seasoning on it and the sides were lackluster as well. The service is what u would expect on 71st street non existent. Sorry jerk city but u will never see another dollar from me, I'll go to where real Jamaicans are cooking jerk.

17.description: Just simply the worst jerk food I have ever tried. The food was extremely dry and very high. The portions was tiny and not worth the 15 dollars I spent there. Wanted to support and I did. Tried to call by no suprise no answer. Well I rate this place a negative 0 and it doesn't touch jerk villa or and other jerk restaurant ever. Well a new jerk place will open soon so this has to be better. The few that rated this place good have to be friends there's no other way sorry.

15.description: Went here yesterday after seeing a certain barber always posts about how bomb the food is and I was highly disappointed. We got there as soon as they opened and though there is a notice on the window that food is cooked to order it took 50 minutes for two jerk chicken dinners. You would think that this food would have been the best jerk in the world. No it was not though the chicken was tender I was extremely disappointed that the red beans and rice came out of the zatarans box . The Mac and cheese was alright . The best thing about the food was the jerk sauce for the chicken. With that being sad try it at your own risk and please don't go on your lunch break because you will probably lose your job waiting for that expensive mediocre food !

0.description: I tried the jerk chicken salad. It wasn't bad but not GREAT either! The chicken was over cooked and mushy in texture and i had to add my own onions and cucumber...it did have a good kick though, i would try something else. Service: the lady taking orders has a terrible attitude very condescending in nature! Overall see for yourself

5.description: Amazing place for Caribbean food. Positive owners and the lobster is awesome. The chicken is quality and they have 2 different sauces. Both are great!  Definitely a regular customer

11.description: Spent close to $15 and received the driest chicken I ever received in my life. I will not be back anytime soon.

8.description: Tried this place last weekend for the 1st...AMAZINGLY good food! I'm actually craving it again a week later. I would've gave it this restaurant 5 stars only if it didnt take an hour to get my food. But don't let that turn you away! IT IS WELL WORTH THE WAIT! It actually made the food much better. I had jerk chicken with macaroni and cabbage! It was so good!

4.description: Best jerk in the city!!! Went there with a couple friends and left out super satisfied.

14.description: Love, love, love the chicken, tried the cabbage for the first time and got really sick (won't try that again) but the Mac and cheese is good

6.description: I tried this place for the first time. It was horrible, they didn't have any dark meat, lobster, shrimp, or jerk sauce. The wait was 30 plus minutes. Food taste like it was frozen not fresh, the 4 chicken wings were so small a toddler wouldn't get full. Very disappointed. Our black businesses must do better !

3.description: I think this Walgreens besides being open 24hrs, it has great helpful staff that really want to and enjoy helping their customers. I think this store has what you need when it's late a you may forget things during the day, that you can get here whenever you need them. This is a life saving location and hours or service store.

1.description: The pharmacy is the slowest in Chicago I wouldn't recommend anyone to drop off or call in there prescription here,it's never ready on time.  I wouldn't be surprise if this WALGREENS got shut down!!!

2.description: I live near this Walgreens and it's really convenient to stop here on my way to work because it's right by the expressway. HOWEVER, every single time I have come here to buy fruit, it has been just about inedible. I'm a very optimistic person and every time I went, I'd hope that THIS time, it would be different. You can even look at the fruit and tell it's old. It's not fresh at all. I'm stupid. I bought it anyway, only to open it and smell that 'day old fruit' smell. It's disgusting and totally unacceptable and I won't buy fruit from there anymore. What a shame. I even complained on the site and had the store manager promise me that it wouldn't happen again. I went back and of course, nothing has changed. It's every day all day. I guess I'm the only person who wants to buy fresh fruit at Walgreens.

5.description: Great service... Professional staff and management

0.description: This store always have what I'm looking for. Cold Medicine,items on sale and my butter cookies. The staff is very helpful. And by the store having nice people in the pharmacy that is always a big plus. If we are in the store looking for cold Medicine at 11pm at night  :-( And still have to go to work in the morning. Please be nice to us in the pharmacy department. Great Service today..Will be backThx Walgreens

4.description: The store has undergone some major renovation which is actually helping to improve the quality of the appearance of the store.The only problem is that they really need to up the standards of the security making sure there are no solicitors congregating outside the store and folks trying to sell you stuff. The appearance of the store looks nicer than it did before the renovation.

3.description: This location sells much more than candy, but I guess that's what it's known for best.Large boxes of gyros meat, large bags of French fries, large boxes of pizza puffs, large containers of ice cream, large boxes containing individual juices, large boxes containing individual candy bars, large boxes containing famous treats such as Twinkies, wow, this place has it all when it comes to wanting to stock up on food.Want to know what makes this place even better? It also sells plastic dishware such as cups, plates, and spoons. It also sells plastic wrap and aluminum foil, and everything I listed in this paragraph comes in large quantities at great prices.Some items that I bought, I use to sell to the students at the nearby Stagg School at 74th and Morgan. The prices that this store offers on its products allows many to sell the enclosed treasures at their own desired prices.To pay for the items you want, you can use only cash, and food stamp cards. They do not accept checks here (thank God), and they will not accept debit cards unless you're purchasing a minimum of $20 in merchandise. They do not accept credit cards the last time I heard.One thing to keep in mind, there are other wholesale food stores just stone's throws from L&P on State Street, but none are as great as L&P! I have yet to find a wholesale store open to the public here on the west side that is as great as L&P, but I haven't been looking. Sorry.

1.description: They don't deserve a star at all. The customer service sucks. Just left out of their and was purchasing some things for my disable sister. I got to the counter and needed a box of pizza puffs so I asked my niece to come from the car n get what kind she liked. The top notch security guard asked her what was her age. She said 16 so he said she got to stand up front. I don't have a problem with their rules but it was 3 guys standing there and Im like she can't go get it. Do you think they even sent someone to get it. Needless to say I said something upon getting my receipt checked out and he told me see you tomorrow. I told him no you won't then he said next month, then next year. They done got to big headed they think people have to support their business. Im done with L&P

2.description: They have a ton of candy at great prices. Helpful staff!

0.description: This store takes the expression "like a kid in a candy store" to a whole different dimension. I felt like I was in a time loop of my child and adolescent life. All of my favorite candy under one roof with ginormous pickles, steaks and party supplies galore. I can't believe I've never been her before especially since I grew up here. If you have a sweet tooth or want to reminisce about the days when candy was candy this is the place to come! My aunt suggested we go because she wanted taffy apples (not to be confused with candy apples). Since my wife hadn't ever had a taffy apple we agreed to go. This was the best decision we've made all day. Left with tons of stuff and the kid got to eat some goodies while we wheeled him around the joint. This store triggered conversations about childhood from almost everyone who was in the store. Not a bad place to go as an adult if you're feeling nostalgic!

1.description: Kingfish is a very average fried seafood place. The seafood is fresh. The shrimp are decent (large and very sweet), but the catfish was too greasy for me. Their chicken wings are pretty decent, but I'm not a fan of the fries at all (good french fries are becoming a lost art). Service is pretty fast, so that's convenient, but it's inconsistent overall.

0.description: I've been coming here for years. The catfish tenders always impress. I tried the fried shrimp for the first time recently after one of the "best" fried shrimp places was closed due to the Super Bowl. By far, King Fish has the BEST fried shrimp I ever had. I called it in and the cook was breading them in front of me. Can't beat that.

If you would have asked me a few months heck a week ago I would tell  you that I love this place although it's not the cleanest and they have raised their prices.I ordered a wings and gizzard dinner and the gizzard tasted spoiled so I walked back up to the restaurant thinking I would just get something else....well that didn't happen...in fact what did soured my taste for this place.The young lady and gentlemen told me they had just dropped the gizzards and I proceeded to tell them I don't doubt that they did my gizzards didn't taste fresh that it tasted spoiled.  They continued to tell me that they just dropped the gizzard when I placed the order...I said to them again that is probably true but do you know what spoil is...its rancid it isn't good.What didn't like I have been coming to this location for almost two years and this is the first time I had ever had a complaint about their food...they know me when they see me...we have laughed and chatted but this visit was so unexpected.  I mean they didn't apologize they just kept trying to say what they did and then when my tone changed they just handed me my money...I left WOW If a person has come to establishment for years and you know them when you see them...if they have a complaint....why not listen to them...why lose a customer over $5.50 I still don't get it...but I digress!Will I go back doubtful...Will I miss this greasy spoon...Sure I will but customer service is more important to me and the truth is there are not good for you greasy spoons all over this city.Enjoy!

I thought I wrote a review for this location months ago, especially since I took the photos...lol but when I checked in to do an update I realized...Nope I never did...so today is the day I talk about my feelings on this particular location!The floor plan in all Aldi's are different but they are pretty much the same anywhere you go as far as products go inside the store.  I didn't like that this location didn't sell Wine...No Wine...Mannnnnnnnnnnn that was disappointing but that doesn't make me stop shopping at this location.  Today made me want to write a review because of the manager that was on duty today who truly did help me with unfortunate miscommunication between me and the cashier....don't worry there was no blows thrown or yelling...lol  I was still in a happy place but still peeved that she didn't remember what I said I needed to do when I was checking out my food and other items...It's none of your business to know what I got...lol!!!Anyway!!!When I first informed her of her mistake she acted as if she would take care of the problem so I told her the person behind me could check out and I would wait...I had a little time so no problem.Okayyyyyyyyyyyyyy!!!  Problem when she started to take the next customer and acted as if I wasn't standing there after she halfway but didn't truly fool me that she forgot I was I was standing there...okay give me a moment while I give you my point.She said she couldn't help me but I spotted the Manager...without being very rude because I saw him on the phone...I said very nicely..."You are the manager right?"  he responded "Yes!" I said "Good because she needs your help and so do I!!!"  He smiled and said "Okay!"It didn't take him long to come over after he got off the phone and swear I was still smiling because I wasn't angry just a little peeved because the young lady didn't want to take the extra step to fix the issue, but what I have learned you go to the top if you want an issued solved these days!!!Anyway!!!!At first he didn't understand what the problem was but once he did...He took care of the issue and got the problem solved...All I kept thinking was thanking for listening and helping me!!!I thought I was going to have to get back in line to get my items that had to be returned, but the manager laughed and said after all this you think that I would make you get back in line..."WOW!!!"  that was my thought...I mean it was the right thing to do but I didn't think it would be done...IJS(I'm just saying)...but I'm glad he even let another customer know that I will be with you as soon as I finished with this young lady...okay yes I liked that he called me "Young"  lol but more than that he didn't seem upset and he let me know that he was going to get the problem fixed and that he did...thank you!!!He made me a fan today and I will definitely come back for the customer service that I received even though I was there for more than I wanted...the manager did what he had to do until the problem was taken care of...that in my mind is an A+++If you are in the neighborhood and you see this Aldi's I say what I always do....Enjoy!!! P.S. they don't take credit card but they do take debit cards...come on Aldi's get with the times!!!

1.description: Really Nice fried chicken! better than others! and the fries were pretty good too. Biscuit was okay!

0.description: YUM! I stopped here while visiting a friend on the south side. Great food!

12.description: This place is great!  I stopped in to get all the fixins for a fish boil and the friendly staff hooked me up with great tips.  I wasn't anticipating adding crawfish and scallops but they were a great suggestion, and the price was so good I couldn't say no!  They had everything I wanted and the quality was great!    Its so refreshing to know all I have to do is head down to the southside to visit an authentic fish market with great food and awesome prices!

7.description: This is one of the top places to come get your fresh seafood and chicken that you want cook.  They are always super busy and I understand why.

3.description: I went here to buy some crabs, and I was totally disappointed,  they were the worst crabs I've ever bought in my life. I've not been there again. I tried on 2 separate occasion to get some crabs,  they were so skinny and empty. Me being from Florida, I am kind of a connoisseur when it comes to crabs, I look for the male, because they're always alot meatier. I know I would never go there again, to each it's own. They do have an array of fish, but that's not what I wanted.  I'll go ahead and make that commute uptown, at least I know that I wight what I want. Thanks.

1.description: Great fish market! I have been getting fish from Haim for years, and never have been disappointed! Love the fresh Salmon!

2.description: The livest fish market ever when your number is called you better be on point and be ready to order because if you don't you will have missed the mark but they will get you served.

9.description: Truly the Louisiana Headquarters of Chicago. I've been coming here for the past 8 months for fresh shrimp & crab. They're prices are fair. I go when they have deals.  This place is always packed! And this is the only place I can find HAND made spicy andouille sausage with real meat casing for my gumbo. The crawfish are always good too. I haven't actually purchased any of the fish I plan to try it in the future. I will adjust my review accordingly. I've recommended them to several people.They have alligator, turtle, lobster, and soooo many different types of fish.

10.description: Great place to go for any kind of fresh  fish...

13.description: Disgusting and dirty. My 3 year old vomited when we came in here. Save yourself the stinky trouble and go to Isaacson and Stein Fish Market on Fulton Market in the West Loop.

16.description: The service at market fisheries was greattt i went in thier looking for salmon fillets they really helped me out also great customer service.....sure will come back......the service guy behind the counter gave us his full attention....really recommended.....then best sea food place in chicago.

17.description: I have been looking for quite some time for a place in Chicago where I could buy turtle and alligator meat without being taken to the cleaners. I picked up the Yellow Pages, looked under Seafood-Wholesale and just started calling. After about 12 stores told me about ordering in 10 or 15 pound increments and $20 - $25 bucks a pound, I came to the number for Market Fisheries. I called, spoke to a nice young lady who told me they had turtle and alligator meat and at great prices. $9 per pound for turtle and $8 per pound for gator. I bought some and plan on cooking them for a Mardi Gras party my wife and I are having next week. I am giving this place 4 stars for the variety of fresh seafood and the prices. It is truly a "hole in the wall" kind of place. No frills, just great selection, great prices and knowledgable help. They also have frog legs, whole boiled crawfish, crawfist tail meat, crab legs, crab claws, whole crabs, lobster and all kinds of fresh fish. They will also clean the fish that you buy. To top it off, it is right next door to a nice little produce shop with excellent prices. Great place. Will add it to my list of  "spots".

15.description: Don't expect much.  I was looking for Alligator Meat, and found it, pre-package, flash frozen..... It was good.  The problem is with service.  Went around noon on a saturaday, no crowd. Behind the counter on one side, three guys are speaking Spanish among themselves and the other side is speaking some form of inter-city-english, and yet totally ignoring me and another customer....... As I observed.... a native walks into the store, jumped right into the conversation going on behind the counter and received service.   So now I know, you gotta speak the language, and the language is not English.   YUCK!

0.description: A great fish market on the south side of the city! The owner Haim shows great concern that the customers are pleased with their total shopping experience.  It is greatly appreciated. Thanks!

5.description: I've been coming to Market Fisheries since I was a little girl. The 3rd generation in my family to shop here...Purchasing seafood/fish here for so many years has been a tradition for both sides of my family. So many memories.. My aunt lives in Minneapolis and part of her visits to Chicago for the past couple decades include stopping at the Market to purchase fish to fry for family gatherings while in Chicago and then buying fish to take back home to Minneapolis. Try it for yourself. this is a business that has been family operated for 60 years.

11.description: These guys are great!  A gentleman named Curtis was a big help to me when I needed turtle meat for a cooking article I write for the examiner.com  It's harder to find Turtle Meat in Chicago than it is in New Orleans!  I was blown away by the selection and quantity of fresh and frozen seafood, and the prices are awesome.  This is a great little place for quality products for foodies like me.

8.description: there is no better place for gulf shrimp.  Make sure you ask for shrimp king brand to get the best quality

4.description: My family has been coming to this fishery since I was five years old. The service is great, and they always have what I need. This is the place to come to get good seafood and chicken, with great prices.

14.description: Awesome place!! They have everything you could want and great service.

6.description: NO stars!!!!!......English learn to speak it ....Little short ass wanna b...Learn how to treat your Customers...I can find another fish house to go to ...will never go back there!!!!

1.description: First, I thought I wrote this review weeks ago.I have to say that when I first seen this location I really didn't want to go in because of all the people that seemed to be hanging around the block not just in front of the restaurant.I'm glad I took a chance to and walked through the doors of Chan's because it was worth finding this little gem.The first time I went I just got the Shrimp Egg Foo Young(yummy) lunch special which I believe was about 5.25 and it came with shrimp fried rice(good) and an egg roll(very good).  After 3 o'clock they add a dollar to the lunch special and it still is a great value because you get a lot of food for the price.I slowly started tasting other items like the beef and broccoli(very good), shrimp and lobster sauce(ok), fried crab sticks(tasty especially when hot), orange chicken(good) and a few other items that I can't remember the name but for the most part all very good.I really like that the food isn't very greasy and it taste so fresh.I even had a chance to briefly speak with the owner who told me they had been there for years and watched as the neighborhood changed and the different stores that have come and gone but they were still standing.I can definitely see why because the food is very good and tasty.  I also call in my order so that I can run in and out not that it takes a long time if you don't do a phone order I just don't like the elements on the block.  I'm not saying they don't get a lot of business because I believe they do but I know they would get more if so many people weren't on the block. There are a lot of stores on this strip(block) as well so I know that is some of the reason for some of the traffic that seems to be constant fixture.They also do not take credit cards so make sure you bring cash if you decide to venture to this location.Give them a try you won't be disappointed in my opinion.Enjoy!!

0.description: A great hole in the wall place to get chinese takeout. Really awesome fried rice.. and you MUST have their chicken wings.

3.description: Not sure if Phil D. got lost and wandered into a different location because the service here is terrible!Everytime I've been here, they are out of something. Burgers, fries, salads, NAPKINS, milkshakes, ice cream. BAGS. When you are fortunate to go and they have your food, it's good food. I mean, it's not great, it's McDonald's...if you want great, I'm sure you aren't looking for fast food.The staff are okay, they aren't overly nasty to you, and tend to treat you how you treat them. If you say aren't overly rude and say thank you, then you'll manage just fine.

1.description: This McDonald's has to be one of the worst I've come across. I only go there cause I want to support the community and so the kids wouldn't have to go so far for a burger. The coffee taste like they use the grounds more than once it's so weak. The drive through cashier always messing up your order and always got a attitude. Mc Donald's is supposed to be open at 5 am no later than 6 it's 630 and there saying in 15 min. We on my way to another one. I had to give one star to post.

2.description: This place is never freaking open and when they are their in service is incredibly slow. Screw this McDonald's.

0.description: I came here today to grab some lunch and it seems they take the speed more seriously than their competition up the street near the 69th Street Red Line stop. I was in and out of there within about 7 minutes. My only annoyance is the fact that the parking lot is in dire need of repairs there's potholes all over the place and some that are 3-5 inches deep. In order to run a respectable establishment is better maintenance of the facility. Also the trash strewn all over the parking lot is an issue which depicts what kind of clientele this location services. I do give them props for their time in completing an order.

4.description: Wow, I recently made a visit to this McDonald's and had one of the best service experiences, I have ever had in a fast food restaurant. Friendly staff, fast service, and great tasting food.

1.description: Uh WHO is Uncle Don Ray and what did you do with Uncle John? I traveled to the South Side for delicious sausage from Uncle Johns and was shocked to see a new uncle.I don't like this uncle's food..and its all turkey,which may or not be a good thing.My turkey hot links were dry and tasted a few days old.The seasonings inside were OK.It came with a few fries and 3 slices of wheat bread-WHY? 2 rickety links and 3 pieces of bread.The person at the desk said that the food was the same,but NAH!

0.description: If you are like me you were more than disappointed to find out that Uncle John's BBQ was no longer going to be in business and on top of that the Uncle John's he gave the torch too was no where as good as the original.I say all of that because I was so excited too see a new BBQ joint in the old location of 337 E 69th street. It was close and convenient.  I wanted too love this place. I wanted it to be the place I go to on the regular. I wanted to rave about it but unfortunately that isn't going to happen today.  I also thought it was weird that they don't open until 4pm by then you have lost out on so much business.  I mean I thought Uncle John's opening up at 1 pm was crazy but Uncle Don Ray's opening at 4pm is a head scratcher.The first time I went to Uncle Don Ray's BBQ was on mother's day.  We asked for the fries to be plain but instead the entire order was but people make mistakes so I didn't give them a ding on messing up our order.  It was closer to the end of the day and the tips really were more of a "meh' not "amazing"My daughters told me hey it was the end of the night, plus the chicken wings they ordered were good and the hot links were decent even though they were no Uncle John.One day she went back and I don't know the day but the rib tips were still not up to par and the portion was small according to her so I don't know what made her give this place another chance but she loves rib tips and I guess she was going for the three strike rules so she went back this pass Saturday  5/24/14 and the ribs were so flavorful and that's all I could think about was getting my own order because she teased me with only one piece.  She also said they gave her a free sample of the turkey tips and they were delicious.I went back excited about getting my order only to walk back home to discover they were cold, dried out and less than tasty bits of meat in my container. They were nothing like they were the day before when my taste buds were excited and couldn't wait for more of the savory meat.  They tasted nothing like they look and I watched as the young man pulled rib tips out of the oven so when did they cook the rib tips?  how long were they in the oven?  I don't know why I didn't think of that while I watched him fix my order.While waiting on my order a young lady came into the restaurant and ordered 3 small "End Pieces" she also ordered a small link after talking with the young lady behind the counter because there was a bit of confusion on what she meant by "End Pieces"  I asked her what was "End Pieces" because I had never heard that term used before in regards to ribs.  She explained that it was the end of a slab of ribs and too be honest I was still confused because I thought they called that end baby back or something like that.  Anyway, I watched as the guy prepared her order and from the way she explained what it was it didn't look like the young man understood what she meant either by "End Pieces" so I told her I don't think you are going to be happy with your order because he is chopping the meat into tiny pieces and you said it was suppose to have a bone in it like a slab.  She went back to the window asked the lady behind the counter was she sure they knew what "End Pieces" meant and the young man assured her he did and the young lady told her she would show her the order before they wrapped it up and gave it to her.  Just as I had expected that wasn't what she wanted but I didn't stay too see the final results so I can't say if things were resolved or if she cancelled her order.  It was messed up because she drove all the way from Oak Park thinking she was coming to Uncle John's and got Uncle Don Ray's. It would have been okay if she had a better experience.If you go into this place envisioning what use  to be there you are going to be more disappointed because this place doesn't hold a candle to them.At the end of the day I will go back to try the turkey tips and if I want some wings I will go there but I can live without their Hot Links and inconsistent, small serving yet expensive tips. I wasn't looking for this place to be Uncle John's BBQ but I wanted it live up to the Slogan "DANG GOOD BAR-B-QUE"Enjoy!

3.description: Food was delicious, and beyond that, the service was fantastic. Very impressed with the management. The person who delivered our food was so incredibly polite and friendly that I called to compliment her. It might take a while, but it's worth the wait, folks. I grew up in Alabama, and I'm picky about my barbeque. Firehouse hit the nail on the head!

1.description: My husband and I read a positive Facebook review about this place in a popular food group which prompted us to stop in and we were so glad we did. One word...three syllables...DELICIOUS!! I ordered the herb roasted chicken and my hubby selected the grilled chicken. The chicken was perfectly seasoned and full of flavor!! We both ordered mac & cheese and sweet potatoes as our side dishes and they were the perfect compliments to the meal. The baked mac was creamy, cheesy and absolutely amazing. The sweet potatoes were cooked just right with a balanced blend of sweet and savory. The papaya lemonade is a MUST!! This was my first time tasting a papaya lemonade and it was one of the best beverage experiences I've ever had!! It is really good! If the owner was to sell this by the jug I would definitely keep it stocked in our fridge at home. The service and food were excellent and I already decided this will become a restaurant staple. They provide nice portion sizes at a good price point. You can easily determine that the owner/chef pours out love and passion into the food providing a model "soul" food meal. Top notch all the way! You can dine-in but the restaurant serves more of a carry-out crowd. Delivery is also available. Next time we will call-in our order to cut down on the wait time.

2.description: This is my girl who i used to work down the street from.I tell you,when it comes to home cooking taste,this restaurant serves some of the best Pizza from scratch and Turkey lasagna around.This restaurant has a nice decor as well to better reserve it's acquired taste.I recommend this restaurant because i've got plenty of dinners from here that encourage me to buy more Grill chicken dinners that are very affordable and delicious desserts.This is also a nice place to take someone for a date with no real interruptions and space enough to feel at home.Stop By.Worth it! Great prices!.Nick

0.description: I can't believe how good these ribs are!! This will continue and always be my place for ribs. The young lady that's deliver is the most pleasant and professional delivery person I have ever come across. Please Firehouse keep up the good work

I don't have much to say about this store I basically just went in to get some water, the cashier smiled and I bought my water then ran back out...lolI was in and out so quickly I didn't really get to scope the place out, but I will be back!!Enjoy!

3.description: Clean, well-stocked, orderly beauty supply store. The employees don't seem to mind my lists of questions, helping me find some obscure item, or, even, handling a return. Apparently, they also host product demos and such, as well. That makes them A-OK in my book!

1.description: Avoid like the plague. Very shady business dealings going on here. Authorizing purchases on stolen debit cards without checking IDs.

2.description: Very neat and organized and the staff is always extremely helpful! They have everything u need.

5.description: Love this place!!!

0.description: This place is better than any beauty supply I have been to. It is lit up so you can clearly see everything. They have tons of jewelry, make-up, and weave. Their hair product prices are top notch too.. I love that the staff is very helpful. It's also good to see the latest hair tools as well. I bought a bun that was only $5.99. It's a great price if you ask me. If you are down this way definitely stop by. In the front they have a big wall where stylist, MUA's, and other can put their business cards out there. I had been looking for a good natural stylist and think I may have found one.

4.description: Urban beautique is my go to beauty supply! I love that they recommend the best product to suit your needs instead of giving you a product to make a profit! I always ask for MICHELLE who is one of their store associates. She's usually spot on when it comes to recommending hair, oil treatments, shampoos and conditioners! It's the only place I go!

58.description: I can't believe there aren't more reviews for this place.  The food is awesome, tastes as good as my moms or my own, the service is friendly, and although I live two blocks away from this place, it is about the best food your going to get in the neighborhood for the price, that isn't loaded with grease and other crap.  Check it out if you can, the only downside is the place is so small, so I advise get carry-out take it home and enjoy it there.

56.description: I love scratch that I ADORE THE FOOD HERE. Granted its next to Cottage Grove (bring whatever you can for protection) but it stills provides a nice warming comfort to the customers. The waitress is nice even though, I don't remember her name but just lets just call her nice lady and the menu has some good items. I always order chicken with the house potatoes with a side of cheese grits, all are excellent especially the cheese grits, you could put that on a box and I would eat it. I highly recommend this place even if you live in distant areas, ITS WORTH IT!

29.description: Found this place on Yelp and it would a great disservice if I didn't post a review after our first experience at this restaurant. In short, best breakfast around!!! Easy to pass while driving, but once you're in it's a memorable experience. Kind and attentive staff. Great patrons who shared some local history while we waited for our meal. Amazing food! My husband and I both had the breakfast special. I ordered mine with grits, pancakes, and both types of salmon croquettes. He ordered his with grits, french toast and catfish nuggets. Closest thing you can get to a grandma's breakfast in a personal kitchen. Support south side businesses and check this place out. You will not be disappointed... AT ALL!P.S. Oder the Easy Living and add sweet tea. YUM!!!

42.description: As much as I wanted to love this restaurant after reading the reviews, I am disappointed that I did not. I tried it for the first time today. The food was just ok. Had the fried chicken and it did not impress. There are only a few side choices and they were not good. And the restaurant could use a little sprucing up. I would not recommend this restaurant and will not be returning.

23.description: The best underrated Restaurant in Chicago.  I love everything from the tiger woods to the turkey cristo.  You must try them!

47.description: The food was great! Came to visit Chicago for a few days and that was the best meal of the trip! Food takes a while to cook, but it's well worth it.  Got the blackened tilapia sandwich with a salad. It was the best blackened anything I've had. We also had the Chicken sandwich, which was very tasty. The fried chicken salad was delicious and perfectly portioned, and the 5 loaves hot turkey sub was great. Service was nice too! Fries are a must for people who like fries

8.description: Intimate Dine In restaurant with class and Great Service! The Spicy Salmon Croquet Omelette Breakfast is to die for, a definite Must Try! Don't forget to try the President Obama's Lemonade!! !!

31.description: Great food! Great Service! I am so glad to have found this place! Thanks Bean Soup Times for the post on Facebook!YouTube.com/MartinTheBro…773-301-1091

34.description: The food was excellent and the customer service was great. I drive past almost everyday and would not have imagined such a great dining experience.

16.description: Good grief!!!!  Amazing service, delicious, well cooked food--walking distance from the crib.  I'm in heaven, thank you 5 Loaves!  Went there this past Sunday for brunch, they were busy but we were seated quickly.  The wait staff were friendly and very attentive.  I got the popeye's omelette, my dad order the denver omelette.  Both were fluffy and amazing.  I'm not a pancake person but I tried my dad's and now I'm a pancake person--they were ridiculous! The refreshing lemonade can be ordered by the quart (that's the size I'd order if I was you) and comes in mason jars. I can't wait to go back and try their turkey chili and all the yummy looking chicken, sandwiches and salads on the menu.And as if the delicious food and great service weren't enough, they've got the nerve to have free wi-fi so that seals it for me.   We even accidentally knocked over a table while we were there..so embarrassing but they were sweet and gracious about it (so sorry to the nice folks seated next to us).I almost don't want you to go and crowd my new hang out, but that would be selfish.  So GO!  Just save me a seat...

13.description: The food here is wonderful.  I had the catfish nuggets, grits and cheese eggs and I thought they'd have to order a cart to roll me out.  Everything is cooked thoroughly (don't ya hate when grits taste "gritty"? not there) and the Tiger Woods (their version of an Arnold Palmer) is delicious.  Plenty of street parking and access via the King Drive or 75th street bus.  The only slight downside is that sometimes they're slow.  So if you only have 1 hour, I'd advise you to order take out or wait until you don't have anything pressing to do afterward.   I'd def go back.

11.description: Excellent food.  Especially the jumbo shrimp omelet.  The french toast is also wonderful.The service could be a little more organized, but they are so darned sweet you end up waiting with a smile.

39.description: They have salmon croquettes down to a science offering grilled or fried options and there pancakes are delicious. They taste like cake.  Yes the establishment is small so you might want to leave the group at home.  We were seated immediately but it was only a party of two. My guy said his grits were a little stiff and his the pancake were to delicate for his liking but his spicy salmon croquette omelet was surprisingly delicious. Oh and our buttermilk biscuits were hard  but with everything else tasting great that was no problem. I have issues with places making my eggs how I like them and they did a good job.This is one neighborhood spot that I definitely will be frequenting again. The prices are reasonable and the chef or owner came out and talked to us briefly too. I like when restaurants do that!

37.description: Yes, it's a hole in the wall and in the semi-hood, but the warmth, love & care of the owner is present in every dish. Family owned and operated, the food never disappoints. Can't go wrong with breakfast, lunch or dinner.

0.description: If you live in the area, want great pancakes, or just passing by, you MUST try 5 loaves.I've only eaten their breakfast, which is awesome, but I sure everything they make is just as great!!! Really any breakfast item on the menus you will enjoy, especially their pancakes and if you live on the edge like I do and go for the lemon pancakes you'll be hooked. Also, try the Tiger Woods drink. I haven't had their soul food options but have heard great things! Treat yourself to an awesome affordable meal. Oh, how I wish they stayed open later.

38.description: This food is Soooooo Good!!! Comfort food for the soul! I love everything on the menu! My husband and I  are are regulars, the Service is Awesome! And if it's your Birthday Joyce will sing to you, she has the voice of a angel

51.description: All I can speak for regarding this visit is the chicken and I am still in a fried chicken with hot sauce coma.  Awesome service as always!

27.description: Really wanted fried shrimp and decided to see if they had any on the menu. To my surprised it was the special on the menu. It was delicious. Lightly breaded, fried nice and golden. They serve with a honey mustard and garlic dill sauce...yum! I had  two sides of potato salad and cole slaw (both are made at the restaurant). I would definitely get those two sides if I needed to bring a dish to an event (yes they do cater as well). For dessert, I had a very delightful peach cobbler (also made in the restaurant). As usual my experience and food was wonderful.

32.description: Sooooo, my family and I have visited the establishment 3 times. It is very small but, cozy. Don't go there too hungry, because the service is very slow. Maybe its because we visited on Saturday and Sunday mornings. I feel like they need some help fro the morning rush. But, on a brighter note, the food is tasty..just don't go when you are starving. I love the green color on the wall!

54.description: I haven't dine in years until today 5/6/14. The quality of food was poor. The chicken wings were usually "off the chain" however, they were blan, they had feathers still on them.  I knew that I wouldn't have enough time dine at restaurant so when I ordered I requested that my meal would be placed in a carry out container instead of on dishes. When my order finally arrived after waiting forever, it was on dishes. I explained to Avery the waitress what I requested. She stated that they were busy and handed me a container.  I order tea without ice, I received a glass with more ice than tea. I will not dine or recommend this restaurant to anyone. They had plenty of help in the kitchen but they were still slow

48.description: Food was great.  The turkey Cristo was absolutely a delight.   I saw salmon croquettes on the menu.   I went back two days later and had them.  Great.  They have an easy living that they serve in a giant Mason jar.   I bought the jar and took it home.  I love this place.

44.description: I was worried because NO ONE gets salmon croquet right... but they REPRESENT! Crispy, no gigantic onions, not fishy, just RIGHT. Biscuits were home made and flavorful, and they didn't just slap a piece of cheese on my eggs, they folded it in. I'm a foodie, and I am impressed.

24.description: Anything I order from here is delicious. My food is always hot and fresh. This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants. SN: Their mini turkey burgers are really tasty.

7.description: Found this place on Yelp and it would a great disservice if I didn't post a review after our first experience at this restaurant. In short, best breakfast around!!! Easy to pass while driving, but once you're in it's a memorable experience. Kind and attentive staff. Great patrons who shared some local history while we waited for our meal. Amazing food! My husband and I both had the breakfast special. I ordered mine with grits, pancakes, and both types of salmon croquettes. He ordered his with grits, french toast and catfish nuggets. Closest thing you can get to a grandma's breakfast in a personal kitchen. Support south side businesses and check this place out. You will not be disappointed... AT ALL!P.S. Oder the Easy Living and add sweet tea. YUM!!!

49.description: Looking for more breakfast places. Went there this morning based on yelp reviews. Rarely this disappointed after a yelpers suggestion, and almost never this disappointed after breakfast on a Sunday morning!I was customer #2 as I pulled up about 10 minutes after the opened, and the waitress seemed annoyed by my presence. She wasn't rude, but I got that impression that I wasn't welcome. I wanted the breakfast special with eggs and potatoes, but I couldn't get the potatoes without onions, as they are pre-made. I decided to get my second choice, pancakes with strawberries. They were out of strawberries. Blueberries? Nope. Only bananas today. So instead I got pancakes with a side of crispy bacon. Pancakes were not good. 2 of the 3 slices of bacon were good and crispy (I liked being asked how I wanted my bacon) but the 3rd piece was not. The juice I ordered was great-- very refreshing, hence the 2 stars. Otherwise only one star. All in all, $11 bucks for some good juice, a couple slices of decent bacon, and some lousy pancakes.

40.description: Although its a small family establishment,the food and atmosphere is amazing! Im always happy and excited to support Black owned  businesses! Prices are amazing as well..... the  people are family and treats u as such!

53.description: I really love this place the food is great even with them taking a long time ,At times you can't beat the price & it's family oriented.

30.description: I really like the food here. It is seasoned very well and served hot. The only drawback to this place would be the quaint size and long wait (since the food is cooked to order). Try to visit early in the morning or on a Tuesday or Thursday to avoid the crowd or wait. There is street parking and a CTA bus stop right outside the door.

46.description: I enjoy going here. Their food is always hot and fresh and the wings are seasoned well. I like the breakfast too. I also appreciate the fact that they have a lunch size and dinner size for many items.Pros: 5 minutes from my housegood foodpositive sisters and brothers working thereclean bathroom ( ummm yes that is very important to me)Big portions, light eaters can shareA nice selection for folks who cant eat porkWhen they have desserts they are tasty and run out quick !We like the fried chicken and fish and salmon, they make greens that have no pork and are tasty, Cons: no free parking but you just park on King drive or a side street and walkThey had ran out of dessert! Dude! I saved my calories all week to have some cake and you have NO desserts? Go to one of the nearby struggling bakeries and buy someFood took awhile, but it was piping hot, I noticed they had a lot of take outs during the lunch rush when I was there, good for them! They probably took my cake oh well didnt need it any way ( sigh...the caramel cake and butter cake was so good )No pop! Just coffee, orange juice, tea, lemonade, but the sweet tea was awesome ( I sipped someone elses, they give you a nice big mason jar so there is no running back and forth that girl was busy!)A good place for breakfast lunch or brunch they close kind of early

1.description: 5 Loaves is a small storefront restaurant that you'll miss if you're not looking. The only advertisement is a sign in the window. I came here last month with a couple friends. The place was small and warm--music was playing and the food from the kitchen smelled great. I had some lemonade that was served in a large mason jar--it was shared with two other people. Beware, it is very sweet! For my entrée I had a spicy salmon croquettes egg white omelette (because the whole egg version of an omelette is too fluffy for me) which tasted phenomenal at first bite. The croquette in the omelette was perfectly seasoned and had the spice that was described. It came with a side of skillet potatoes (the soft chunks) that were good and hearty, albeit a little salty, and pancakes which I never ate because the omelette was so satisfying. Only thing to note is that two people who were seated a half an hour later than us received their food first. Seems like the cook doesn't know how to time sending orders out, so for that I'll have to deduct one star. My friends arrived 45 minutes before I did and placed our orders and we still had another 20 minute wait afterwards. There's no more than 6 tables in there and half the people inside were already eating, so I was confused as to why the service was so slow. The server was attentive, though. ***Overall, the place is clean, the food was great, and is a definite must try! I will return!***

55.description: This place is a gem. The food is delicious, the place is homey, the people who work here are super sweet. It's hard, sometimes, to get people to leave Hyde Park, where I go to school, but I have a regular group of people who ask when we can go to 5 Loaves next. Do yourself a favor and eat here.

9.description: I loooooove this place. I usually go after church. I love that they play gospel and that it is owned by Christians, or so I've been told. The staff is kind. I've had one or two issues, but they've more than made up for it!!!! Shrimp and grits and a waffle on the side.

26.description: Tried 5 Loaves one more time before I decided to write it off permanently. As stated in my tip, my last order was too oily or salty. This time, I decided to go with what I saw others eating to be on the safe side. 3 of us ordered and got fried chicken, pancakes, a basic breakfast (eggs, meat, potatoes, biscuit) and lemon zest pancakes. I'd say the majority of the food was mediocre with the chicken and lemon zest pancakes being somewhat problematic. The chicken, though cooked well was really dark (almost black) on the inside...although safe to eat bit appealing. The lemon pancakes were so bitter we had to throw them away! Apparently whoever grated, didn't know stop before the white part or else he dish is a fail. Ironically when we called to complain, they said they knew abt it! So either you served it anyway or just have no quality control. We did arrange to get our money back but there was no additional level of consideration given service wise. The bottom line in my opinion is there are too many amazing food options to settle for mediocre food and careless service. Save time and don't stop here.

25.description: Extremely happy with this find!  Had the Turkey Cristo which was delicious!  THe potatos had a ton of flavor too!

12.description: I'm a need y'all to STOP IT and then go slap the cook with those salmon croquettes!  1st time eating,  and heaven was in my mouth.  The fried chicken is like none other. Everything soulful to eat there is mouth watering and delicious!!!!#

59.description: Just had breakfast here today, and it was really tasty.  The omelette was huge and flavorful, the french toast was good even without syrup, and the potatoes were seasoned but not salty.I'll be back.

21.description: The menu consist of classic southern fare. I.e chicken and grits, salmon croquettes and eggs etc... It did take a while for the food to come out to us but we had a large order and the kitchen/establishment is not quite that big.The service was great. I have not one complaint about friendliness and hospitality. I loved the small and cozy feeling of this southern eatery and I liked the way that it seemed so busy throughout the morning. It was a great welcome into Chicago.This place is a definite local spot that community members frequent and they can spot an outsider from a mile away. (The stares were in abundance at this place) I enjoyed my wings and waffles. The salmon and eggs, home fries and all else that my family members ordered looked great. Overall I did like this place but considering the 4 star average rating I was expecting something slightly better.

17.description: Went with a large group that rented the space out.  I had the turkey cristo, greens, Mac n cheese, mashed potatoes and cabbage.  Everything was flavorful and tasted just as good as home made.  I will be back

10.description: My first time eating here and the breakfast is wonderful. It touched my soul :-) #delicious

5.description: The menu consist of classic southern fare. I.e chicken and grits, salmon croquettes and eggs etc... It did take a while for the food to come out to us but we had a large order and the kitchen/establishment is not quite that big.The service was great. I have not one complaint about friendliness and hospitality. I loved the small and cozy feeling of this southern eatery and I liked the way that it seemed so busy throughout the morning. It was a great welcome into Chicago.This place is a definite local spot that community members frequent and they can spot an outsider from a mile away. (The stares were in abundance at this place) I enjoyed my wings and waffles. The salmon and eggs, home fries and all else that my family members ordered looked great. Overall I did like this place but considering the 4 star average rating I was expecting something slightly better.

3.description: Sometimes hidden gems are found in the smallest of places.  It's a little small storefront restaurant off of 75th street that you can walk right by and miss.  But if you find it, you are in for a treat.Food was excellent.  I ordered the 2 any style eggs with catfish nuggets and everything was cooked perfectly.  The cook even came out to make sure our order was up to our satisfaction.  The portion size is pretty huge.  Just looking around the restaurant at other orders and you saw tables filled with food to eat (especially the orders that included fried chicken).  The only real issue is the size of the place.  It's very small so on busy weekend days (especially Sunday), you are going to wait.   But after you get a seat, you practically forget all about that.

35.description: I am so happy to have found this place because I commonly say (complain) that there are not enough good restaurants on the Southside. The staff is super nice and attentive which is always a great thing. The food is great! I've been for breakfast a few times and enjoyed everything. Things of note are the smothered potatoes, the salmon croquettes, and the catfish. Let me just say that for some reason my taste buds changed awhile ago and catfish is something I stopped eating frequently. My mom ordered the nuggets after seeing someone else with them and they looked so tastt, I had to try them. They were excellent! Even the customers are friendly! Be prepared to wait as they cook to order. However, this is not a negative for fresh food.  My only constructive feedback is that the bathroom leaves a bit to be desired. Other than that, this place is great. It is rather small, so be mindful of when you go. Maybe I'll go today!!

19.description: Me and my friends love going to this place for Sunday breakfast or brunch. The staff are extremely hospitable.The Restaraunt is on the smaller side but provides a family environment. Whether we have breakfast or lunch the food is always amazing and provides a home cooked/ comfort food delight. In particular I love the bang for your buck you get with their combos (salmon croquette, pancakes, potatoes, eggs, and chicken). We like washing it all down with the Arnold palmers (lemonade and sweet tea mix). Often times we will get breakfast and order dinner (fried chicken, salmon croquette, collard greens, yams and Mac & cheese with cornbread) to take home. They give reasonable portions at even more reasonable prices!

28.description: Good grief!!!!  Amazing service, delicious, well cooked food--walking distance from the crib.  I'm in heaven, thank you 5 Loaves!  Went there this past Sunday for brunch, they were busy but we were seated quickly.  The wait staff were friendly and very attentive.  I got the popeye's omelette, my dad order the denver omelette.  Both were fluffy and amazing.  I'm not a pancake person but I tried my dad's and now I'm a pancake person--they were ridiculous! The refreshing lemonade can be ordered by the quart (that's the size I'd order if I was you) and comes in mason jars. I can't wait to go back and try their turkey chili and all the yummy looking chicken, sandwiches and salads on the menu.And as if the delicious food and great service weren't enough, they've got the nerve to have free wi-fi so that seals it for me.   We even accidentally knocked over a table while we were there..so embarrassing but they were sweet and gracious about it (so sorry to the nice folks seated next to us).I almost don't want you to go and crowd my new hang out, but that would be selfish.  So GO!  Just save me a seat...

45.description: I came here to have breakfast with my mother, we were near by and I saw this place had good reviews so I decided to give it a try. It's a cute little restaurant, we missed it the first time we passed by it. It's towards the end of the block (by Martin Luther King Dr) by where the bus stop is at. The food was delicious I loved it! And so did my mom. I had the Deluxe Sandwich and my mom had french toast with fruit. I like that they use fresh fruit on the franch toast and not the kind in syrup, not a lot of places do that. I ordered potatoes with my sandwich and they were AMAZING! I would definitely recommend our order, specially my sandwich.

33.description: I've been here about 4 times before this experience so when my friend asked if I wanted to go that was fine by me. I remember them having awesome salmon croquettes. They were soo yummy that the small space didn't bother us. The fact that we have to hold our handbags in our laps while eating didn't bother us. The fact that nothing can fit on the table once 2 plates hit the table didn't bother us either. Sadly this time they were mushy and salty. Also, I asked the server about what meat are cooked in the sides and she said turkey so I asked if there were any in the dressing and she assured me only stock no meat. However, as I was eating it there was meat so I had to send it back. She suggested I get the string beans which are sautéed with garlic. Well maybe she should've described em as being sautéed IN garlic. When she brought them out I assumed there was parmesan on them nope that was ALL garlic. Which was way too much, at that point I was DONE! I just wanted to get the check so I could get home and start flushing all that salt from my system so I wouldn't wake up the next day swollen. The server was accommodating she comped the check and also gave one of us (as if we were a couple) a certificate to comp our next meal. Which was fine by me because I have no plans of returning. If I have a taste for salmon croquettes again while out I'll just go to Daley's, at least I'll know they'll be cooked properly and I'll even get home made biscuits. I TOTALLY overstand the cook having an off day but I'm not one to take chances with my food. Other than that the servers were pleasant.

43.description: The food and the service at this restaurant were awesome! Visually the restaurant is not super appealing. However the  food, costumer service, and prices compensate for what is lost visually.

2.description: First things first, the food was decent and I would definitely come back. I had the Popeyes Omelette with homestyle potatoes and pancakes. Our waitress failed to mention they were out of spinach, so that was substituted for broccoli in my omelette. The omelette was okay, probably won't order that again, but the homestyle potatoes and pancakes were really good. The service was decent, given their small waitstaff, and it being pretty busy due to the church crowd beginning to roll in. Overall, it's a nice spot to meet up with a couple of friends to enjoy a good meal for a reasonable price.Update: We ordered food for later that included chicken wings, salmon croquettes and several sides. Everything was delicious, except the garlic mash potatoes. Therefore, I'm upping them to 4 stars because I can't wait to go back now.
