18.description: Anything I order from here is delicious. My food is always hot and fresh. This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants. SN: Their mini turkey burgers are really tasty.

41.description: I'm impressed. My heart is smiling. I came here for a change of scenery and what I just witnessed was humanity in motion. A man walked in, attempting to sell used magazines, speaking loudly, and the owner? manager? came by to talk to him. He started with his pitch, she listened patiently, and then said, "I'm not going to take any magazines, but why don't you sit at that table? I'm gonna fix you something to eat." He insisted on giving her a magazine, and she graciously accepted. It wasn't just that she fed him, it was the way she treated him with such dignity and care . I feel honored to be eating here and to have witnessed that.And the food is just as wonderful.

52.description: Once again, 5 loaves fed me good! Deluxe breakfast sandwich- fried egg, bacon, tomato, spinach on toasted marble rye bread- hash browns and hot tea all made for a light but tasty meal.

50.description: Food: 5 Stars, Service: 5 Stars. This is the only restaurant I've found on the south side that doesn't just serve deep fried fatty food. They have a great variety of foods and breakfast! The server is the most attentive I've experience in this area, she was fantastic. We've tried to go back on a Monday and Tuesday and found they are closed these days. If you find yourself on the south side and you don't feel like fried fish or chicken, try 5 Loaves Eatery, it will not disappoint.

4.description: I was there last week Thursday and it was quite the experience. The place was packed at 10:30am. I was really shocked. It's a very small location however, the food was amazing! The buttermilk syrup was THE best in Life!!!!!!!

6.description: Teeny, tiny spot on 75th just east of King Drive.  Excellent fresh food. Got a salad with grilled chicken.  It was very good.  My only complaint is that they are slow. I ran in for take out and waited more than 20 minutes.  The young lady who took my order and rang me up kept me posted on my food and offered me a free drink for my wait, which I appreciated.  I like to support neighborhood spots so I will go back and will try a full meal.

22.description: The food here is wonderful.  I had the catfish nuggets, grits and cheese eggs and I thought they'd have to order a cart to roll me out.  Everything is cooked thoroughly (don't ya hate when grits taste "gritty"? not there) and the Tiger Woods (their version of an Arnold Palmer) is delicious.  Plenty of street parking and access via the King Drive or 75th street bus.  The only slight downside is that sometimes they're slow.  So if you only have 1 hour, I'd advise you to order take out or wait until you don't have anything pressing to do afterward.   I'd def go back.

15.description: It was a nice experience reasonable prices great food the waitress sang a very nice happy birthday to another customer

57.description: This is a hidden gem!   I could eat the grilled chicken salad from here every single day!  The ingredients are always fresh and their dressing is homemade and delicious!  Yes it's small and it can get crowded but all of the food is really good and fresh.   My husband always gets their iced tea which they call Tiger Woo.   I must admit it is good however very very sweet so I steer clear of it.   You will not be disappointed by the food or the welcoming atmosphere!

20.description: Loved the chicken fingers! I believe it was the owner that checked if we liked everything, nice touch! A definite do it over and over again!

36.description: Great Food and customer service. I had the salmon croquettes both grilled and fried with grits and eggs. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good reasonably priced breakfast!

14.description: Went out here since it was the closest spot open for Brunch, food was decent ambiance was great. Urban clientele. Nothing spectacular or innovative about the place, but they did a great job with the traditional menu items. Might visit again when I'm in Chicago next, but won't go out of my way for the food.

3.description: I'm giving this establishment a one star because this is the lowest yelp offers... Today I went to this store for the first time to purchase items my children at school so they could do some fundraising. I presented my tax exempt letter from my school, and a man came by took and as he had a mouth full of chips proceeded to tell me it was fake. He said it was a copy. I said of course the school has the original and provides a copy if items need to be purchased for the school. He then proceeds to talk still with a mouth full of chip and says I typed this on my own computer and I used the wrong format and again says its fake and walks away. I smiled, and I will call the store in the morning to speak with management. This is no way to treat people that come to your store to shop. In the future a proper way to handle a situation would be not to talk with a mouth full of food, and say I have no way to verify this today if you wold like to check back tomorrow we can get you taken care of so you can shop for your school. Accusing customers of forging documents will get long unfavorable reviews like this one. I will never come to this establishment again because where I spend my dollars are very important to me!!

1.description: Called the store for a price. The young man told me he could not access the system to give me a price because I didn't have an account.  I asked him it I walked into the store you can give me a price correct?  He said yes. Sound like to me  they give you whatever price they want to.

2.description: This is more than a liquor store! As a matter of fact, I come here much more frequently for last-minute catering supply needs. Whether I run out of half-pan lids, need more Jerk rub, or got the wrong size portion cups, A & G has me covered. They even have 50-lb bags bags of lump wood charcoal!As far as liquor, they have nearly everything! Close to holiday time, they they have lots of the nice little gift sets that I like. Everything from Chambord with pink DOF glasses, to Gentleman Jack with a stainless steel flask, to Rumchata with shot glasses.

0.description: The name of this establishment is really A & G Food and Liquor it is a Wholesale store.  They don't just sell Liquor but they sell Pans for cooking Mac n Cheese or for a cater.  They sell Jello shot glasses to plastic gloves. I even saw a Nacho Cheese Machine.  I'm sure there is more but I didn't really explore that part of the store.I like to come in here for chips or soda(when I have a taste for soda) because it is right off the red line.They also have Liquor that is cheaper than some in the neighborhood, but they do close at 6:45pm except for on Sunday they close at 2:45pm. They also have cash back on debt and they don't charge you a fee like many places do now, but I don't know if your bank will charge you so if I have to use my card I just do credit and I like that they check your ID because with identity theft I like when an establishment ask for my ID no matter how many times I have walked through the doors.The customer service is great and I will definitely be back!Enjoy!!!

1.description: The only thing I ate here was the steak cheese fries. They give large portions of steak, flavor was pretty good.

9.description: Fred and Jack's!!! Been coming here for years. Most of my life really. Italian beef, dipped, sweet and hot peppers and American cheese me please!!! Way better than greasy Portillo's. The fries are bomb and the al pastor tacos are delish.

23.description: WOW  one of the best hotdog in the city!!! ok  let me start off saying the fries are just ok but the hotdog is super good, ( one warning, they did once put ketchup on my hotdog, so i had to take it back, it only happened once out of the 8+times i been there). this place has changed owners over the years, but the food is still good. im not a fan of the fries but the hotdogs here are just too good. i would recommend a visit here, i usually come here when im working in the area, yes the area isnt to good, but if your able to brave the neighborhood you wont be disappointed with the dog, it is usually always crowdedthey do have a parking lot, no seating, strickly take out.  oh dont forget to bring extra money, someone might ask you to get them a hotdog!!!

12.description: Not the best neighborhood but the food is very good!  Only tried a Polish Sausage & Hot Dog but both were perfect with the Polish being the standout.  All sandwiches come with good french fries.. It's usually busy but they get you in & out pretty quick!  Prices very reasonable/ Red Gold Ketchup packet.. get dat did

21.description: I come here for the milkshakes and always leave on a cloud. Why? Because the guys behind the counter always flirt..and not in the gross out way. It's cute.The shakes here are UH-MAZE-INGGGG. Hands down, one of the best reasons to come here. It's right off the expressway, so it's located where anyone could come down here, but not in the best neighborhood at night. The parking lot also is TEENY as I've almost gotten hit every time I either exit or enter, so be careful. They are known for their tacos and burritos, and sad to say, I've never had either from here. When I'm here, I go for the nachos, the burgers or chicken sandwiches. And while it's greasy food that you go for rarely, it's good. The staff is always warm and they can handle any size crowd, and do so effectively. However, I go for the milkshakes. They have various flavors, banana, chocolate, strawberry, vanilla and others. I've probably had all of them at least once, and I'm a traditionalist at heart, I go for either chocolate or vanilla. Oh, and they take cash only!

17.description: Good, cheap, and you won't be disappointed

10.description: Man I remember going to this place when I was a kid my dad would take me too Fred&Jack's I would get a cheese burger and banana shake he would get the Italian beef with red sauce and a fountain root beer. Oh my god did life seems so simple then the cheeseburger was just a great big bundle of joy of course I was a kid also and the banana shake was so impeccable my father always enjoy the Italian beef and sometimes he would get a combo. As I grew older I got into the Italian beef and sometimes I would get a combo but I stayed with my banana shake its something that I didn't change as a matter of fact there is still a guy that works there from when I was a kid I think he said he's been working there for about 30 years even after the ownership change. Fred & Jack's is just okay nothing like it used to be the seems as though they do a good business cuz there's a line all the time and there but nothing like the old Fred & Jack's. The Italian beef is just ok the quality of the meat is not as good as it used to be in the red sauce theme to have changed from the way it was originally I mean that red sauce was so good I used to take cups of it home it was just the bomb. Since the change of ownership there's been a change in food product the service is still pretty good I don't frequent this place as much as I used to I might come to Fred & Jack's maybe twice a year and I don't live far away versus coming oh my goodness maybe for 3-4 times a month compared to back in the day. Nevertheless you do get what you pay for the service is great the food is not bad but its not as good as it used to be back in the day. Then some would argue nothing is as good as it used to be back in the day, right? But as it turns out if you go to Fred & Jack's you'll probably enjoy yourself iw recommend the shakes the other mom Fred & Jack's has another location on Pulaski and Roosevelt right on the alley nothing like the one on Vincent and they don't use a red sauce for their Italian beef so if you into the red sauce you might want to stay on vent then. Fred & Jack's you been there for a while but you're just not as good as you used to be and that's why I'll come maybe about once or twice a year everyone else enjoy!  bone Appetit. !!Bruce Bruce

5.description: This place is good for a quick burger or taco. I usually get the pizza puff special that comes with fries. The food is all pretty standard in terms of fast food. This place usually gets crowded after 5 p.m. during the week, but since the service is fast, the wait is usually no longer than 10 minutes. Since the kitchen is surrounded in glass, you can watch as your food is being prepared. Currently, there's construction going on in the immediate area, so street parking isn't as plentiful as it once was. But if you are accustomed to maneuvering your car around in small places, the parking lot should be a breeze.

11.description: These reviews really kill me. So what about the neighborhood. Don't come over here and eat our food then Jesus. This was one of my grandfathers favorite places. I love the shakes. The amount of food you get for the price. You seriously can't beat it

22.description: Great quality food... Even thou the original owners aren't here anymore

0.description: One of Chicago's many greasy spoons that serves up great food. It seems pretty popular, especially during the lunch rush. The steak tacos and steak fries are good; and I also hear that they have some pretty good shakes. There's construction around the building so parking may be hard to come by during busy hours.

2.description: First time here.  It's a little hidden.  Saw the good yelp reviews and gave it a try.  Nice  clean location.  Big parking lot.  Large menu and good counter service.  Great prices! I got the grilled rib eye sandwich.  Covered in grilled onions.  Decent.  Great fries though.  $7. Can't beat that.Boxes of those good butter cookies sold here.  I luv em.Next time I'm going to try a grilled hot dog and strawberry shake.  That's what a nice old guy recommended while I was waiting for my order.

18.description: I come here for the milkshakes and always leave on a cloud. Why? Because the guys behind the counter always flirt..and not in the gross out way. It's cute.The shakes here are UH-MAZE-INGGGG. Hands down, one of the best reasons to come here. It's right off the expressway, so it's located where anyone could come down here, but not in the best neighborhood at night. The parking lot also is TEENY as I've almost gotten hit every time I either exit or enter, so be careful. They are known for their tacos and burritos, and sad to say, I've never had either from here. When I'm here, I go for the nachos, the burgers or chicken sandwiches. And while it's greasy food that you go for rarely, it's good. The staff is always warm and they can handle any size crowd, and do so effectively. However, I go for the milkshakes. They have various flavors, banana, chocolate, strawberry, vanilla and others. I've probably had all of them at least once, and I'm a traditionalist at heart, I go for either chocolate or vanilla. Oh, and they take cash only!

13.description: Against my better judgement, I had my bf call the order in & they managed to screw it up. Ordered 8 CHICKEN tacos for us (b/c we haven't eaten beef or steak in years & our 6 yr old has never had it). They gave us 8 STEAK tacos  We called back, willing to take the food to get our order & they acted like it was inconvenience to them. No apology & they said they would start making the order when we got off the phone. Nope! They started making it when my bf got back, had the nerve to count the damn tacos one by one like they were being cheated, and still no apology! The guy was rude so he asked for our money back and again b/c we're being such an inconvenience to them, they had the nerve to say we already started making it. Customer service is everything when ppl are spending money, so they won't be getting any more of mine. We dont eat often in greasy spoons, but when we do, I expect to be treated courteously. KEVIN'S HAMBURGER HEAVEN (the truck stop) has better chicken tacos. Try them.

4.description: I guess you get what you pay for they're hot dogs have lettuce and I don't know if its a Mexican thing what they wanted to delicious French fries were okay Pizza puff ok subway shake delicious

6.description: Any place where I can get a grilled hot dog gets 5 stars from me. Fast service for pick up and them dogs taste great. Love that it is right down the street from my house. Will be stopping by more often.

15.description: Really good food.  Late night hours. Reasonable wait time.  Friendly cashiers, especially the African-American woman.  I've tried their shakes, burgers, cheese steak fries (add lettuce, sour cream, and lettuce for extra change), hot dogs, and burritos.  No complaints.  Carry-out only.  They accept cash & credit cards.

7.description: Good food. Hole in the wall kinda place but those always turn out to be the best places for me. I'll be back to try the shakes that seem to be so popular.

8.description: They young lady at the register was nice,, I order 3 steak tacos 2 plain 1 with onions n cilantro only,, got home n I had 3 steak tacos with cheese lettuce etc, I was not please at all i lived to far to come back,, I called to inform them of their error and they guy in the back ground says  just come back I informed him it was late n I lived to far his response was oh well come back Thursday,, I was pissed, I explained to her I just wanted to let her know this was the 3rd time they screwed up my order and act like it didn't matter.... Fred n Jacks needs to remember your in a community and our opinion about customers satisfaction does matter even if you don't live in that community,,

3.description: I decided to give it a try since I was in the area.  The shakes are probably the best thing to order off the menu. We ordered pretty much each item off the menu the tacos are good but came out cold. The jumbo dog was good never ate a hot dog with lettuce before. I wouldn't recommend the wings or the Italian beef I only gave it 3 stars because how good the banana and strawberry shake was.

14.description: So this was my Grandma's fave greasy spoon back in the day.  She would get us McDonald's (around the corner) and get her food from here.  Well now we are grown and we know better so we do better hahaHighlights include:BEST PINEAPPLE SHAKE IN THE WORLD?GREAT HOTDOG WITH FRESH CUT POTATO FRIESSTEAK TORTALOADED NACHOS

28.description: Love this place, I go every week. Mani / Pedi deal M-W for 35 dollars. Then I just get a polish change in between when my next one is due. People are friendly, they go above and beyond, clean atmosphere and they are always playing Friends dvds.

1.description: Unprofessional trashy salon. I would never recommend this place, not when there are tons of other great spots in the wet loop. I made an appointment here on a Saturday and they proceeded to take a recent walk in over me. Fine. So I pick out my color, wait 20 minutes and the woman tells me the hot water is broken for the pedicure. I should have suspected that when I saw her pouring a coffee pot filled with hot microwaved water into a woman's pedicure bowl. What? Um no.After the woman told me the hot water "might" work after I get my mani, I decided I'd rather take my business elsewhere. I wish she would have told me that upon walk in so I wouldn't have wasted 30 minutes on this mess. Stay away.

39.description: Tried out the $35 mani/pedi special (mon-wed) and a week later my mani/pedi is still perfect.  Normally, I never get manicures because they chip or get messed up one way or another.  Not this time!  It's been over a week and even with lots of gardening my mani is still in pristine condition.

9.description: I just moved into the neighborhood and was so happy to find this nail salon so close by. I decided to take my chances and walk in with no appointment on a Sunday afternoon and glad I did cause I walked right in with no wait time. I needed to get a pedicure and no chip manicure done. Normally, for a no chip manicure and regular pedicure I am looking at $50. Very standard throughout most nail salons + tip. I have to say that their selection of nail polish was very small. They started me with the pedicure and the only thing I have to say was interesting, was the hot rocks they used to rub my feet with for a short minute. They also cover your heels with a plastic baggy filled with some type of soaking soap water. Nonetheless, I felt my pedicure was a bit fast. I don't feel that the girl doing my pedicure took her time filing my feet the way she should have. I could care less for the hot rocks and the plastic baggy. I would rather have a good foot file. She did a very good job on the nail polish. For a $30 pedicure... Umm. Not 100% satisfied.. Maybe 75%. This is normally $20 anywhere else.  For the no chip manicure, they use the Shellac nail polish. It's looks nice, but for those that had it done before, it's nothing out of the ordinary from a regular nail polish.. other than using the ultra violet nail light to make it stronger. The color I picked was a very light hot pink, so because my nails were not filed properly, I have small bumps showing through. A good nail salon knows to always paint the tips of your nails as well so they don't chip easily. Unfortunately for me, I was not one of the lucky ones to get that service and a day later after having my nails done, it's starting to chip off a little bit at the tips. I was busy watching tv, and did not pay attention to what was going on in front of me. For a $40 no chip manicure... Umm. Not 100% satisfied. Maybe 60%. This is normally $30 anywhere else. Fot the prices this salon charges for services, I would think they would be more up to date with their decor, paint, and service. The television does not help the experience either. I don't understand why it had to be so loud. I prefer spa music to relax to, not a chaotic television show that I don't care for. It's silly to think that I spent so much money on my no chip to have to do it all over again most likely in a week. Sorry Jewel Nail Spa. If you want to market yourself as a high end nail salon, you need to back it up with high end atmosphere, service, and customer service.

29.description: No idea about the service because they wouldn't serve me.  Apparently I needed an appointment but I went there as a walk in.  They weren't busy so I sat right down and I told them I had a Groupon.  I had my feet in the water and they told me they wouldn't serve me unless I paid another $15 (which totaled the regular price mani/pedi).  I didn't make an appointment, my fault, but I was there, they had a spot for me (there were only 2 other people in the whole place) and wouldn't serve me.  A business that makes their money almost exclusively on walk-in business, making an appointment is ridiculous.  I've never made an appointment at a nail place.  Poor customer service.

23.description: Very nice! My wife and I went here for a pedicure date. Only my second time for a pedicure, but I liked it. Quick professional service in a clean shop. Lots of massage and hot paraffin wax. My feet feel great. A good value.

5.description: My go-to nail spot in the area. Nothing fancy but they do a great job. Like others have said - the hot stone massage & heel paraffin during a pedi is an added plus! I'm usually lucky & go in during the slower hours but always call to make an appointment anyways. Plus Monday's thru Wednesday's is $35 for a mani & pedi. Price list added to photos :)

31.description: First of all, the polish was not bad. The man/ped itself was not bad at all. I'm giving this rating because of the awful customer service. I had an older lady (All the younger ladies were very nice to their customers.) She did not scrub or buff my feet for the pedicure. When she finally started polishing, when she messed up, she would dig into my skin with her NAIL to fix it; very unprofessional. What I did like about the pedicure is that they put paraffin bags on your heels when they're done with the pedicure, which most salons charge $10-$15 extra to do so.  When we FINALLY got to the manicure, I asked her if she had time to do a french manicure instead. She rolled her eyes and simply said "Yes." Once again, she was kind of rough with my fingers, didn't even ask if I wanted round or square and she was fixing the polish with her nails. She put some lotion and hit my hands twice, which I'm really hoping is NOT the massage they give out to their clients. I specifically told her that I want a WHITE BASE for my french manicure, I do not like pink at all. She got me a clear base! She put the base on and started doing the lines, no brush, nothing. The lines were so crooked! When I saw her grab the base again, I asked her if I can have something more white. She stared and me and spoke her language to her co-workers. She said "I do line again," which I replied to "I don't need you to repeat the white line, I would like something more white on the base." She got really frustrated and stood up and started talking her language with her co-workers again. A younger lady came and asked me what I would like, I explained again and she brought me a couple of choices, very nice and smiley girl. The older woman came back and did it, its not bad for a french mani (I asked her if she can fix the white line, to which she used her fingers again, but its not bad),but overall I was very dissatisfied. The lines aren't all the same width and they are thick, so they will definitely chip fast. If you want a cheap mani/pedi and you don't care if the technicians are talking in their language the whole time, getting up all the time to reply to their texts and answer the phone, not talk to you AT ALL and not understand when you ask them something, you can go. It took the woman 2 hours to do the man/ped, and like I said, ITS NOT BAD. However, I prefer to pay a little more and have the great experience with the technician. Oh, and there is ABSOLUTELY NO PARKING anywhere near the salon, so be careful!

25.description: If you have a groupon, don't even think about using it here. They never had available time slots and were very rude even when the groupon expired and I tried to use the cash value of the groupon. Had to call groupon to get my money back. Seriously, don't even waste your time.

12.description: I went to Jewel about a month ago for a no chip mani and regular pedi.  The pedi was good, chairs were great.  The no chip mani was hurried and then she told me both wer $70 which is much higher than any other west loop place.  After I voiced my concern, she said $65 for both.  Based on that i assumed my no chip would be great...not the case.  Once in better lighting, i saw she didn't do a good job of the second coat.  My nails starting chipping 5 days after.  Also the top layer would peel off (which i've never had happen).  Moral of story...no chip is not good and way over priced!

37.description: This place is fabulous. The pedicure rocks. Great service. Reasonable price. Very relaxing.

21.description: I went last night for a 5:15 appointment and they were able to take me and my friend right away. It was a Monday night and according to the other reviews, they had a great mani/pedi combo deal for $35 (but we only wanted a pedicure). The color selection was appropriate, not overwhelming and not skimpy... They took us at our appointment time - glad I made an appointment though because there were a few people that came in and were turned away... They gave us a hot stone massage - which was heavenly, and they gave us a paraffin heel wrap, which was a first for me in a standard pedicure. They did a great job with the polish. I was a happy camper. When we paid, however, I was expecting a pretty decent deal on the pedi, since the mani/pedi was $35. The pedi itself was $30. We will definitely get the mani next time for the $5 extra. Overall good experience, only 4 stars because the "deal" isnt really a deal if you dont get the mani as well. I will go back though, for sure!!

16.description: I went in on a Sunday afternoon (yay!) for a no-chip refresh. It wasn't packed, so I was a little nervous. However my manicure looks pretty good and I'm satisfied with the 80 minutes and $40 spent.It's a clean, cozy shop. They don't have loud music blaring, but they do have DVD shows on the large TV. That's enough of a distraction while getting your nails done. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was three-fold:1) They remove the no chip via soak and pick. No cotton ball/foil wrap removal. Not the most efficient, effective or non-damaging way to remove old no-chip gel.2) They were polite but not necessarily friendly. No problem though. You get in and you get out. No fuss, no muss.3) Limited no- chip gel color selection. Compared to other nail salons, they had about half of the colors from OPI that I've seen before. And those colors are from an old collection. Not really up to date on the newer, more on-trend shades.All in all, I'll definitely be back. I might soak off my own gel before I get there, though.

17.description: I had a mani-pedi 5 weeks ago. The young girl who worked on my feet was considerate but inexperienced and was rushed by the older owner/manager/whatever. She injured my toes which hurt for days after. And when I removed the nail polish, to give my toes a break, I found I had fungal infections (is it plural?).  First time that has happened  in reaction to a pedi. It's close to work and $35 is a nice deal, but I'm never going back.

10.description: My boyfriend and I came here for the first time and we absolutely loved the service and staff! We both got pedicures and we were very impressed with their process which includes a hot stone massage, an oil treatment, and hot towel wrap on a massage chair! It was so relaxing and fun because they have a big screen tv and they were showing friends so I was laughing the whole time. Afterward my boyfriend got a manicure, they did a great job! While I got a no chip manicure and she did a great job filing them down, making them square, and applying the color. We are definitely coming back!

11.description: This place is so annoying.  I spend a long time looking for parking, end up paying to park, and then when I arrive there is 1 person working, and it is an hour long wait, even though there is only 1 customer.  The one time I did get helped, I am 99% sure I picked up a foot fungus on my heel.  This was the only place outside of my home I had been barefoot in 6 months.

26.description: great nail place, $35 for mani pedi mon-wed, $40 other days. they are friendly, massage chairs are pretty good. nail polish selection is decent. pedicure is excellent - do a great job on cleaning your nails, buffing your calluses, and do a hot stone, leg massage, and paraffin on your heels.great attention to detail. manicure was great as well. excellent neighborhood spot, and great price! friends dvd are hilarious as well

27.description: So nice! Affordable manipedi with all the perks- massage chairs, loads of fashion mags, hot stone leg massage, neck massage when done and I'm on day 4 of the manicure with no problems. I will be returning! We didn't have reservations but it was 10am on a weekday.

35.description: Love this place now that it is under new management! I always wanted to like Bijeau which was here before this place as it is right outside of my building, but never really enjoyed my experience. Now they have massage chairs for pedicures, they do a hot stone massage and paraffin with a nice shoulder rub at the end. They spent a long time on both my pedicure and manicure and I enjoyed not feeling rushed. There was very peaceful music playing in the background which made it a nice all around stress reliever for the end of a busy week. To top off my wonderful experience, my manicure lasted forever! It started to grow out before it started to chip (and this was a regular manicure, not a no-chip), the best manicure I have had in a long time! I am excited to have a new nail place in the neighborhood that I really enjoy! $35 mani/pedi Monday through Wednesday and $40 otherwise.

8.description: I've gone there twice and they have done really fantastic jobs. Perfect mani/pedi. They take their time.

0.description: Mon - Wed $35 Mani PediOrdinary.  Zero trend knowledge or opinion.  Thou shall not speak or socialize with tech.  Efforts in service.WALK-INS -- welcomed.CLOSING TIME -- promptly at 8:00 pm.  Last service at 7:30 pm.  POLISH SELECTIONS -- limited. OPI's Infinite Shine upcharge is $5.POLISH APPLICATION -- close application between cuticle and nail bed.  Polish cleanup with brush.NAIL CLEANING -- aggressively good.  No bleeding.  But, it stings when acetone is applied pre-polish.MANICURE -- ok hand massage, hot towel.PEDICURE -- tibia scrub and hot stone.DRYING STATION -- I still hate them.  Tech gladly helps in spraying and removing toe separators.

38.description: This place is fantastic -- Mon-Wed they have $35 main/pedi. Other days, pedi is $30. Included in the price is a leg massage, hot stone massage, and they paraffin your heels! They even give you a short shoulder massage while your nails dry. Very clean and friendly. Can't believe all you get for the price! Much better than the old place, Bijou.

20.description: I've been to Jewel Nail Spa at least 10 times out of convenience. However, each time I went the service got worse and worse. My most recent visit (12/18/2013) consisted of a no chip mani and pedi. With both services and with the service provider I was thoroughly disgusted. The young man that was doing my pedi was quick and lackadaisical about my pedicure. He didn't give my feet time to soak, he half-assed scrubbed my feet. He half-assed used the hot stones and paraffin wax on my feet and quickly applied the polish. Additionally, my no chip manicure should have been a regular polish. Two days later the "no chip" polish came off two of my nails. It's disappointing, especially when I paid $50 for a service that was crappy. I thought the no chip mani and pedi were going to last because my friends raved about no chip manis and I wanted to try one (they've been to better places and those places were not Jewel Nail Spa). I should of known after I looked around the salon and other folks were getting better service and treatment than me. Jewel Nail Spa will never get anymore of my money because the quality of their service is poor and the treatment you receive is not equal. I've been to better nail spas and been to this place out of convenience. Clearly you pay a price (time, money, and quality) for convenience. Never again!! Overall, thumbs down and I will NEVER come to this place again.

19.description: First of all, the polish was not bad. The man/ped itself was not bad at all. I'm giving this rating because of the awful customer service. I had an older lady (All the younger ladies were very nice to their customers.) She did not scrub or buff my feet for the pedicure. When she finally started polishing, when she messed up, she would dig into my skin with her NAIL to fix it; very unprofessional. What I did like about the pedicure is that they put paraffin bags on your heels when they're done with the pedicure, which most salons charge $10-$15 extra to do so.  When we FINALLY got to the manicure, I asked her if she had time to do a french manicure instead. She rolled her eyes and simply said "Yes." Once again, she was kind of rough with my fingers, didn't even ask if I wanted round or square and she was fixing the polish with her nails. She put some lotion and hit my hands twice, which I'm really hoping is NOT the massage they give out to their clients. I specifically told her that I want a WHITE BASE for my french manicure, I do not like pink at all. She got me a clear base! She put the base on and started doing the lines, no brush, nothing. The lines were so crooked! When I saw her grab the base again, I asked her if I can have something more white. She stared and me and spoke her language to her co-workers. She said "I do line again," which I replied to "I don't need you to repeat the white line, I would like something more white on the base." She got really frustrated and stood up and started talking her language with her co-workers again. A younger lady came and asked me what I would like, I explained again and she brought me a couple of choices, very nice and smiley girl. The older woman came back and did it, its not bad for a french mani (I asked her if she can fix the white line, to which she used her fingers again, but its not bad),but overall I was very dissatisfied. The lines aren't all the same width and they are thick, so they will definitely chip fast. If you want a cheap mani/pedi and you don't care if the technicians are talking in their language the whole time, getting up all the time to reply to their texts and answer the phone, not talk to you AT ALL and not understand when you ask them something, you can go. It took the woman 2 hours to do the man/ped, and like I said, ITS NOT BAD. However, I prefer to pay a little more and have the great experience with the technician. Oh, and there is ABSOLUTELY NO PARKING anywhere near the salon, so be careful!

33.description: 2 stars described by yelp as meh, which is exactly how I felt leaving this salon. I went to this salon based on yelp reviews and I wasn't as impressed as the others. The polish selection wasn't great, they had classics, but not much to choose from. What I chose ended up being thinned out so much that I will have to have a polish change from another salon to get them right. The pedicure was mediocre and they did not clean under my toe nails with the dental like tool that gets the crud out (VIP part of the pedicure). I noticed the same thing about the manicure as well...not a lot of clean up on the cuticles or underneath the nails. They do have nice perks like the hot rocks and the fancy oils, but I would trade those for a spic and span clean up of my feet and hands.  Oh, they also got busy at the end of my appointment so no neck massage was given:(

2.description: I have been here twice.  Twice, I had the best manicure in the city.  Not sure how they do it but my polish lasts a whole week+ when the ladies here do my nails.  They are really nice and take their time.They let me stay longer (past closing time) to allow me to dry my nails before leaving.  They just went their way and cleaned up the salon, but let me stay and dry my nails.Technicians are really nice here and they do a great job. Price is reasonable. A+ !!!

34.description: I'm sorry that I am the only one not giving this 5 stars.  I really did like this place but there's always room for improvement :)While this place is a bit pricey, you do get more than just your average mani-pedi here.  So, as long as you can afford $30 for a pedicure, $40 for a mani-pedi, it is worth all that you get.  It's a little out of my budget, but I will go here again for a special occasion.  I should note that mani-pedis on Mon-Wed are only $35 and that's a pretty good deal.I had my first pedicure here.  It is very nice, you get a hot stone massage and hot paraffin wax on your heels in addition to the usual pedicure from other places.  I enjoyed both.  As all women know, your feet need these extra little things in the summer when flip flops are worn every day.  They also offer to give you a shoulder massage while your nails are drying, I did not partake just because I was in a bit of a hurry, but I will next time for sure.  Just be prepared for a pedicure to take an hour, which is a bit much for a lunch break if you want a manicure too, so I think you can just let them know if you're in a time crunch.  They were all very nice.  So the only complaint I have is that the place was awkwardly silent.  There was no music, there was no tv playing and there was no talking.  I was afraid to move because it may make a sound.  So that and the price are the reasons why I give it a four.  I will definitely come back when my bank account allows.

32.description: Love it!!! The pedi and mani were fabulous and the service was excellent. The lady that did my service cover my feet with plastic as not to mess up my pedi because I had on my gym shoes. I will definitely be back.

18.description: I got a gift certificate for my birthday and went on a Wednesday so the mani/pedi was $35. I booked an appt from 12-1 thinking I could get it all done on my lunch, but I didn't tell them my plan which was completely my mistake. I'm glad I made that mistake. The pedicure was possibly the best I've ever had. It took about 45 minutes but she was so detailed and careful,  plus she rubbed hot stones up and down my calves and over my feet, and then rubbed oil as well. As she was painting my toes, my heel was soaking up paraffin. My feet are so smooth and so well done, I would gladly go for this treatment again. I didn't have time on my lunch hour for my mani, but she scheduled me for after work so I could still get both for $35, which I really appreciated. The manicure was completely average, which is fine by me.

41.description: This place used to be called Bijou.  Now has new owners and a new name obviously.  They remodeled, super clean.  I had the best spa pedicure and manicure.  The mother daughter team that was here today were so polite and really took their time.  Best nail spot in the west loop!

13.description: This could definitely be my go to nail spot.  It's VERY conveniently located, and comparably priced to other nail salons in the area.  There were three technicians working on this lazy Sunday afternoon and only two patrons, so I got seen right away.  I got a french pedicure, and the pedicure was lovely.  Hot stones and paraffin.  Ahhhhh.  They were binge-watching Friends and there was water available so all in all, not the height of luxury, but very relaxing just the same.  I'll probably try and take advantage of the madi/pedi Mon-Wed special of $35 in the future, but all in all, definitely worth the visit.

4.description: A bizarre experience. I usually enjoy checking out new nail salons and this was by far the most confusing. The service was ok and although it was cheaper than most I ended spending 65.00 for an ok pedicure and painful manicure. My nails were cut too short and the cuticles are sore. They wrapped plastic bags on my feet and said I did not have to dry my toes. The "hot stone" massage was marbles placed in warm water. Like I said, bizarre and not recommended.

24.description: After yet another attempt to get a walk-in mani-pedi at my local salon, which yet again turned me away because they were "completely booked" (if one occupied chair means "completely booked") I found Jewel. I really liked how you got your mani and pedi at the same time. The little massage perks were great. I took advantage of a M-W special. I would definitely be back.

6.description: Nice little hidden gem. Great job on the polish and lasts over a week. Not giving five stars since I felt a bit rushed and wasn't offered shoulder massage this time. They made it very clear they were expecting some appointments in the 5-7 minutes that remained between the end of my service and the next (which were not even there yet!)   The male that attended my mom was much less rushed and gave her a longer foot massage as well. Mon-Wed deal on mani/pedi is $35!

22.description: I went in on a Sunday afternoon (yay!) for a no-chip refresh. It wasn't packed, so I was a little nervous. However my manicure looks pretty good and I'm satisfied with the 80 minutes and $40 spent.It's a clean, cozy shop. They don't have loud music blaring, but they do have DVD shows on the large TV. That's enough of a distraction while getting your nails done. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was three-fold:1) They remove the no chip via soak and pick. No cotton ball/foil wrap removal. Not the most efficient, effective or non-damaging way to remove old no-chip gel.2) They were polite but not necessarily friendly. No problem though. You get in and you get out. No fuss, no muss.3) Limited no- chip gel color selection. Compared to other nail salons, they had about half of the colors from OPI that I've seen before. And those colors are from an old collection. Not really up to date on the newer, more on-trend shades.All in all, I'll definitely be back. I might soak off my own gel before I get there, though.

15.description: My go-to nail spot - nothing fancy, but they do a nice job and have a good price.  I like the paraffin wax on your heels.  They can get busy, though, so it's best to go on off hours.

40.description: I love this place.  Have been here twice since the new management and it's great.   Nice color selection and great service.  Hot stones massages- the best ever.     If you are in the loop, don't pass this place up.

7.description: I have been to Jewel many times (enough to go through 2 punch cards giving a free manicure). Like many Yelpers I have seen the service decline. Out of convenience only I have returned. I will never do so again.I walked into an empty salon today at about 11:30 requesting a pedicure and no chip manicure. The owner said no problem and had a new inexperienced person do the pedicure. It was nothing remarkable to say the least. That alone would not have kept me from returning. The owner complained that it took to long to soak off my previous no chip polish. At 11:55 a woman walked in. They greeted each other warmly and the woman said she had a 12:00 appointment. The owner asked me if I could come back later to get my nails done. About 5 minutes later another woman ( a friend of the first woman) walked in forger mani/pedi. I was rushed outdo these two women could be taken are of immediately.I am not an unreasonable person. I respect and understand appointments. What I can't abide is being rushed in for the money and then thrown out when better "regulars" walk I. The door. The owner should have said she did not have time to accommodate me. That would have been fine. I know when I have had an appointment I have had to wait...hmmm I tip really well so that isn't the problem I show up every other week so I'm fairly regular. I guess the owner does not want my business. No worries. There are plenty of nail places in the West Loop.I vowed never to one back before due to poor service but relented. Today, however did for me. I won't be back!

36.description: I was never a bit fan of bijeau....but this place has come under new management...and there are major improvements.  The pedicure is lovely...they have nice massage chairs and calming music.  With a pedicure you get a hot stone massage, exfoliation rub and paraffin on your heels....all for 30 bucks.  They are nice and clean and overall a great experience!

30.description: They did a great job on my mani/pedi. Everyone was professional, prompt & knew what they were doing. They wrapped my heels with oil and gave me a shoulder massage at the drying station. Only gripe is the parking is difficult, but otherwise a great experience.

3.description: Popped in for a no-chips mani. Talk about a bare bones, no frills experience. And for $40?!?? Yeah, I'm going someplace elseThe manicure looked fine, albeit the polish job was a little sloppy. I'll chalk it up to my nails being super short at the moment. However, all my tech did was apply the polish and send me on my way. No hand massage, no shoulder massage, she didn't even put lotion on my hands or offer it to me!!For $40, these are requirements. I heard the pedicures here were good but because of this experience, I will not be coming back.

14.description: I'm sorry that I am the only one not giving this 5 stars.  I really did like this place but there's always room for improvement :)While this place is a bit pricey, you do get more than just your average mani-pedi here.  So, as long as you can afford $30 for a pedicure, $40 for a mani-pedi, it is worth all that you get.  It's a little out of my budget, but I will go here again for a special occasion.  I should note that mani-pedis on Mon-Wed are only $35 and that's a pretty good deal.I had my first pedicure here.  It is very nice, you get a hot stone massage and hot paraffin wax on your heels in addition to the usual pedicure from other places.  I enjoyed both.  As all women know, your feet need these extra little things in the summer when flip flops are worn every day.  They also offer to give you a shoulder massage while your nails are drying, I did not partake just because I was in a bit of a hurry, but I will next time for sure.  Just be prepared for a pedicure to take an hour, which is a bit much for a lunch break if you want a manicure too, so I think you can just let them know if you're in a time crunch.  They were all very nice.  So the only complaint I have is that the place was awkwardly silent.  There was no music, there was no tv playing and there was no talking.  I was afraid to move because it may make a sound.  So that and the price are the reasons why I give it a four.  I will definitely come back when my bank account allows.

0.description: I came from there to buy some toilet paper and I can understand why people don't want to do business in their own community since the moment you walk in the store it's clogged up with loitering hoodrats with nothing better to do with their time other than hang out at the corner store. The sad thing is that everything is overpriced there and it may work for a one shot like I did for toilet paper, but I will not be coming back to this place again. The cashier acted like a smart ass asking me what I was buying a 36 pack of toilet paper (for those of you who aren't hip to the ways of how ghetto south siders operate they buy large packs of certain items and turn around and sell them to make a bigger profit). First off the cashier has no reason to ask a customer what their reason for buying a certain item it's none of their business. Second the excessive loitering is why people don't want to come into places like this because who wants to shop where they have to see wall to wall hoodrats present. I have lived on the south side for most of my life and I am thoroughly disgusted at the presence of hoodrats being in and outside of stores hanging around like they have nothing better to do with their time. These store owners need to stop allowing hoodrats to hang out in their establishments. I would not recommend shopping here even for a soda or bag of chips go someplace else if you want to buy something you want or need. I can do without the smart ass remarks from cashiers asking my business when I am a paying customer and hoodrats looking at you funny for just coming in to buy one stinking item. Stay away from this place. They accept debit and credit with a .25 surcharge tacked to it so if this is a one time purchase then it's all good, but I will not be coming to this store ever again. I get better service at Jewel than corner stores.

3.description: Don't go here - (1) rude owner (2) food prices are higher than all other soul food places (3) food is bland. I gave them 3 tries - the last time I called in an order for pick up, they gave me the wrong items (someone else's order). I didn't know until I got home and opened the package. Better choices: Mama Lou's or Morrison's

1.description: This was so nasty the salmon was not cooked all the way!!! Then the Mac cheese  was over cooked! My 1 time eating here was great! Today's food was horrible won't b bck! Done

2.description: My boyfriend and I always SPLIT a $10 dinner for breakfast and we are satisfied for the rest of the day. All of the food is great and the owner and staff are always friendly and welcoming! Loyal customer.

0.description: Hood eats for cheap The owner Roy and staff are always friendly and welcoming! Loyal customer.t Pick up and go 5 stars

3.description: I went there for lunch today and ordered 5 Kentucky grilled thighs and they were not that great they had very little meat on them. Plus not to mention the biscuits were dry and could have used a light sweep of butter. They also have this mode of taking orders behind a bullet-proof plexi-glass window that indicates how African-Americans are treated  in certain neighborhoods. You're treated like a criminal by talking to someone through a speaker and it's usually some hoodrat that works the register. I usually don't eat at KFC since half the locations I go to are usually staffed with hoodrats and people with serious attitude problems and ignorant management. One customer got pissed off when they didnt have what she ordered and she snapped saying "Can I at least have my drink for the inconvenience". Yet it's funny how the behavior from the customers is appauling to see people acting ghetto and rude because a restaurant was temporarily out of a certain menu item. I wasnt impressed and the grilled chicken they had was not-fall-off-the-bone good like they claimed it tasted rather bland.

1.description: I sat at the drive thru window for 10 mins. The worker told me she forgot I was there smh. She then takes my order. I'm at the window waiting to pay for my food & I see them sitting up there taking selfies instead of taking my money or making my food. I blew my horn to get they attention & the girl gave me attitude like I was doing something wrong. I finally get my food which was suppose to be 10 honey bbq wings but they only gave me 8  overall I received horrible service & i will never go back to that KFC on 75th & lafayette

2.description: I am writing this just to let the world know this is the most fucked up kfc ever. My little cousin just had to have kfc so we stopped here. We were in the drive thru for 30 mins. Our order was placed through the intercom thing, and when we got to the window we had to repeat the order to the dumb chick. After 30 mins we get the food we drive 2 ft she gave me wedges not mashed potaotes circle back swoop behind the car that was just in back of us, mind u theis drive thru is full the rest of the line is still being held behind the intercom wait 30 more mins for sum mashed potatoes. We get a mile away and this boys discovers she gave him some kinda spicy chicken little instead of the regular one that he ordered. It was to late at this time, he shoulda checked. worst kfc ever

0.description: KFC is now offering a 10% discount for veterans and active duty military. Of course inquire about it to ensure that your KFC is a participant. Since there is a Popeye's chicken across the way,  they'll honor the competitors coupons.

3.description: Hello Everyone,I haven't been here in a year but my memories of this place are good :)They are the only local place I know that makes authentic gumbo with a little burn. I don't remember if it had the red or brown rue but it was good and worth the risk of eating at a hole in the wall. From the outside you may think twice before trying this place but this place is an example of how the best stuff comes from the worst looking places.Enjoy,Elihu

1.description: Well this place isn't the end-all be-all that was described to me. It took forever to get our food and it was average at best. The cabbage was good, the rice and peas were on the drier side and the chicken was okay, but the shrimp was actually great. I had such high hopes, but feel like I was missing something.On to the next!

2.description: Authentic Jamaican cuisine. One cook which makes for a consistent taste. Original recipes handed down from generation to generation. Rice and peas are like no other the perfect amount of thyme and coconut milk. The jerk shrimp are amazing as well as the chicken. My favorite is the Red Snapper spicy and cooked to perfection. Daddy O and I go way back from working there to being a customer.  Whenever I get a chance I go, and for some odd reason I always want Daddy O's jerk pit on Mondays when it's closed LBVVS

5.description: I started my love affair with Daddy O in 1997. I lived downtown at the time and I would call my orders. Not once was it ready when i got there! But that's ok, because outside of the wait Daddy O serves up THE BEST jerk chicken & shrimp that I've ever had. One order is enough for 2 people unless you're greedy like me. I've put so many people on to Daddy O throughout the years that I should be part owner by now. Don't forget the seafood gumbo!FYI - Be prepared to wait, perfection takes time!

6.description: Daddy o's i call him the jerk chicken nazi. You had better walk up to the counter and order your food.Don't change nothing about your order.Warning or you will pay.He snaps out sometimes yes ,He knows his food is good so if you leave so what. Daddy o don't play ,ok i warned you.Now the chicken and shrimp combo is thee best.You can't go wrong with the jerk chicken sooo good.I have been going there for 20 years.

7.description: I go to Daddy's everytime I'm in the area. I haven't tried the chicken because the shrimp has me hooked! I can't get enough of it! It perfectly spiced and full of fresh vegetables and thyme sprigs. The dinner comes with bread salad and sweet plantains. I'm able to stetch the dinner into two meals. For $12 I think its quite a deal.Just so you know the place has no ambience whatsoever but the food is fantastic.

8.description: Last year, at the high recommendation of my husband's coworker, we tried the jerk/sides @ Daddy O's and WAS NOT IMPRESSED.Fast forward, 9/4/09 @ the African Festival of the Arts & I didn't remember eating at this establishment and out of all the places selling food and observing the fact that Daddy O's food was covered and not readily accessible to the freakin' flies........Jerk chicken wasn't bad & rice/peas could of had a little more gravy on.  The only major gripe I had was that there was no cabbage or plantains =(.  Furthermore, garden salad was the 2nd side choice, but the young man was about to place it in the same container as the hot food.  Sorry, I do not want my garden salad/minus dressing, mixed in with hot food. esp. since I wanted it to go, to be eaten at home, on the other side of town.  After firmly stating my claim, the gentleman  who I believe was the boss, gave it to me my way.  =)$10 Mon9/7/09 - After standing there observing before ordering, I witnessed a female food preparer that DID NOT change her plastic glovs after handling money.......FORGET IT!  Instead, my husband swayed me in to getting a vegetarian taco.

0.description: Me and Daddy-O went to the same Food and Sanitation class at Olive Harvey College.After class one day he invited me over to try his Jerk Chicken drumstick.It was very delicious. From that point,i started recommending people to his restaurant.He has the best Jerk chicken and Rice and beans in Chicago.Hands down.I've tried them all.He also gives you a super large portion so that you probably wont be able to finish. Prices are well worth it. $12 gets a lot. Believe me.I cook and went to school for this and i know excellence.Whats up Daddy-O? HQ

4.description: A cozy little jerk shack nestled in the heart of the South East side on Cottage Grove. I stopped in here for a late lunch recently and I ordered up the jerk chicken dinner. I'd have to say that it was the most tender chicken I've ever had. by itself, the chicken was spiced with some tasty flavor, but you pour on that little container of juice, an WOW! now that's some kick! It wasn't so overpowering to make me go blind like some of the other jerk places I've been to, but man was it good. The sides of beans and rice were flavorful. I got a seriously large plantain. and the little side of salad came with some sweet and tangy dressing and it actually had veggies other than lettuce!While not high end fine dining, I would stop here anytime.

3.description: The mild sauce at this Harold's is slightly different than other locations.  The chicken is always piping hot and the service is better than expected for a hood staple. I'm probably biased because this is the Harold's that I grew up eating.  My partiality aside, this ranks near the top when you're craving a 6 wings mild.

1.description: The light skin lady seem as though she some other form of employment. Waiting an hour for chicken is crazy. Unorganized and poor customer service is a very big problem with this business

2.description: I wish I could give this location no stars. The location itself is bad as the store sits in front of a bus stop in which you cannot park. The menus need to be updated professionally instead of being changed by tape and markers. The food (chicken) that I've ordered has always been super hard as if they retried it three days in a row. I never see many people In this one. Probably because they know better. Go to the one on 87th! You'll get better food there.

0.description: I love Harold's, but this location is slow. I ordered a two piece meal and was there well over 30 minutes. Try a different location.

58.description: Wings are pretty good, lots of flavors you have to be careful which sauce you pick though because they have different consistencies and might not be exactly what your expecting. But most are delicious I like most of the carribean flavors... BUT the one huge negative is the cheap french fries and beverage options kinda suck...bad fremch fries kills it for me personally so thats what the 3 stars is about

56.description: Very nice business owner and friendly staff.  Good knowledge of super hero movies...  Staff asked if we wanted anything to drink while we were waiting for our order.  A staff member opened the door for us on our exit too.The wings were perfectly cooked.  Moist without a hint of pink.  They were not tiny either; good size.  The flavors we tried were lemon pepper, honey jerk, and honey q.   The lemon pepper was flavorful, succulent, and crisp.  The honey jerk was a magnificent balance of sweet and spicy.  And the honey q was delicious.We were told we would be back.  And he was right; we definitely will.  If you're anywhere nearby, it's worth the detour.  Even if you're farther off, it's worth the trip - there is ample seating inside the clean and organized interior, plus street parking wasn't difficult.Protip: ask what flavors they are out of before ordering.

29.description: These are my favorite wings. Totally worth the drive into the southside. This place is a true Chicago gem. My two favorite flavors are the strawberry barbecue and the honey jerk. Also, the toffee grapes are a surprisingly delicious (and relatively healthy?) treat!

42.description: Some of the best wings you will find in Chicago.  Great variety of sauces, and you have the option of getting the wings grilled.  Just go!

23.description: If this place was in the North Side of the Chicago, it would be a blast. Definitely the best wingz I had so far. I tried Lemon Garlic, Garlic Parmesan, Sweet Bbq and XXX. Yes, triple x was damn hot but a good one. Normally, other wing restaurants just dip the wingz into some nasty hot sauce and it is all dripping, there is no taste of chicken or the pepper, just a mess. Here they soaked them into the wingz, it was not messy and taste was still good! The commute is long but I will keep going.Attention to the Yelp and users, this place does not accept the Yelp deal anymore. The owner told me that Yelp should not be selling this anymore. I requested a refund from the Yelp team. Lets see what happens.

47.description: If you know me you know I love wings and every wing is not treated equally.  I believe this is some of the best freshly cook made to order chicken wings I have tasted in a long time.When we first heard of this place we drove to the old location and if we had only walked down a little more we would have seen the new location, so if you see on Yelp or Google that Chicago Wingz Around the World is closed its the 510 E 75th  location and the new one is 557 E 75th right on the corner.When we first stepped in we could see the place was clean and the aroma of the wings filled the restaurant.  If you think you are just going to see your typical wings you are mistaken they have flavors like Parmesan Garlic(d'lish), Jerk Q, Cheesy Buffalo and Jerk Teriyaki to name a few.  I believe they have about 40 different flavors to choose from so you could go everyday and still have something new.What I really loved about this chicken is it had the right kind of crunch on the outside and moisture in the inside.  You can get ten wings (halves) w/fries for $9.95 and two flavors so it allows you to taste more than one flavor. I sprinkled some of my Parmesan cheese on my Jerk Q and I was in heaven the cheese cooled down some of the heat from Jerk and also gave it a bit of a pop in flavor on my dancing taste buds.The owner was cool and it seems like the regulars really like him and we can see why because he was very nice and answered all of our questions about the different flavors that he created.I like that on Monday you can get the wingz for .50 each. On Tuesday they have a wingz challenge and if you can eat their hotess wingz they will give you up to $50 dollars depending on how many wingz you eat.(Now I don't know how long this deal is going to last but it was going on when I was last there.)  Another thing that makes this owner stand out is that on Sunday from 12-2 they have a homeless special where they give out free wingz. This tells me that the owner is a blessing to many and we should bless him with business so that he may continue giving back to the community.They no longer serve the salad he told us because it wasn't really selling along with the homemade Sweet Tea.  I kept thinking bring back the Sweet Tea...lolThe second time we went back we ended up eating there and the owner came over to our table making sure everything was okay with our food and he also told us that if we would have let him know we were eating there he would have put our food on a real plate.  It was fun listening to the other customers talk about sports I forgot how animated men can get when they are passionate about their team.They also have a deal on Yelp which is similar to Groupon $10 for $20 another way you can save and taste those  Amazing Wingz.  Trust me you won't be disappointed!!I will definitely be back!  Enjoy!

8.description: The atmosphere is great. Restaurant was definitely clean. No complaints, you should definitely try this place out.

31.description: Love the wings from this place! Parmesan garlic and ginger BBQ is my favorite. The wings are meaty and they give you lots of fries. Can't beat the price and the flavor. And those covered grapes were really good too. We'll be back for sure!

34.description: Guess who's back!!!!It hurt my heart to learn the original location closed last year and once I heard they reopened in a new location I was ecstatic! Me and some friends decided to have a gathering to celebrate the return of WATW! We ordered 100 wings for pickup.Once we got there, I noticed they have a bigger space as now you can sit inside whereas before you always had to get your food to go as there wasn't any sitting space. There are also flat screens on the wall to catch some good TV while you smash some delicious wings. They have also diversified the menu a bit as they now offer chicken sandwiches, chicken tenders, salads, chicken & waffles as well as some fried seafood.The favorites are still here as you can still get Strawberry BBQ, Sweet Ginger BBQ, Cheesy Buffalo, Maple, Jerk-Q among others. We put a damn hurting on them wings as there were pretty much none left once we finished. Good to see these guys are back on 75th.

16.description: IThe staff in this restaurant are terrible. They were not polite nor were they friendly. The person at the counter never said may I help you nor did he say thank you or come again. He acted as if I was a bother. He said they were whole wings. They were not. They are more expensive than any other chicken establishment in the area. I chose them to support my people.  My people treated me like s***. I had three different types. The buffalo wings were the only ones that were tasty. I will never visit this restaurant again. I would not suggest it to anyone.

13.description: The Jerk Chicken tacos were so good. I ordered two tacos but I was full after the first one.

11.description: I I don't eat chicken but they have colossal  shrimp with the ginger barbecue sauce that's fire!! I'm  a Yelp person and they had rave reviews so I brought my daughter here. It smelled so good in there. They have at least 34 flavors for wings. Didn't even know this spot was over here. Very clean establishment and friendly. Glad to support .

39.description: Best chicken wings I've ever had, hands down! Try the garlic parmesan! It was worth the trip down

37.description: Those were some really good wings!! I will definitely be back here!

0.description: Best wings on the planet! Get the garlic parmesan, cheesy buffalo, and jerk barbecue and you'll get a vast myriad of memorable flavors.

38.description: Incredible savory flavors paired with incredibly tender wings. Wonderful and highly recommend.

51.description: The whole staff was so gracious and polite. The food was great! I got free food and dessert just because the owner was being nice. And he said he's going to start showing Scandal and maybe offer non-alcoholic drinks

27.description: Chicago Wingz Around the World is the best place in Chicago to get great wings.  I appreciate the variety of flavors and the good dessert options.  My favorite flavors are Parmesan Garlic, Honey Jerk, Maple, Strawberry-Q and Jerk.

32.description: I would say it's because of the time of night I went but I know that couldn't be the case because I've received better service at around the same time here before. But considering the service I received I had to do an update on my original review. The guy was pleasant enough when I walked in and took care of me right away.  And the food was ready pretty quickly, so I thought hey cool I'm in and out. As I was heading back home something told me to look at it. And there were no fries, luckily I caught it before I got too far away. When I got there I was given a size fry that comes with five maybe ten wings, not the size that I know comes with twenty(that was for two people to share) because Ive been there plenty times before. And it was put in the wrong container which melted from the heat of the fries, so I still did not have any fries. Who wants fries with melted plastic all on them. I don't know if I'll come back here.

54.description: Chicken wing run run chicken wing

48.description: MY FAVORITE WINGS IN CHICAGO. And I order wings a lot. Wow. So happy that they are open again. As good as I remember from a few years ago. Maybe better! Loved the Lemon Pepper, Cheesy Buffalo and the Banging Ranch. Also thought that the Cheese Bites (fried and breaded mac & cheese) were solid. And standard Mozzarella Sticks. I agree with the other review that the fries aren't great. Kind of like you'd get at a BBQ joint. But like at a BBQ joint, you don't go to Wingz Around the World for fries. One warning: The hours that Yelp lists are not correct. Hopefully that gets fixed. On Sundays they are only open until 8 or 9. Don't  know about the other days of the week. Think that there might have been some seating, but much more of a take-out place.

44.description: Great service. The staff was welcoming and helpful. They made a good recommendation for a wing sauce for my 3yo (strawberry BBQ--  she loved it) and waited patiently while my husband ran down to the ATM after we realized mid order that they only took cash. While we waited for him to come back, the guy behind the counter came out with some toffee strawberries for the kids.The food did not disappoint. I had the honey jerk sauce and it was fabulous--sweet, hot and earthy. Husband had teriyaki and ginger BBQ wings; he says the teriyaki was the better of the two but they were both tasty. My 9yo seafood fiend had the fish and chips and said the fish was "exceptionally good."With the $10 for $20 worth of food Yelp deal, we really got our money's worth. We would definitely eat here again.

24.description: Great customer service I highly recommend eating here manager is very respectful and the staff is always willing to help out I have been a customer for over a year now best wings in chicago

7.description: By far one of my favorite wing spots. They have a plethora of flavor a here.  Definitely make sure you check out the CWAW Flavors. I had the Honey Lemon Pepper and the Jerk Honey BBQ wings. I promise you that I had to inspect my bone again to make sure I didn't leave anything left on there. Full of flavor and fried slightly hard.  Very small establishment, so don't blink because you may miss it.  I wish I could order their  wings from Nashville because I would eat them all the time. Make sure you stop here when you come to Chicago.

49.description: Amazingggggg. We had honey jerk, blazin ranch and cheesy buffalo. All flavors were delicious. The wait time is long though.

40.description: This establishment has some really good chicken. The owner was very helpful and patient with all the questions I had about the flavors. The food was fresh and hot cooked to order. I wanted to try some desserts but I was informed he feeds the homeless on Sundays so next time. Overall good place to try if you're looking for some wings and they are not as expensive as Wing stop at all.

53.description: Great flavor of the wings...I had banging buffalo, honey jerk, and lemon pepper...honey jerk was the best. They also accepted my Yelp voucher with no complaints. Call ahead to save time

30.description: Still a big fan. Since the days on 35th. They can run , they can hide. I'll find them. PS ON MY WAY THERE NOW. Parm-garlic , Jerk honey BBQ here I come!

46.description: Delicious homemade sauces. Excellent quality chicken. Amazing service. You can't go wrong with this wing joint! Will be back to try more flavors.

1.description: I pass this place every so often.... I've wanted to try them for a while...Ok... Read all the reviews... Went in to try... There were some people sitting inside... But the smell of sewage hit me square in the nose... Not sure why no one else was offended...Now what I know that food will pick up those smells as a flavor... So I just grabbed a menu and left... Don't think I'll return given the reviews posted

55.description: The food here is good, you just have to wait a while even when you call in your order 30mins prior. They have a lot of diverse flavors like Honey Jerk and such but I mostly stick to the garlic parmesan and lemon pepper. The customer service is fair even though sometimes the cook is the greeter and cashier at times. If you're in the area and want to try different types of sauces for chicken check it out but make sure not to make eye contact with the hovering crack heads (they can smell change.)

9.description: There was a $10 for $20 deal on yelp, so I came here with two friends over the weekend. The surrounding neighborhood is pretty rough, so I would recommend driving over to the restaurant. (We took the 4 bus here and walked two blocks -- have never seem my friend walk so fast in my life. Ended up uber-ing it back). They were filming for some sort of TV show or movie when we arrived, which was pretty cool. The service here is great -- we ordered two sets of 10 pc wings (garlic parm, honey bbq, banging spicy, and jalapeno). The honey bbq one was my favorite. The spicy had a real kick to it. All the wings I had were very delicious and flavorful. I would definitely recommend getting two contrasting flavors (e.g. one sweet, one spicy) to get a fuller experience here. While we were waiting for our wings, one of the workers here brought us out a cup of grapes lightly coated with peanuts and caramel. This gesture was very much appreciated! These little fellows were delish! If they are on the menu, you have to try them.Service is great here so this wasn't really a problem for us, but I can imagine that during busier hours it would be useful to have a napkin dispenser on each table since the wings are so messy.

26.description: Was looking forward to trying this place out for so long and finally got the chance. I must say I was not disappointed. The variety and quality of the wings are amazing. I will never ever dine at Wing Stop ever again. I tried the Cheesy Buffalo, Garlic Parm and Strawberry Q. All were great imo. You should definitely give this place a try if you are a wing connoisseur.

25.description: Love the food!!! So many flavors. i had the ginger bbq, bourbon, and Fire Jerk.

12.description: Guess who's back!!!!It hurt my heart to learn the original location closed last year and once I heard they reopened in a new location I was ecstatic! Me and some friends decided to have a gathering to celebrate the return of WATW! We ordered 100 wings for pickup.Once we got there, I noticed they have a bigger space as now you can sit inside whereas before you always had to get your food to go as there wasn't any sitting space. There are also flat screens on the wall to catch some good TV while you smash some delicious wings. They have also diversified the menu a bit as they now offer chicken sandwiches, chicken tenders, salads, chicken & waffles as well as some fried seafood.The favorites are still here as you can still get Strawberry BBQ, Sweet Ginger BBQ, Cheesy Buffalo, Maple, Jerk-Q among others. We put a damn hurting on them wings as there were pretty much none left once we finished. Good to see these guys are back on 75th.

59.description: The best wings hands down! The staff were very friendly and welcoming. Prices are very reasonable and affordable. We had the teriyaki, bangin buffalo and bangin ranch and they we amazing! Very flavorful and spicy(Bangin). Definitely my new fav.

21.description: Delicious! If you like BBQ flavored wings you must try the straw-q the hint of strawberry mixed with the BBQ is a must try! The customer service was also great, what looked like to be the owner was very pleasant and inviting.

17.description: This honestly is probably the best place I've had as far as wings go. I got the Garlic and Cheesy Buffalo wings. So damn good.  I am a wing fanatic that has ate at wing spots all over the us. This has got to be one of the best I've had.   Staff was cool too.

10.description: If you know me you know I love wings and every wing is not treated equally.  I believe this is some of the best freshly cook made to order chicken wings I have tasted in a long time.When we first heard of this place we drove to the old location and if we had only walked down a little more we would have seen the new location, so if you see on Yelp or Google that Chicago Wingz Around the World is closed its the 510 E 75th  location and the new one is 557 E 75th right on the corner.When we first stepped in we could see the place was clean and the aroma of the wings filled the restaurant.  If you think you are just going to see your typical wings you are mistaken they have flavors like Parmesan Garlic(d'lish), Jerk Q, Cheesy Buffalo and Jerk Teriyaki to name a few.  I believe they have about 40 different flavors to choose from so you could go everyday and still have something new.What I really loved about this chicken is it had the right kind of crunch on the outside and moisture in the inside.  You can get ten wings (halves) w/fries for $9.95 and two flavors so it allows you to taste more than one flavor.
