I sprinkled some of my Parmesan cheese on my Jerk Q and I was in heaven the cheese cooled down some of the heat from Jerk and also gave it a bit of a pop in flavor on my dancing taste buds.The owner was cool and it seems like the regulars really like him and we can see why because he was very nice and answered all of our questions about the different flavors that he created.I like that on Monday you can get the wingz for .50 each. On Tuesday they have a wingz challenge and if you can eat their hotess wingz they will give you up to $50 dollars depending on how many wingz you eat.(Now I don't know how long this deal is going to last but it was going on when I was last there.)  Another thing that makes this owner stand out is that on Sunday from 12-2 they have a homeless special where they give out free wingz. This tells me that the owner is a blessing to many and we should bless him with business so that he may continue giving back to the community.They no longer serve the salad he told us because it wasn't really selling along with the homemade Sweet Tea.  I kept thinking bring back the Sweet Tea...lolThe second time we went back we ended up eating there and the owner came over to our table making sure everything was okay with our food and he also told us that if we would have let him know we were eating there he would have put our food on a real plate.  It was fun listening to the other customers talk about sports I forgot how animated men can get when they are passionate about their team.They also have a deal on Yelp which is similar to Groupon $10 for $20 another way you can save and taste those  Amazing Wingz.  Trust me you won't be disappointed!!I will definitely be back!  Enjoy!

5.description: EAT HERE IF YOU LOVE WINGS. Their flavors are really creative. The straw-Q  and the Honey Jerk are so far my favorite. I plan to go back very soon to try more. Be mindful they only accept cash. Also the only suggestion I have is to bring back the Greek and Italian options and to update the website. But the wings are hot and saucy and the fries are seasoned well.

3.description: The wings are great, I had the honey bar b q jerk, service was good. its a lot of things only the menu I would love to try. only thing is the guy that took my order overcharged me waaay too much on the tax..or instance the taffy grapes are 4.00 he charged me 5.00 a whole also on the chicken...bro need to brush up his skills on sales tax..

35.description: Had these wings for the first time today and I am hooked for life. First the place is not closed. It opened promptly at 12pm as advertised. The gentleman at the counter was friendly and took time to explain their many wing flavors. I decided on the garlic Parmesan, the Bourbon, and the jerk wings. All I have to say is this place is my new spot. I took some to my husband for lunch and he loved them also. Five star place.

19.description: Delicious homemade sauces. Excellent quality chicken. Amazing service. You can't go wrong with this wing joint! Will be back to try more flavors.

28.description: My first visit to the new location. Again it is a little bit east of the old place. The new location is brighter and has sit down tables and they also carry soft drinks.You know the routine. The pricing goes in batches of six. I usually stick to the more popular items (cheesy buffalo, jerk, bourbon). My favorites are the garlicky ones with big pieces of garlic all over them. Yum.There's some construction on 75th. There was a Yelp deal available but I don't mind paying full price because I noticed that they are involved in the community and provide free meals to the homeless on Sundays.

45.description: All you need to know is that they have the BEST wings, period!!!! Get yourself over here and check it out!!!

33.description: Not closed but certainly should be. It's a shame, too. Since I knew the owner since he opened up the original place on 35th. Just off King drive. When it was just him and his brother working the joint. Went in there tonight. Was met by some 2 Chainz looking fool who, instead of greeting me, just looked at me up & down. Then said, " What you want?". I turned right around and walked right out. It's sad. I want to support black businesses. Especially one ran by a fellow Jamaican but that was inexcusable. Unfortunately you only see that sort of rude behavior in black neighborhoods. Shame.

43.description: There was a $10 for $20 deal on yelp, so I came here with two friends over the weekend. The surrounding neighborhood is pretty rough, so I would recommend driving over to the restaurant. (We took the 4 bus here and walked two blocks -- have never seem my friend walk so fast in my life. Ended up uber-ing it back). They were filming for some sort of TV show or movie when we arrived, which was pretty cool. The service here is great -- we ordered two sets of 10 pc wings (garlic parm, honey bbq, banging spicy, and jalapeno). The honey bbq one was my favorite. The spicy had a real kick to it. All the wings I had were very delicious and flavorful. I would definitely recommend getting two contrasting flavors (e.g. one sweet, one spicy) to get a fuller experience here. While we were waiting for our wings, one of the workers here brought us out a cup of grapes lightly coated with peanuts and caramel. This gesture was very much appreciated! These little fellows were delish! If they are on the menu, you have to try them.Service is great here so this wasn't really a problem for us, but I can imagine that during busier hours it would be useful to have a napkin dispenser on each table since the wings are so messy.

2.description: I heard a lot of good things about this restaurant from my co-workers. So I decided to give them a try...I mean how can you go wrong with wings.  Well, guess what...it went way wrong.First, I went around 2pm in the afternoon on a Monday and when I first walked in there it was empty except for two guys and a girl talking and hanging out. Something told me that one of the gentleman was the owner because there was no one at the cash register and it didn't appear that anyone was in the back cooking. Sure enough one of the guys walks over to the cash register and says what can I get you. I told him it was my first time there and asked if he had any recommendations.  He suggested the bbq wings and I also ordered the lemon pepper wings. Upon getting home and looking at my wings. I immediately noticed that the lemon pepper wings looked dry and over cooked. I also notice the different proportions of the wings. It was also evident that the wings were not fresh. Not sure where they buy their wings from but you could tell it was not quality. The bbq wings were ok but the chicken was tough and fried too hard. It was horrible. I will never go back. With so many great places to buy wings, there's no reason to visit this place. I'm not sure how this place got so many good reviews.  Maybe there was a different cook when I went but I was just not impressed.

18.description: My first visit to the new location. Again it is a little bit east of the old place. The new location is brighter and has sit down tables and they also carry soft drinks.You know the routine. The pricing goes in batches of six. I usually stick to the more popular items (cheesy buffalo, jerk, bourbon). My favorites are the garlicky ones with big pieces of garlic all over them. Yum.There's some construction on 75th. There was a Yelp deal available but I don't mind paying full price because I noticed that they are involved in the community and provide free meals to the homeless on Sundays.

41.description: Service was amazing. Food EVEN BETTER!! Great choice on a whim & they've earned a loyal customer!

52.description: Let me start by saying I don't even like bone in wings...but I love this place. Yes, service can be slow but it is well worth the wait. The chicken wings are cooked well, as in not too greasy or dry. They always taste fresh and obviously the sauce flavors are amazing. I even love the tenders. If you are in the area, don't go anywhere else for wings. If you aren't in the area, it is worth a weekend trip. FYI...my fave sauces are honey jerk, lemon pepper, and parmesan garlic.

50.description: I have been missing wings around the world for awhile not knowing they had re opened right down the street under new ownership. So glad to find the new location. And just like old times, the wings were on point!  Crispy and full of flavor. We got Parmesan garlic and Honey q.   Bursting with flavor. We will definitely be back.

4.description: Best wings in town!!! Working my way through the flavors, 10 down and looking forward the rest.I usually phone my order in, and when I get there 15 minutes later, it's ready! But if I had to wait around a few minutes I wouldn't mind. The place has a relaxed atmosphere.

6.description: Everything is made to order which is great but I was expecting something else. I was looking to get a fried wing smothered in some type of sauce like traditional buffalo or teriyaki wings. What I got was a fried wing with seasoning sprinkled on top of it. The mild sauce was a disgrace to Chicago's Mild sauce as it was just a spicy barbecue sauce. However now that I know what to expect I would visit again as the wings were fried to perfection, really crispy with a fluffiness to them.

22.description: Fast and friendly service. Wings were cool, I had the garlic Parmesan(had more of a ginger taste, I suppose b/c it was next to some ginger wings--and I'm not a ginger fan) , jerk honey bbq, and jerk. I have high 'jerk' expectations so that was my fault, knowing good and well It would be fried. The jerk bbq was just okay as well. The onion rings were delicious though!

15.description: Great food and the owner is wonderful great attitude i will be going back and i will tell everyone i know to go there and eat very satisfied customer.

57.description: I stumbled upon this gem as I was on the bus heading to school and passed by it. Since then, I've been back at least 5 times. They have so many flavor options and combinations, it's crazy. The garlic parmesan are my favorite but the BBQ and honey lemon are great too. Order ahead or be prepared to wait 15-20 minutes. They season them well with just the right amount of sauce, but sometimes the wings are inconsistent in size (last time I went they were super tiny). I don't see how anyone could try this place and not love it.

20.description: This honestly is probably the best place I've had as far as wings go. I got the Garlic and Cheesy Buffalo wings. So damn good.  I am a wing fanatic that has ate at wing spots all over the us. This has got to be one of the best I've had.   Staff was cool too.

36.description: Seriously better and better each time I go. Fantastic wings, week cooked, and a wide variety of imaginative flavors. I tried strawberry-q, honey jerk (my all time fave) and cheesy buffalo on my most recent visit. All were exceptional.Update: Shitty customer service. Went on a Monday for the 50 cent wings. Went to order and was told that the 50 cent wings were done. Asked what time they were available till and was told "till gone". Asked when they usually sell out by and was told " till gone". That reeks of bullshit.

14.description: Their wings are ssoooooo good, esp the hot ones because they definitely are hot.. I want to try the jumbo shrimp & maybe the jerk tacos, nachos or fries on my next visit

3.description: This is the slowest McDonald's I have ever been to. I just went here for the dollar sundae, so you'd think that would've been an in and out experience but no such luck. As if the wait in line wasn't enough there was another about 10 min wait for the sundae. I wouldn't come back to this McDonald's unless I was absolutely starving and had no other options. There are way too many McDonald's in the city to have to wait for ever at one.

1.description: Is it me or have the McDonald's restaurants around the south side have been taken over by hood idiots? I came here the other day for lunch since the location was on the way to my work  and it seems as if the workers there spend too much time running their mouths and not getting the orders out because the inside is always crowded and so is their drive thru. I ordered a large sweet tea-light ice (whoever made the drinks must not have been paying attention when the order called for LIGHT ice), large fries no salt-fries were cold and soggy when I got my order, and two fish sandwiches (neither barely had tartar sauce on them). I am too through with this location because they don't seem to be too concerned with the quality of service and making the food. I call them the workers that mommy and daddy had to force to get a job so they can start paying their own cell phone bills and other things like clothes.  Either way I am done with this location they've just worked my last nerve with the shitty service I've received numerous times. Don't bother going here until they decide to hire some real workers who want to have a job and not just because their parents made them get one.

2.description: This McDonald's has the worse service I have ever seen at a McDonald's. I watched and listened to the manager curse and rant about how the customers get on his nerves like I wasn't even sitting there in my car at the window. Like we made him work there. He needs to be put back on fries or something. Nothing dealing with humans at all. And to add to the situation the food was awful. This is not the first time I got bad food and bad service. It's right up the street from me and I'm never going back. They don't even deserve me going back to complain...

5.description: How can someone scrw up an order. When you give an order number assigned to a meal. Wrong order . food cold.   ridiculous and there was not enough ink in printer to read the frickren reciept

6.description: I just left Comer's Children Hospital with a sick 7 year, sleepy husband that school tomorrow and all of us were hungry. We stopped at two McDonald's both had people inside and no one ever answered the notification. Well, we caught the lazy, inept workers at the second one (69th and Lafayette - Dan Ryan). Guess McDonald's only wishes for exemplary service in OTHER neighborhoods. Uploading to send to corporate. I just saved them a few hundred $$ for a secret shopper - that's if they care youtu.be/K5lBp635Gso

0.description: I won't say I'm jumping for joy when it comes this McDonald's because I have had some good experiences and some bad ones.  They are slow and at times it seems like they are moving in slow motion while you are watching them from the sidelines wondering when will you get your food.I have had some cashiers that just smiled and asked me what my order was and others who look like I just stole their puppy.The last time I took my granddaughter here to get a Mighty Meal they forgot her apple slices and many people complained about things missing from their order.The tables were very dirty so I took my napkin to wipe off the table.  What I thought was rude is this while my granddaughter was finishing up her burger a lady came and wiped off the table and as the crumbs fell in our laps she said "Oh Sorry!" while we were sitting there and my grandbaby was in mid bite...Who does that?You can't clean the table now that we are sitting here or you say something before you begin to place that nasty looking rag on the table where I'm eating.Why did I give this place 3 stars instead of 1 like so many people have done in their reviews and hey I'm not judging I understand because you only get one chance to make a first impression.This McDonald's is in my neighborhood and yes they are slow most of the time but I have also had some great experiences here as well.  The food is always fresh and they are employing young people in the neighborhood.They do need to work on efficiency, timing and customer service for some.  They need to read the reviews and maybe even give a survey so they can better serve the community, because I have never gone into this McDonald's and it wasn't packed. Now, if I didn't live in the area I wouldn't travel to this McDonald's just to buy a burger but as long as I'm around I will come back.They do need to restructure and get their timing together because when you go to McDonald's you are looking for Fast Food not Slow Food...was that too much...lolAnyway, I will be back but that's only because they are close and my grand baby loves getting her McDonald toys.Enjoy!!!

4.description: I had no problem with the service! They were very polite, and the service was fast enough. I have to say that those of you who are bashing this establishment, consider what these employees are paid for their work, consider that this isn't the greatest area and they get to deal with people (as I noticed) that take quite a while to get their order communicated. Seriously, this isn't wealthy suburbia, here, but they're doing their job and the wheels are turning. I was the only person in the place that clearly wasn't from the area. Do you think they treated me differently, because of it, NOPE! We're the speakers pumpin' out Snoop (an all-time great), YEP! -Lighten up!

1.description: Reason for 1 star1. Cashier... Very unprofessional younger gentleman proceeds to have a conversation with a person on the opposite side of the order window instead of taking my order.2. Noticed people standing around in the back when the curtain was ajar... Didn't look productive at all. 3. The waiting area was cold. And very uninviting. 4. The food was not to my liking. I ordered 2 jerk dinners . I asked for yams but they ran out.. I settled for cabbage and red beans and rice. The chicken was very dry. The cabbage was different... very spicy and lacks flavor. The red beans and rice wasn't terrible... Definitely had better. Thanks for reading

2.description: Food is PITIFUL a DISGRACE..!!! Chicken has NO taste whatsoever.The sides was literally like a table spoon scoop.Was totally a waste of  money.

0.description: Great food. Great service. Often gets mistaken for the one down the street. But this place is definitely better. Fast service too

1.description: Thank goodness for Yelp! I read the reviews here and decided to take my Granny here for her 100th Birthday! She's never had a manicure in her life so this was a treat. Dione was our nail technician and she did a fabulous job. We got the no chip gel polish in silver glitter. I'll attach the pics so you can see. I won't know how long the gels last yet since I'll be leaving my Granny today after 2 days of polish wear. The whole process wasn't long at all and you need to make an appointment. The place was very clean and the interior design was beautiful with accents of purple. I'll attached photos as well. I found the salon to be out of place in the neighborhood since it was residential with no neighboring stores. That being said if you're in the neighborhood make sure to stop by and get your nails did!

9.description: This is absolutely the best nail salon I have ever been to! The service is outstanding the sanitation practices are phenomenal and the pampering session is just what the doctor ordered! And to put the icing on the cake it is a black nail salon- such a rare gem !  Im done searching! Thank You Nina!

23.description: Was looking on Yelp for a nail salon that was in my area (did not want to drive far) and that was different from the average Asian salons that are in my area . Came across "A Polished Work" and was instantly curious. The reviews were good and the pictures of the decor that was posted online was gorgeous. I was uncertain of the area where the salon was located because Chicago has some sketchy parts that you should stay away from but decided to give it a try.First, let me say, the area is fine. The salon is located on a very busy street with constant traffic and a beautiful, well-lit park across the street. There was plenty of street parking and the salon is right on the corner. Secondly, the moment I walked in I knew that this was not your "typical" nail salon. The decor was even better in person. It was warm, welcoming, and the type of environment you would want for a "me" day! Thirdly, the owner, Monica, who happen to be the lady that I made my appointment with, greeted me and told me she would be with me shortly. Once she got me soaking for my pedicure she offered me a glass of wine, tea, or water. I went for the wine of course :-)I was extremely pleased with my pedicure. Monica did a great job and it was honestly one of the best pedicures I have ever had. I did not feel like I was being rushed through the process like I always do at other salons. She really took the time to give me a quality pedicure and catered to my specific needs. She even gave me some tips on how to care for my feet between pedicures and she introduced me to pedi-socks, love them.This is now my new favorite nail salon in Chicago. I highly recommend it. Loved everything about it. My feet thank you!

25.description: Had the pleasure of taking my 7 yr old daughter and my 16 yr old niece there for a special mani/pedi treat.  They have a really nice pack for kids under 12 called a the princess. Also, the carry a lot of specials.  They treated the girls there like "princesses". Everything from the pretty colors of their nails to the color changes of the water was cute.  Even found a color to match my daughter's Easter dress. I'm a man so not into the mani/pedi stuff, so was able to get connected to their WiFi and watch a movie on my tablet. They even convinced me to get a manly hand scrub and nail cleaning. Overall, very nice and clean place. Music throughout.

12.description: LOVE LOVE this place!!! Quality is everything to me. The nail polish are quality!! The service is elite! The atmosphere is peaceful and relaxing! The ladies are professional! It's blacked owed! My feet are always on point!!!

21.description: I visited A Polished Work at the end of a very long Friday. The experience was great. I was offered a beverage as soon as I walked in, the decor is very cute, and I did not have to wait long for my service. The owner, Monica, gave me a flawless pedicure and helped me with a color choice. I will be back!

16.description: I found this place on Yelp, because I was tired of looking for a quality nail salon on the south east side of Chicago (I usually travel North or to the south loop). I am thankful that I found this little gem. It is clean, cute, priced reasonably, black owned and Monica is great. My only recommendation would be to add gel fills to their online booking. Other than that great service - try them!

17.description: Was looking on Yelp for a nail salon that was in my area (did not want to drive far) and that was different from the average Asian salons that are in my area . Came across "A Polished Work" and was instantly curious. The reviews were good and the pictures of the decor that was posted online was gorgeous. I was uncertain of the area where the salon was located because Chicago has some sketchy parts that you should stay away from but decided to give it a try.First, let me say, the area is fine. The salon is located on a very busy street with constant traffic and a beautiful, well-lit park across the street. There was plenty of street parking and the salon is right on the corner. Secondly, the moment I walked in I knew that this was not your "typical" nail salon. The decor was even better in person. It was warm, welcoming, and the type of environment you would want for a "me" day! Thirdly, the owner, Monica, who happen to be the lady that I made my appointment with, greeted me and told me she would be with me shortly. Once she got me soaking for my pedicure she offered me a glass of wine, tea, or water. I went for the wine of course :-)I was extremely pleased with my pedicure. Monica did a great job and it was honestly one of the best pedicures I have ever had. I did not feel like I was being rushed through the process like I always do at other salons. She really took the time to give me a quality pedicure and catered to my specific needs. She even gave me some tips on how to care for my feet between pedicures and she introduced me to pedi-socks, love them.This is now my new favorite nail salon in Chicago. I highly recommend it. Loved everything about it. My feet thank you!

10.description: I really like this place. I've been coming here for about almost a year. I haven't had any problems or issues. This location is about 15 minutes away from the South Loop but it's worth the drive. Other nail places usually make my cuticles bleed but not this place. I'm happy that a found a place with great nail technicians.

5.description: I am always trying to support black owned businesses & this is no exception.  Very professional services provided however I found the manicure station to be very untidy.   That was truly a turn off to me especially since it was first thing in the morning.    Not enough to keep me away, just a housekeeping tip.

11.description: Worst nail experience EVER! Very inexperienced technicians. My nails looked a hot mess after spending 2 hours here. Yelp is usually very help but they were dead wrong about this place. This place is definitely not 4 stars. Plus the manicure chairs are superrrr uncomfortable. Not worth the time or the headache. Save your money and choose more experienced people to work on your nails.

22.description: I recently moved to the area and needed a closer nail salon. This is definitely the place. It's a boutique like nail salon. Monica was great! And my toes look awesome. I highly recommend visiting this hidden gem for your nail services. To top it off! It's very clean!

0.description: Where do I begin.... A Polished Work Nail Spa is the gem of the south side!! Cozy, comforting and always worth the trip!  My daughter and I have been patrons of Tomocha for over 3 years now (including time at a spa that no longer exists) and we would not trust our mani-no chip and pedicures to anyone else. The shop "black owned" a refreshing change from most nail shops in the area and surrounding area which hustle you in like cattle, barely have a word to say to you and speak in other languages to their peers while servicing you.  Instead, A Polished Work Nail Spa treats you like royalty with complimentary beverages, a bit of shop humor from time to time and professional, fabulous service!  I pray this shop lasts forever and future expansion would only add to the great service!

20.description: I really love this Nail Spa. The customer service was awesome. These ladies were very professional yet they made me feel as if  I have been coming here forever. The space is beautiful. They are very clean. As soon a you're done with your service, someone is right behind to bleach & sanitize the station & utensils.

19.description: I LOVE this place! From the relaxing environment to the professional & friendly staff. My no chip mani & pedi were perfect thanks to Ariel. Not to mention, you actually see them disinfect the bowls and tools after use! I'm so glad I was introduced to this hidden gem.

2.description: Amazing place, best nail salon I have been to in chicago thus far. Very thorough and they take their time to do an awesome job. Very professional and most of all black owned! Very low key intimate location, nice aura and not full of people. Quality work, will definately be back for all of my future services, they go above and beyond.Now!!! The only reason I did not give them 5 stars is because they wrote my credit card information down without permission and did not destroy it adequately, instead of shredded, it was balled up and thrown into the trash. Someone in a previous post said bring cash, guess I should have taken that advice, but hey things happen and their machine was down. Although a negative, not enough to keep me away, the great work and service still got them 4 stars ;) Would recommend

18.description: OMG! I love this place!! Monica is AWESOME. The setting is intimate and friendly. The decor is beautiful. The owners are great. This is my new place. The other thing I loved about this place is that Monica educates you on the care you are receiving. You should definitely come here.

13.description: Mocha did an excellent job on my nails and feet. She is an asset to the team. Very accommodating by offering a beverage and a towel when needed. This is a peaceful and relaxing shop. The decor gives added tranquility. There are not any harsh fumes nor inappropriate conversations going on which makes the experience heightened.

4.description: Had an AMAZING SPA day! Walking in the salon was very warm and welcoming! Gorgeous decor! Monica was very professional and personable as she took care of my nails today. My pedicure was great from start to finish. She recommended some tips for at home care! She took her to time and asked questions along the way to make sure I was comfortable. I really appreciate a salon that focus on great customer service. The salon is also very clean! Right after your service, the utilities  are cleaned properly! The color selection is great as well! I had a hard time just picking one! Support great black owned business!

24.description: A DIAMOND in the rough! The Grand Crossing area is not some horrible nightmare; however, finding a gem such as this salon is a rarity, but a blessing. Selected this location on the whim when I realized my go to nail salon was not open on Mondays. Peeked around on Yelp and saw this was nearby and open...yes, on a Monday!The atmosphere was very inviting. Lovely interior design! You walk in and definitely know this is the place to be pampered!My nail technician, Monica, was phenomenal!!! From the moment she opened the door till the moment I left, she made me feel welcomed. You almost feel as if you're being welcomed into her home. Her experience is very evident and she shows that customer service is a top priority for her. Applauds all around!!! So good you want to keep it to yourself as your own special treat, but everyone needs a taste of this awesome experience! Black owned and a great experience is an unfortunate rarity, so please go and support those who break through the stereotype......I definitely will!

6.description: A Polished Work is certainly a 5 star nail salon that reeks of class and style. From the warm and welcoming reception offered to all who enter, to the very professional services received A Polished Work never disappoints me. This gem on the south side of the city is the absolute perfect place to treat yourself to a manicure or pedicure in an environment carefully created to ensure relaxation.

15.description: I visited A Polished Work at the end of a very long Friday. The experience was great. I was offered a beverage as soon as I walked in, the decor is very cute, and I did not have to wait long for my service. The owner, Monica, gave me a flawless pedicure and helped me with a color choice. I will be back!

7.description: I absolutely loved my experience at A Polished Work. My cousin and I had a little girls day. Monica did her nails and Mocha did mine. I'm sure she (my cousin) will agree with everything I have to say. I have been going to shops owned by Koreans for about 4 years straight. My usual was an overlay but also a pedicure every now and then. I won't demean anyone's business but after yesterday I will never step foot in one of those shops again. Mocha gave me an experience as a nail tech that I'd  never had before. I came to her with an overlay that hadn't been filled in a month and month old chipped polish on my toes. I was ready to let the overlay go because I could see the health of my nails deteriorating. Not only did she do an amazing job.. Every step she took and every product she used she explained what it was and what it would do. She was honest about the state of my nails but also assured me that we would get them back healthy. The shop is clean and the decor was beautiful. My cousin and and I both got a mani pedi. The ladies were very professional, punctual, but also hilarious. I just had a great experience overall and as Mocha said "do you want to be a client or a customer" because there is a huge difference..I'm now a client. Yes the prices are a little higher than your neighborhood shop BUT it is black owned and the products and services are of QUALITY! More in depth review with pics coming soon!

8.description: After numerous attempts at trying to book manis and pedis for 3 people (without success) I decided to just drop by A Polished Work.  Upon arrival I saw two police cars. When I went in I was relieved to see the officers making a friendly business visit.  This is definitely a safe nail salon.  Unfortunately I was not greeted with a beverage offer, but I assumed this was because of the understaffing.  Nonetheless my therapist Ariel did an amazing job on my feet.  I explained to her how I enjoy the natural experience and she performed like a pro! Once this location is fully staffed I believe this salon will be a great place for a girl's event.  If you are into girl talk and keeping up with the latest trends this is the place for you. Please support Monica...this is definitely a rare gem.

3.description: My first time going great services, staff is polite and friendly the salon is cute and clean.

14.description: I really love this Nail Spa. The customer service was awesome. These ladies were very professional yet they made me feel as if  I have been coming here forever. The space is beautiful. They are very clean. As soon a you're done with your service, someone is right behind to bleach & sanitize the station & utensils.

3.description: I was pleasantly surprised at how well lit and inviting the interior was. Vast alcohol selection although the space can get to be a bit tight. Overall a hidden gem that I would've never thought to go to had I not been meeting a friend who frequents. Happy I checked it out and would return!

1.description: They have the potential to be a nice mingling spot. BUTTTTTTT as previously stated the staff SUCKS! They have the biggest nastiest attitudes I'VE EVER SEEN. I was there this past Saturday and we were made to stand in line outside in the cold for 30 mins (although they let 20 pplout). This irritated the hell out of me. Then we finally get in its wall to wall ppl. Beyond it's capacity level by law I'm sure. We fight our way to the bar and my husband patiently waits 30 mins for drinks and some 6ft tall light skin female gives the bar a speech on being patient and she heard their requests. SHE WAS ALL DRAMA!!! Needless to say we got our drinks, never tipped her and left. This is my 4 or 5th time in here and it's always something with these bartenders. The music is just OK. They play alot of r&b & 90s rap. I WISH LARISTOS WAS STILL OPEN!!!!!

0.description: Best chill place around the neighborhood. I love it here! The DJ is always doing his thing! The security at the door is tight so I never have to worry if the night will be ruined. Drinks are always on point! Two bartenders I always deal with, Jackie and Chrissy. They make em right! Never had an issue with those ladies! I recommend this place to anyone just looking to chill and have a good time! No foolery, no freshly legal young adults, just a good time! Best place to watch the game too. I will be going back!

2.description: First time last nite..had a great time!! No drama, nice crowd and very good music! Will definitely be going back!!!

5.description: You have to be BUZZED into this place. You just cant walk-in. I like.This is a Bears Bar; Live DJ who is on point with the jams. A lot of old-old heads were in here with a mixture of mid-age peeps; so I felt very very comfortable and eased and not if I needed to be alert. This is the kind of place you can let your guard down in. The 2 Barista was great, funny, and attentive to a full house, WOW!. GOTTA find out when my co-worker is taking me back. I am a newby to Chicago living downtown so it was nice to get from the stuck-up bars around Michigan Ave and sit around real life loving peeps.  ONE!

6.description: I really enjoyed myself at the President's Lounge!The Vibe, the People, the Ciroc Obamas.....and the House Music All Night Long was on point.  The female restroom, so clean that I frequented it more than once :D "...Everybody in the club getting tip-sy...!"

7.description: Fun times! Came here with friends for drinks during the winter time and had a blast. Ciroc Obamas are great drinks that taste delicious but will get the job done. Music's pretty good and there's a range of ages which is cool. Fun place and I'd go there again, so fun. And as Montez G. mentioned, you have to be let in.

8.description: Had a great evening at the President's.  Nikko makes great drinks and is extremely knowledgeable and friendly.

9.description: IF you love freedom of speech..DO NOT GO HERE!!! It's a 30 and over crowd, but if you speak an adjective. Beat down... one would think there's children in the house.  I've never seen a more intense as in rules and regulations in a karaoke place ( there maybe different themes on different  nights if so, i'm have a suspicious feeling they're regulating them as they did  this night ).  There's no script to karaoke, you do you, freelance, be it on the lyrics or ad lib.  Adjectives were used by a Sistah that was on the mic, and  she did apologize for them.. nothing a 30 & over crowd haven't heard  before ( teenager use worse ). Long story short, the karaoke dj approached and said you can't do that. He also approach another Sistah and told her she couldn't dance in the back round or sing with her friend.. WOW, the celebrities I know don't act like that.. Hood mentality..  After all that after thought drama.. the bartender had something to add, which was based on his emotions. He tried to explain, some body momma was in there ( relative to the owner or manager ) and you just can't say adjectives, out of respect. Now it's wasn't harsh like that. Never the less, this is a public establishment and if ya' momma haven't heard this by now,, well lets just say " she frontin".. smh.. Oh, after all that, he wouldn't give  the same Sistah a glass of water ( she paid for several drinks ).  He said the lights were on and he couldn't give any drinks.. It's water not alcohol.  So  I ordered some water and the Sistah behind the bar gave it to me and I gave it to the Cutie with the adjectives..lol.. All she could say was Wow, in regards to the bartender and i think the whole night.. so on  that note. to my New Yorkers, Cali crew, Floridian people..  I would advise to skip this venue and try somewhere more people / out of town friendly environment. If you ever end up here just smile at the fair skin bartender with the under the lip piercing. He's the emotional guy that likes to play tuff with females and refuse to give them water when they have been spending their $$$ there. Also if ya' momma is in the house please remember this is a public establishment and we are paying our $$$. SO IN ALL REALITY WE KEEP THIS SHIT OPEN not Ya' MOMMA/ No disrespect intended . I just saying, people can make you and when you treat them with DISRESPECT, you break ya'self...Bystander listening to the whole scenario.. So wrong!!!

10.description: Great local bar, clean, good music, and solid drinks

4.description: I really like this place overall and come periodically. (Hence the 3 stars instead of ONE for the CONTINUOUS RUDE ENCOUNTER). I just have a bad experience with the male bartender EVERY time I encounter him.  I typically come on Friday or Saturday nights, but I went on a Tuesday night this last time, since the NBA finals game 6 fell on a Tuesday.       Ok, so usually I avoid the light skinned male bartender at all costs and order drinks from any of the ladies that are always pleasant to deal with - heck they even speak and smile when they see me (yes I tip well)! So this night one of my friends (didn't know any better) asks HIM to make our drinks.  And since she was dealing with HIM directly and I wanted to see his attitude with her, I waited for the conversation to unfold naturally. She ordered her drink, and he came back with it and she proceeded to order 2 more drinks (mine and another friend of ours) he immediately snapped and told her to hurry up and she should have ordered all the drinks at one time! WOW..  She brushed it off & ordered the drinks.  I watched him across the bar make my drink with Patron instead of Don Julio (which is what she ordered for me). He also poured the other drink wrong too!  When he came over to us with the drinks she told him the errors and he said ok I'll remake the margarita, but you ordered this other drink wrong, and that's not my fault. O_O  I leaned in to tell him she wanted the Jack Daniels Honey instead of the reg Jack and could he be so kind to take care of that - he snapped at me and said she ordered this wrong, and next time maybe you should order your own drink! (FLOORED) I told him this was not my drink the margarita was, and as a matter of fact I don't even need you to remake my drink.     He immediately threw the incorrect Patron drink down the sink and said, "No problem!" (body language said the rest) I said to him, "You are very rude" and he said he didn't care!  I couldn't believe it! So he made her pay for the wrong Jack and when she asked for a glass of water he ignored her and walked back and forth past her w/o acknowledging her request ever!  I was so pissed at how rude he was, right in front of other customers too!  I walked away and ordered my drink from the lady on the opposite side of the bar - always pleasant.       Its sad to see a nice establishment with rude employees.  This is the type of thing that can make or break a business.  Customers are your paycheck!  You have to be accommodating to people paying their money - or they will go to a place that WILL accommodate them.  I hope the owner/management speaks to this man and he gets his act together, or let him go already! I'm sure I am not the only person who feels this way.  Maybe he's related to the management/owner and that's how he still has a job.  I hope to NEVER have to deal with this man EVER!  And LADIES if you go to this bar, please take my advice and order your drinks from the women bartenders, they are SUPERB!

0.description: Freshly renovated with The Weave Shop next door. Plenty of parking right in front of the store. They carry all major brand of hair extensions. They have a monthly specials on every categories of beauty supplies. People there know their products

Great little boutique!  Ella the owner is wonderful.  She is passionate about her clothing and accessories and designs many of her own clothes. Ella truly cares about her customers. If you are a church lady or a red hatter, you must shop here.  She has limited hours but easily accommodates appointments.   Fun place to shop on the south side!

3.description: The Long Islands are the bomb and they have a variety of flavors to choose from. They come in a huge, giant mug for only $12.00 (?), I think. They have a DJ on some nights and can get crowed on the weekends. I think every Thursday or the first Saturday of the month is Ladies night. It's worth the visit for the drinks. I plan to visit again.Re: The Long Islands are a little smaller but are still the bomb. I believe they use to be in 22oz mugs and now are in 16oz mugs. There are still very strong and so worth the money. I like to stop by Leos 1st before visiting other clubs to get my drink on. Lol...

1.description: I'm really disappointed about Monday nights, it used to be Showtime doing the karaoke, but now it's some woman named Lady Red who is all about texting the selections and she would rather be all about when you put it in rather when the next singer is.I'm pretty upset about this, and it makes anyone texting a song having to wait an hour easy to sing.She seems pretty sure people will come back but I'm sure I won't, she makes the singers feel second rate, although the bartender is great and is doing his best to keep everyone happy and the bar is well-stocked.All in all a good experience in having a drink, but the karaoke is a mess and makes me not want to come back.The neighborhood is supposed to be kinda sketchy but I've never had a problem with it, but it's a shame the karaoke has taken such a bad turn.

2.description: I must say this place has the best martinis I've ever had!  I'm not sure what the ingredients were but I enjoyed a "Relax...Its Lavender" martini, and omg it was amazing!  I will definitely visit again when I am in Chicago, they make martinis with all types of liquor and having over 150+ to choose from is an experience.

0.description: Pleasantly surprised!! Wonderful martini lounge hidden behind the bar!! They have about 200 martinis to choose from.. The bartender was friendly as well.. Will definitely be back soon to see Erica!!

3.description: Use to be good  the worst pizza on the south side no sauce on meat just thin bread ..don't know if New owners or just don't care about with there serve people I will not be going there anymore.

1.description: I came here because most of the people raved about how good the pizza was and it was in my neighborhood so I thought why not check it out...Um er yeah...No...can I say Nasty!!!I don't know what other people had or tasted but my melted cheese and sausage on the hard dry brick bread was anything but tasty.The only reason I didn't give it one star is because the lady behind the counter was so nice as I tried to figure out what I wanted on my pizza.  I went for the Indo(which is a cool name for individual pizza) I had cheese and sausage and my friend had peperoni and cheese....I have to say hers was better than mine but it didn't make me want to make the trip again to taste  the other items that they sell here at all!!!I mean its cool they stay open late but I need my food to be good no matter how long you are open...When I smelled the pizza I was like mmmmmmmmmmm  but it did not taste as good as it smelled and I was so disappointed....I'm glad I got the indo because it was only $6.86 for one topping.I should have known I wasn't going to like the food when the workers had outside food delivered to them and they serve more than pizza...ijs(I'm just saying)The pizza took less than 20 minutes to be done and that was a plus but again I say I still need my food to be good...I don't know what the difference as far as prep for the sausage and the pepperoni but the person that made mine needs to take pointers from the one that made the other pizza.I really wanted to like this place...no love this place since it is very close but um er that didn't happen!!!Try it maybe it is for you but it's not for me and this is one of those joints I won't be back too...I can't believe some compared it to Italian Fiesta and they are not even what they use to be back in the day, but dang they are better then this place...ijs   The only thing this place has over this place is price because they have not been the same in years...but truth be told if I had to take the Margarita's Pizzeria II pill or the Italian Fiesta pill...I would take Italian Fiesta!!!Customer Service is great but at the end of the day I need my food to be just a great!!Hey at the end of the day...It's up to you this is just my humble opinion!!!Enjoy!!!

0.description: Great pizza if been going here for years better than Italian fiesta, best then crust in the city ,i don't eat pork and there beef pizza is the best they actually season the ground beef unlike most places which leaves the meat tasing bland and flavorless I.e geordonos

2.description: Was told by friends that this place is better than Italian Fiesta. Sooo I just had to try it and I was not disappointed . Called my order in for a large half pepperoni/half chicken pizza and it was ready in less than 25 minutes.The pizza is delicious and the service was great as well . I will be returning especially since I didn't have to deal with rude employees like if I went to Italian Fiesta!!

5.description: I went here the pizza was really good.. Salty but good.. Not sure If Ill be back .. I got a small just to try it out and I wasn't given any Parmesan crushed peppers bc I ordered a small.. Ill keep going to Genos in Harvey which is way close some what of the same taste less salt

6.description: First time here. Saw a pic on a friends IG and the pizza looked great... The pizzas very good! Better than Italian Fiesta! I will be returning.

7.description: I was a little concerned based off reviews but I placed my order sausage and pepperoni w/extra sauce. Excellent & they also accept debit cards now

8.description: Absolutely great. Not too greasy just right.

9.description: Best pizza on the south side hands down

10.description: We were loyal customers until today, one week ago we ordered a pizza and they gave us the wrong topping, we called and told them , and they said your next pizza is free( great, Leona's will send you a corrected pizza the same day), today we try to get our free pizza and needless to say, we did not get our pizza, they said they would give us 3$ off ????, can we say poor customer service!!! SMH

4.description: I love the pizza, to me they have Italian Fiesta faded plus they take credit cards. The sauce is awesome and as well as the crust. I highly recommend this spot!!!

1.description: South Side candy store that sells massive quantities of all your childhood favorites like Frooties, Long Boys, Chews, Now & Laters, etc. It's like Costco or Sam's Club but with candy and chips only. All the folks you see selling candy in the street and on the L have likely bought their supply out of this store.Best part about this store is the QUANTITY. Normally you can only get this type of candy in a few pieces from gas stations and corner stores, but this place sells gigantic tubs of your favorite $0.10 candy. If you like to binge, this is your place.Let's just say that this store isn't located in Lincoln Park. The neighborhood is a bit on the rough side, so I probably wouldn't bring some of my North Side buddies here. Parking can be tricky. Diagonal parking in the front that always fills up quick but there is a private lot behind the place that a lot of people don't know about.

0.description: You know those kids who are always out selling M&Ms "for their football team" downtown outside of the train stations?  Well, I've finally found out where they buy their product - L&P Foods.  Of course, most transplants and carpetbaggers would never consider venturing to L&P, as it's on the dreaded South Side of Madison.  It's a shame most North Siders will never drive south of Madison to experience the wide thoroughfares, architecture, parks and history of the South Side.  The South Side isn't entirely the Berlin of April,1945, folks.  L&P is basically a wholesale food outlet that's about 10 minutes from the Loop via the Dan Ryan (sans traffic).  It's directly adjacent to the expressway and 30 seconds off of the ramp.  It's sort of a Costco or Sam's Club for the hood.  You should go to L&P if you need the following cheap: 50 packs of Sixlets, 50-pack boxes of Vitner's chips, huge boxes of meatballs, huge boxes of chicken fingers and other kinds of bulk frozen meats and junk food.  As for the kids who sell those M&Ms downtown, they likely buy their 50-pack M&M boxes at L&P for $25 and then sell them downtown "for their football team" at $1 apiece.  That's a 100% profit, sports fans.  Not bad.If you've got a big family to feed, a convenience store to stock or a need to stockpile your junk food, then L&P is your place.  Four stars.

28.description: I came here Thursday, this place is like a daycare than a nail salon. The kid run up and down, and the young tech is not focus to do my nail at all. I need a place to relax for my lunch time and get my nail done. Overall, this place is new, so I hope the management make an adjustment. The tech need to focus on the customer, not themselves, and turn on the funky music. The music is annoy, the kid is running. Don't get me wrong, I have 3 kids, but they are not belong to nail salon. I need to look for a different nail salon and not a daycare.

1.description: Just got my nails done by JoAnne. I got a full acrylic set, almond shaped. They look great. I'll definitely be back.

9.description: I only come here to do my nails. Joanne is AMAZING and does a fantastic No Chip! I would highly recommend coming here.

29.description: The manicure/ pedicures are OK. Just OK. They have a good color selection, however they opened just 6-7 weeks ago and some seem old/dried already. My issue with the location is they are too pushy and opinionated. I do not want my color choice debated when I pick a nude  for my toes and a green for my nail. I would prefer if the technician didn't tell me I'm putting the wrong color on my toes. Also I have now been here twice and both times the lady doing my manicure has brusquely  told me "you need your eyebrows done". This is annoying to me for two reasons; For one it's a rude way to present an option for add on services and another  I had both times JUST had my brows done only days before and I know they don't need to be done, A more subtle approach would be nice. Another issue I experienced is that I  like my nails cut very short. Both times I requested so, the technician acted like it was a ridiculous request and made me feel as though I was requesting something outrageous. The first time I asked three times for my nails to be cut short, this time I didn't  fight with the lady. She half heartedly cut them down after the first time i requested (Note she originally didn't even ask if i wanted them cut and started the manicure with only filling)  I know i'll need them trimmed in three days, but i'll have a polish changed else where.  Over all- manicure/pedicures are OK (at best) the location is convenient, but the experience is lacking completely.

23.description: The team did a great job, I got a lavender pedi and a no chip mani.  The salon is clean, the ceiling reminds me of Cesar's Palace in Vegas with the clouds and everyone is so nice. The salon is still pretty new so the weeks are slow :-)

5.description: I love this place it's very clean and calming and the staff it's fast and friendly, Joanne has been doing my nails lately and she is extremely good, my nails last longer with her than anybody I been to precious to this place and she is very meticulous so they look perfect !!

31.description: This place is amazing! Extremely clean, comfortable and spacious. John did an amazing job on my liquid gels. They look very thin & natural and he took the time to make sure the shape was just to my liking on each nail. Everyone was extremely friendly. I will be back!

25.description: I went again and wanted 4th of July nails! My experience is always nice and friendly and efficient. I have always seen Kim. However my friend has seen different guys and got a full set a couple times and she has loved it as well! Check out my pics for how good my nails look.

12.description: Love Kelly and her team!! I always get a ton of people wanting to know where I get my nails done!

21.description: GREAT no-chip manicure and good prices.  The woman who did my nails here was careful, thorough, consistent, and very clearly knew what she was doing.She was friendly, helpful, and offered some other services but wasn't pushy.The fifth star is withheld because of the grouchy man who works there who barked orders at other customers and employees in a way that very much disrupted an otherwise very relaxing experience.  Go when he's not there and it would be pure bliss!!

16.description: I tried this place today and I can definitely say after this experience I'm sure I won't return.  This place is only a block away from my job and since I was only getting a no chip thought I would be in and out...One hour fifteen minutes tops. I was wrong...A WHOLE TWO HOURS FOR A NO CHIP! And that was the only service I wanted. Would've been longer if I hadn't had to turn off the nice chick routine and show my complete disdain at their efforts.  The technician was very meticulous (or confused) as she studied each nail for a long period of time before moving onto the next one....And then going back again. For reasons totally unbeknownst to me.  It's only an okay job, but for two hours of back and forth over the same ten nails, no toes included, I'm expecting the best manicure ever. Nope. Plus, the polish seemed to be pretty clumpy. I should've run when I noticed that in the first place. They give you so many reasons to strike them out as a go to nail salon. I walked in asking how much they charged for a no chip. I was told $35. Cool, because that's less than what I normally pay. However, when I got ready to pay I was told $40, but they would only charge the 35 this time. Next time I'd be charged 40 unless I signed up for a membership. I wish the hell I would!The lady that did my nails spoke very little English so the communication barrier became a huge issue every time I asked her anything. I wanted my nails rounded. She did it upon the first filing, then after she finished both hands, she went back to clipping the nails on the previous hand in square fashion. I had to 'show' her that one hand was rounded and now she'd turned the other one square. Which made no sense because now she was clipping and filing again to make them even...and shorter. Meanwhile, time is flying by and I'm looking at my watch like what the heck lady? It was like she was an OCD polisher because she just kept going back and forth....I mean way more than what's typically normal. I watched two people get finished up with their nails and two people start up before I left. The people that left came after I did. What's wrong with this picture? You're in downtown Chicago. The ideal woman/customer is trying to come in and get out during a lunchbreak. I started getting frustrated. Then it doesn't help, as I saw in another review, when they come around and 'tell' you that you need brow service. I don't even know how well you do with brows and so far I'm not impressed with the nail service so no thank you! She was pretty in your face about it too. Go away! She was also the translator so she came back more times than I expected I would see her. When I told my tech to stop polishing after she was slowly revving up to put on my third (felt like eighth) coat off polish, she didn't understand and the translator had to come back and tell her to put on my finishing coat. Finally! But translator tech sees my frustration and I guess in an attempt to smooth things over keeps telling me my nails are pretty and it's a nice job, wanting me to affirm same. I don't care at this point. I want to leave. She goes away and my tech completes the final polish. But then she wants to do the hand massage. Please spare me lady! So I had to tell her no thank you on that part and she smiled and tried to do it anyway. Annoying! Please stop holding me hostage!!!So with all those things in mind, I can pretty much guarantee that I will not be back at LD! The one star is because they are super clean and the atmosphere seems it could be relaxing....if only you could get decent service.

17.description: This may sound weird, but I'm glad my go to nail salon closed as I would have never discovered LD Nails & Spa! Grayson did a great job on my nails and I like how they offer member pricing. Member prices are $2-5 less than non-member prices and it makes no sense to NOT be a member since sign up is free, and you earn points which then can be used towards future services. Will definitely be coming back.

10.description: What can I say- I like to slice and serve so need my nails to always look good. I Received VIP treatment here with a nice selection of music.. (If you like Ryan Cabrera or EDM you'll love this spot).  This place is Brand new so everything salon is very clean- not to mention HUGE. I only only wish I had more than two friends so we could get our toes did together. I had a gel manicure and spa pedicure and they did a great job. The Gel is pricey but so is being a female. I'll def be back for my standing mani/pedi appt.

11.description: Great no-chip manicure. The woman was fast and did a great job making sure everything looked even and was tried perfectly. I would definitely go back and try a regular manicure there as well.

26.description: I've been going to LD Nail & Spa in West Loop for 3 months now since just after they opened..  So happy with this place I won't go any where else !!!  Store itself and All the equipment is new, clean and high quality.  I've had UV Gel manicure, Pedicure & Eyebrows done.  Very happy with all the services and the entire staff.  I recommend you request John for Manicure & Pedicure -  He does a great job & is my favorite on staff :-)

27.description: The pedicure here was good and the tech who gave the pedicure was totally fine as well. It's the person "in charge" that really pissed me off and ruined the experience. When I got there it was very busy. I had to wait. Not an issue. However, no one even acknowledged my existence at all. I "signed in", but little did I know, no one even looks at the sign-in sheet. So why the hell have it? I picked out my color and had a seat to wait my turn. Still...not a problem. The problem came when another customer walked in the door, asked for a pedicure and was immediately given a chair. Huh? WTF? Hellooo, I've been freaking sitting here for ten minutes, you oblivious jerks.  How about you check that useless sign-in sheet you have there. I spazzed out, made a scene and got a chair, but still waited longer than the girl who just freaking walked in the damn door. Pay attention, dumbasses. I tipped the tech because I'm fairly sure he had nothing to do with the debacle. So, in closing...I probably won't be back. I haven't found a ton of alternatives in the area, but I'll keep looking. They just really pissed me off...a lot.

35.description: What can I say- I like to slice and serve so need my nails to always look good. I Received VIP treatment here with a nice selection of music.. (If you like Ryan Cabrera or EDM you'll love this spot).  This place is Brand new so everything salon is very clean- not to mention HUGE. I only only wish I had more than two friends so we could get our toes did together. I had a gel manicure and spa pedicure and they did a great job. The Gel is pricey but so is being a female. I'll def be back for my standing mani/pedi appt.

0.description: I love coming here! I would recommend this place to anyone and have gotten both pedicures and no chip manis. I always see Joanne, she is amazing!!!First, the spa is really clean and inviting and has a very relaxing atmosphere that I appreciate during the hectic work day :) I come during lunch and don't have to wait and get back to work on time too.Joanne does an amazing job, she is very meticulous and always makes my nails look amazing. She spends her time to make sure that my no chips last for two weeks and still somehow manages to move very quickly so I don't over stay my lunch break! If you work or live in the area, this place should be your new go to! I tell everyone about it! Go see Joanne!

20.description: Was so disappointed with what should be considered standard customer service that I created a Yelp just for this post. I purchased the no chip mani Groupon a while back. Per the instructions on the Groupon, I called last week to make my appointment, noting that I'd be using it as payment. I showed up 10 minutes ahead of time and an employee who was working on someone else asked how she could help me. I began saying "I have an appointment at 6..." when she cut me off, telling me to "go sit over there" and pointed to the opposite side of the room. About 10 minutes later, she dropped a box full of nail samples in front of me and told me to choose a color, walking away again. The next time she passed, I asked her if it would be alright to put my tip on a card (although I brought cash, just in case). She responded, "next time bring cash."I'm not easily offended, so none of these things are what pushed me to give this place such a poor rating. I was turned away for no good reason. After conferring amongst themselves, a different employee came by and stated  they will not honor a valid Groupon. According to them, they "stopped working with Groupon" and I would need to figure out how to get a refund myself. I asked for the employees name so that I could reference it when I spoke with Groupon and he refused, handing me a business card and walking away. It looks like a lot of people have had positive experiences here and but I'm shocked at how awful the customer service was, especially a first time customer. Don't waste a customers time if you don't know your own policies. If you're no longer accepting certain payments, you should be informing customers before they make their way to the appointment. Summary: My observation is that, unless you're coming in for higher priced services, they disregard you as a customer. Too bad they lost a customer who works right around the corner.

19.description: Kerry does fantastic nail art by hand! Joanne is also great at manicures, I have yet to see her nail art skills but I hear she's as good as Kerry.

33.description: This place is 6 weeks old so very clean and fast service! I was in and out in 25 minutes! I got my first gel french manicure (groupon) and it looked great. Tee made my nails look beautiful! Def recommend going here and dont forget the groupon, it was a great deal!

2.description: Great nail salon ! Place is very clean and they value their customers ! Kevin is my favorite and does my gel and no chip flawlessly - highly recommend

34.description: I would love to give this salon a good review but I cannot. I stopped in after work for a pedi/mani, nothing special. It took 2 hours, partly because I had 3 different techs work on my pedi. One girl started my pedi, the owner, Cheng, sent her to work on someone else and Cheng took over, then she stopped to do a brow wax, another tech took over, then Cheng came back...sheesh!  It was the worst experience AND mani/pedi quality I've ever had. My nails are not even, they have too much polish. It looks like a 10 year old did my nails. They just opened but must get their act together.

32.description: Not. Good. Took my BFF here as a pre bachelorette Mani and left horrified- my thumb didn't stop bleeding after a chunk of skin was taken and then the nail technician blamed it on my dry skin- what? Awful and took forever I am a patient person and am easy to please- I was just happy to try a new place in the neighborhood but honestly, I cannot recommend this place:(

18.description: I went again and wanted 4th of July nails! My experience is always nice and friendly and efficient. I have always seen Kim. However my friend has seen different guys and got a full set a couple times and she has loved it as well! Check out my pics for how good my nails look.

13.description: Worst paint job ever!My experience started out great as one of the female technicians did a great job on shaping and filing (only reason they aren't getting one star). However, the place started to get busy and the male who runs the front desk (not sure if he's the manager) started to move people around and ended up moving my female technician to a customer that just walked through the door. I wasn't happy about that as she was doing so well. HE then tookover for the polish. He was more worried about getting every customer that walked in seated, then he was about giving quality service to the customers already there. He walked away from my mani at least 5 times to help whoever walked in.If my nails looked great, I wouldn't have minded that as much. But he had my nails painted in about 30 seconds. He went so fast that they look awful. He had to redo two of them after they dried because they were "clumpy". Here's pictures to show how terrible they look (still clumpy, not smooth at all, polish on my skin, etc). Since it was my first time there, I may give it one more shot, but will definitely not let that man touch my nails again!

4.description: This was hands down the best fill and pedicure ever! I just found my new nail place! Kerry was my nail tech.

24.description: This place is literally around the corner from my office so I thought I'd give it a whirl over lunch.  I got there about 11:15 & was the only customer so was seated promptly.  The place is sparkling clean & very nicely decorated.  They offer you complimentary bottled water & are super friendly.  They spent extra time on my cuticles which I appreciated as they were pretty gnarly.  While I was there, the lunch rush started to trickle in so I would recommend getting there earlier than later.  My only gripe was no hand massage or lotion but for $15 & how good my nails look, I'll let it slide =)

6.description: I love this place!! Joanne does a wonderful job. She is quick, meticulous and friendly! The place is very clean and spacious. I am so glad they opened right around the corner from my office. I can pop in on my lunch break for a great no-chip or pedicure!

22.description: I went there about a month earlier for a no-chip; great service. Lots of colors to pick from. And I made myself remember so I would come back (I jump around from nail salon to nail salon). Came back, did not want a no chip, wanted to give my nails time to breathe between no chips because I have thin nails. I got charged the $5 to remove the no chip, even though I got my nails done there a month before.. (reason was because I did not get another no-chip as a replacment nail service). I was getting my no chip removed when they had to re-soak the nails longer. It got busy, and instead of telling other customers to wait 15 mins, they started them. So while I got started on by one person, had to wait an extra 25 mins for someone to come back and work on me, even though I was there before other customers, to have a NEW person start on my hands, who was rude and actually cut my nails down so short they hurt. To then have ANOTHER person come back and finish them. They advertise a regular mani for 20 mins (mind you I had time time remove my no-chip, lets say 15 mins max). I was there for an hour and 20 mins. And they only put on 2 coats, the nail polish job was terrible/thin/ spotty. And they chipped within 2 days. Long story short: unless you are paying for a higher priced service, they treat you terribly. I would never go back unless I knew I was going to get a solid service, and not have 3 different people working on me. Terrible.

15.description: The first time I decided to go to this place was a cold winter day and the nail salon that I usually did my nails was kinda far and I just wanted to go somewhere close, I found this s place and the reviews were average but I made an appointment,the guy who did my nail was Kerry he us really great, he did it really nice and spent a lot of time on my nails. After that LD nails and Spa is my favorite nail shops.  I did pedicure and wax too. Sue did the wax and she was great!

7.description: I'm giving this two stars because the owner is nice and friendly. However, the lady that did my nails took over an hour to do no chip nails. I think it took an hour and a half. She took forever and still didn't do a good job painting. Very frustrated that it started chipping after less than a week. The quality of the nail technicians really lack. I've never had a consistently good experience here.

8.description: I am a frequent customer and especially as of late, am getting excellent service! They do a great job on my nails and pay close attention to detail. Kerry and Joanne have been doing my nails lately and I always get compliments on them!!! I get gel nail tips with no chip. They also do designs on my nails, and it's beautiful! Great prices and friendly service.

30.description: I bought a groupon for this nail salon and was taken by surprise. The place is very nice, new and clean. The staff is extremely nice. I asked them to copy a nail set from Pinterest, which required difficult nail art and they were able to accommodate my request. Tee and Kim worked really hard and I was extremely pleased with the results. I will definitely go back.

3.description: I had an 11:15am appt. to receive a no-chip mani.  When I got there I had to wait 5 mins (no big deal, I'll pick out a color).  Once I was called to my technicians chair all set to begin services, the owner taps my tech and says "you go and help the gentleman customer (who randomly just popped in) and I will help your customer" (THE OWNER who is clearly NOT a nail tech).  He started cutting and filing (didn't bother asking me if I wanted round or square nails), plopped this horrible chunky looking polish on my nails and still had the nerve to ask if I wanted to add a tip to my charge :( :( :(I am honestly SO upset that I even paid for the way my nails look right now, I could've done better at home!!

14.description: The team did a great job, I got a lavender pedi and a no chip mani.  The salon is clean, the ceiling reminds me of Cesar's Palace in Vegas with the clouds and everyone is so nice. The salon is still pretty new so the weeks are slow :-)

58.description: This is hands down the absolute best vegan joint in all of Chicago. If you've been trying to get your meat eater friends to try some vegan options this is also your best bet. They've been making 100% legit vegan food since 1983, before it was fashionable. They've got it down and know exactly how to hit those taste buds. BBQ tofu is so tasty and the mac and "cheese" is sooooo good! You wouldn't even know it's not actually dairy. Greens are perfection. They even have vegan desserts. This place is a definite stop. I just wish it was closer to me but luckily they supply Whole Foods with some take home items.

56.description: This is my favorite vegan restaurant in the city. I love the raw kale, sunflower pate, carrot pâté, my daily dose of wheatgrass, my spurilina smoothie, peanut butter smoothie, and the berry smoothies are the best.

29.description: Soul Veg continues to own my soul.I made the hike over for my 2nd visit and while they were out of the BBQ twist, I loved everything else I had. Yes, my heart broke into a million little pieces but I took it as a sign to expand my horizons. Since we had a groupon (they come around every year around March, check for it!), we got the gyro, jerk wrap, east coast BBQ roast and tidbits, of course. We over-order because we need to keep eating this stuff the next day. Once it hits your lips, it's just so good. Fries come with the orders and they're ok. You don't make the trek to SV for fries though. You don't even need to eat the fries. Server was chill and while we waited for the grub, I walked to the restroom and noticed photos on the hallway walls of the owner chillin with Barack and Whoopi amongst other famous people. Damn, can I be your friend too? Overall, everything was still freakin' phenomenal. The place was packed and the AC wasn't on but It didn't matter. My belly experienced joy like it was Christmas morning. I could honestly eat Soul Veg daily and not get tired. Til the next time, my soul will be dreaming of SV.

42.description: What's not to love? Generous portions at a reasonable price. Portions are large and service is attentive. The fine folks at Brown Sugar Bakery turned me on to Soul Veg and I am so grateful.  The special with rice and veggies and cornmeal coated tofu is amazing and enough for two. Great deal. A recently ordered pasta dish was rather boring and not imaginative and that was a disappointment but other meals have been stellar. With so few vegan choices (I am not a vegan but love my veggies), this place is a treasure.  I do not fit the traditional demographic in this locale and have, at times,  felt looked upon with suspicion when entering but my easy going disposition has brought me into some interesting chat with fellow diners. Soul Veg is off the beaten path for many Yelpers but I encourage you to visit not just for the great food but also to experience the amazing history, culture and sights that Chicago's south side has to offer.

23.description: This is an amazing Vegan spot. A real hidden gem located in Englewood Chicago. I had the Macaroni and cheese, kale,salad and carrot salad along with the bbq vegetarian dish. It was like no other! I'll be back with someone special!

47.description: Vegetarians and vegans, unite!  Soul Vegetarian is a restaurant free from the worry of your food being cooked in beef fat or fish sauce or chicken stock!  And it's so damned GOOD, too!Now, at around 3pm on a Thursday, the restaurant was bustling, so you know that you've found a real gem of a place to eat.I ordered the Veggie Gyros and my god, were they delicious: the perfect texture with the perfect seasoning, the pita bread thin and not too heavy.  And the fries that accompanied it were crispy and tasty too.  As my friend and I were digging in, a dapper gentleman came to our table to ask us how we were enjoying our meal.  Remember how I said the restaurant was busy?  This is clearly an example of why that is.  If an establishment cares about what they're serving you and how you like it, well, instant return visit for sure!

8.description: Stopped in today for a quick lunch for my brothers bday.   When we walked no one greeted us. Bomber. We were told to find us a sit. It took this lady forever to come over to our table. Strange because there was not alot of ppl. Finally when she did make it over to our table. She just dumped 2 glasses of water on the table and walks away. Well excuse me.  No hello or anything. Where is the customer service up in this place?Ok finally she comes back and murmurs under her breathe what the daily special was for that day. We both decided on the brown rice over black eye peas kale sweet potatoes and I guess something of bbq meat. The Stir Fry over brown riceTo my surprise the food wasn't bad. It was ok very bland but not bad. My brother had order a banana smoothie when we placed our food order.  It took forever just to make a smoothie. Not sure if someone had to run out to Jewels to buy more bananas. We were about to pay the bill and head out the door. Poop comes out the smootie. I don't think that I will be back out south wasting my gas on this place.

31.description: Really enjoyed my dinner. Wish I could eat this on a daily especially from the raw bar!!!

34.description: Pleasantly surprised, yummy flavors. I had the rice with protein bits to start. I will go back for the food. The crowd was diverse. We went during lunch and the small restaurant had every table occupied. I docked two stars for the service. The young lady there was not attentive and was actually quite rude. Having grown up with a family owned restaurant, I know what it takes to be a server. She didn't even say hi, just took our food order and delivered it once it was done. No water refills or check ups.

16.description: The food isn't how it use to be I think they have new cooks or something I use to love the prince dressing it taste super funny now like it's made of butter and garlic only. The fried steak was horrible I did however love the fried cauliflower I'm probably gonna make those at home now. The fried tidbits still pretty good.THE fries are kinda soggy and greasy not all that and to make things worse the waitress was kind of rude with a attitude problem.
