I live up north they have lots of vegetarian restaurants now next time I'll stay up there if I was a vegan restaurant.

13.description: So good. Worth the drive. Their soft serve ice cream is made in house and always amazing. Their lunch/dinner special is so filling but delicious.

11.description: I love their Vegan food! The breaded tofu, candied yam, spaghetti casserole and chili were delicious! It's so hard to find a good tasting Vegan restaurant, but they totally meet the mark. I can't wait to come back, they had a set menu but I look forward to trying everything on the menu.

39.description: medicore. put together last minute vegan food. maybe if they work on presenting foods more favorable, i could visit often.

37.description: I'm not sure what might have happened today, but I visited based on the stellar reviews and I was very much disappointed with what I tried. I ordered the Barbecue entree that comes with fries and salad. I ordered carry out and drove to my destination which was just about four blocks away, and by the time I got to my location the food was cold!! The food did not seem fresh at all, more like warmed up frozen food doused in barbecue sauce. Huge disappoint  in the quality, flavor and presentation! I am giving two stars bc the service was nice and friendly. This was the dish everyone recommended, so I am not sure if I will try anything else bc this is one of their signature dishes, and if they cannot get that right my confidence is lacking for other items served. If I patronized based on service vs. taste, I would return, but that is not the case for me.

0.description: We drive in from Naperville. It's THAT good.Vegetarian food with ***flavor***. That's the important part. You'd go there even if not a vegetarian. No. Really. Our favs:The eggless egg saladThe black eyed pea burger (OMG we are in the car heeded there now and I can hardly contain myself)The seasoned fries and the breaded cauliflowerKale greensCan't wait to try:LasagnaProtein bitesCornbreadBreakfast hand sandwichBBQ twist

38.description: I went here for lunch today with a non-vegan. We had the vegan chicken fried special with mashed potatoes, gravy and corn. It was really great! The service was excellent, and I really enjoyed my meal. I even ordered the spicy chicken sandwich to go so I had dinner, too! I will be going back to try the barbecue tidbits and gyro, next time! YUM!!!!!!!

51.description: Great food, I just wish it was closer! Everything is vegan and you must get the greens when you go...and the mac and cheese. I love this place and if I could get there more often, I totally would.

27.description: Being a vegetarian from the south is hard but this place fills the hole in my stomach. it has Great food. Service is slow, but its so worth it. I've had everything on menu and never been disappointed. the cauliflower with barb que puts me in a good mood for days.

32.description: This restaurant does wonders with soy and tofu.  My wife ordered the 'dinner plate', which was some sort of BBQ protein along with mustard greens, potato salad and corn on the cob. I ordered the BBQ twist platter which was also some sort of protein that also came with fries.  We also ordered an appetizer of BBQ tofu wings. To be totally honest with you, neither one of us had any idea what we were getting.Both of our meals came with the choice of soup or salad so we got one of each.  The soup was chili and came with a big square piece of cornbread.  The house salad was standard and we got it with something they call "Prince" dressing.  My wife said it was the best chili she had ever eaten and the salad was also crispy and delicious.As far as our appetizer and entrees, I don't know how they manage to get so many different and unique flavors from BBQ, but they pull it off.  Everything was delicious.  The service.........meh.........there is definitely room for improvement.  When we walked in there was a young lady standing at a large counter who just stared at us.  She looked as if she didn't know who we were, who she was, or what city and state any of this was taking place in.  She didn't say anything so I walked up to her and said "two" while holding up two fingers.  It was as if she had no idea what that meant either.  I then asked her if we should sit anywhere; to which she mouthed something inaudible but gestured to the effect of 'yes' so we did just that.  After we were seated and ordered (this young lady was also our server, but I'm not going into that adventure) she was very attentive.  She constantly checked on us and kept our glasses full of water.  Overall it was a good experience with very good food.  My wife didn't like it as much as I did, but I think we'll be back.

54.description: Really long wait so call first. I had a juice next door. I was told they don't believe in mixing fruits and veggies together so that was interesting. I had the black eye pea burger and fries. I t was so good!!!! THE cashier let me sample the greens and they were a little salty to me. I like the vibe of the restaurant.

48.description: Just had the worst experience at soul veg. My husband ordered the special. It came out before our mushroom appetizer. 20 minutes later my burger came out with mustard on it which I had asked be left off. There were also onions on it which the menu didn't say was on it. I had to scrape those off but then I couldn't even eat the burger because I absolutely hate mustard. The server never came back to ask if everything was ok. We just got a box and left. My husband will eat it later. The service was horrible and I will never go back!  I paid $36 to watch my husband eat.

44.description: Soul Veg is one of my favorite restaurants in the world, without question. Living on the South Side for almost 8 years and being a vegetarian the whole time, I used to come to Soul Veg as often as possible. All of the food is delicious, and has given me lots of ideas for making recipes in my own kitchen. Sure, most of it is not exactly healthy, even if it is vegan, since it's heavy on the deep fry, but most soul food isn't super healthy anyway.The BBQ sauce is boss, the homeade seitan is delicious, and my mouth is literally watering thinking about the Jerusalem fries as I type this review. I love their carrot salad and homemade dressings, too. The juice bar is pretty good and they'll make you basically whatever you want, even though the menu is pretty extensive. I wish they still made the date rolls there, though years ago, the cook who made them stopped working there and I don't think they've made them since.The service is laid back, so don't expect to be in and out in a jiffy. I think because this is such a destination restaurant, they get a lot of yuppie vegan types here who give the staff attitude if the service isn't super speedy. You can tell they roll their eyes a bit when they see obnoxious, self-righteous vegans from the North Side who have never  really been in a predominately African American neighborhood. But, if you are appreciative of their delicious food and smiley service, the wait staff will make sure you are well taken care of.

24.description: I used to prep and  cook for Soul Veg...even I adore this restaurant.I'LL ALWAYS LOVE YOU SOUL VEGGGG!!! LOLAnyway,  I love to bring my children here on a hot summer's day. We do the same thing each time. We go to their Eternity Juice Bar and order food, then we order hot food from the restaurant to take home.Eternity Juice Bar-soft served vegan ice-cream cones-Raw/Cold salads...chick peas, bean curd, kale, tofu, artichokes, olives, you name it! OMG, DO NOT FORGET the JALAPENO CHEESE  (they put a huge dollop on top of your salad).-bags of honey mustard kettle chips or crackers to dip.***This hits the spot on a hot day when you are hungry but don't want to eat anything heavy***Then, we order food to go from the restaurant.-everyone orders their favorite foods or dinners, a dessert to go, and a yummy ginger brews or drink.***While we wait for our food, we hang around, talk, listen to music, look at all the pictures and artwork on the walls. We always see people we recognize, cool vibes, and positive people from all over Chicago and IL. We leave with our bellies and our souls satisfied and full!***

7.description: I've never imagined there would be a vegan place that makes soul food. This place was great! They close early but they work fast. Try their BBQ anything, you won't be disappointed!

49.description: I came here on a Friday at 3pm and was easily able to find one hour street parking outside. I ended up ordering the Down-South BBQ Twist Sandwich, which had both tasty BBQ sauce and protein, but was a bit too messy to eat with my hands. Next time I come I think I will order the protein tidbits off the appetizer menu.

40.description: Soul Vegetarian is a hidden gem. The bbq twist and the protein bites are officially my favorite dish in Chicagoland. When meat eaters say, "the meat cut like butter"...well I suppose its kind of like that. The texture is perfection. The sauce is boss. The prices are very fair. What more to say.

53.description: So I did recently have the chance to eat here at the actual restaurant. Was very tasty and I enjoyed the food greatly. As the name suggests, it's soul food, so not necessarily the healthiest (which is what I try to eat). I made exceptions here and was happy I did. The place was pretty full; lots of people lovin it. It has an easy-going, simple dining room. I do recommend it, if you're in the hood. Otherwise, for me, it's not worth the trek. I'll be happy continuing to eat their stuff at all the food events they host.

30.description: After eating at both Atlanta Soul Vegetarians and the one in DC for many years, it was good to finally visit Chicago's Soul Vegetarian. As expected, the brunch hit the spot. Soul Vegetarian was the place to first let me know that Vegan food could be good and soulful.

46.description: Fabulous greens and cornbread - what a fabulous, unexpected find and in an unassuming neighborhood.  Can't say the atmosphere or the service gets 4 stars but the food - quality, flavor and attention to the health conscious - were stellar.  Give it a shot, I'd go back in a heartbeat.

1.description: The #1 stop hands down the best Vegan/ Veggie food in the metro Chicago area. The mac and cheese and gravey burger are always on point. Protein tidbits are great and so is the  lasagna. Try it you'll be hooked!!FYI: The parking in the area is horrible but if you can find a spot check out this spot!!

55.description: I did not eat at the restaurant itself while visiting Chicago. However, I must say that I really enjoyed their pre-made food at Whole Foods. Delicious wraps, mac n cheese, and more. I've always loved soul food, even before my vegan years. Delicious comfort food that always keeps you full! Affordable prices and great for a quick bite to eat if you're in the area for lunch. I've heard both good and bad reviews about the restaurant itself but I must say that I enjoyed the food and would gladly eat it again when I'm in Chicago.

9.description: My new favorite place now that I'm on a healthier path of life. I gave it 4 starts because it's so small in there, food and smoothie is great tho!!!

26.description: Nice restaurant, bad food.  I'm a vegan and I decided not to go the raw route, hence I tried what everyone on yelp was raving about: bbq tidbits and the bbq twist sandwich.I think this place goes "vegetarian" by substituting everything with tofu.  The tidbits were eatable only because they are hot and fried, but I threw away the twist sandwhich after a few bites..I love the atmosphere and I was dying to try some of their cobblers or desserts.  I think I tried the wrong entrees.. Don't get me wrong- I love soul food.  I have a gf who takes me down that route ever so often.  She also takes me to Ms. lees which is on point!! I'm just guessing but I think this place is trying to make the ever so popular soul food more healthy. I just don't know if u take something with so much sugar, fat, Greece, salt and cholesterol and turn it vegan?  Ever...Great atmosphere and great place inside, but the food wasn't very good for my taste considering I've tried a few other vegetarian/vegan/raw places in my dad

25.description: Years ago I swore off Soul Veg. "Never again" I screamed to the heavens... But, I am back. And boy does it feel good to be home.

12.description: Soul Veg continues to own my soul.I made the hike over for my 2nd visit and while they were out of the BBQ twist, I loved everything else I had. Yes, my heart broke into a million little pieces but I took it as a sign to expand my horizons. Since we had a groupon (they come around every year around March, check for it!), we got the gyro, jerk wrap, east coast BBQ roast and tidbits, of course. We over-order because we need to keep eating this stuff the next day. Once it hits your lips, it's just so good. Fries come with the orders and they're ok. You don't make the trek to SV for fries though. You don't even need to eat the fries. Server was chill and while we waited for the grub, I walked to the restroom and noticed photos on the hallway walls of the owner chillin with Barack and Whoopi amongst other famous people. Damn, can I be your friend too? Overall, everything was still freakin' phenomenal. The place was packed and the AC wasn't on but It didn't matter. My belly experienced joy like it was Christmas morning. I could honestly eat Soul Veg daily and not get tired. Til the next time, my soul will be dreaming of SV.

59.description: If stopping thru chicago this is not to be missed. I love soul food but have to be careful since I am a vegetarian. I first dined here about 6 years ago and was delighted with the food. My dining companions who eat meat gave their food 5 stars also!

21.description: I have wanted to get over here for a long time.  It is not conveniently located for me.  I live way North and work late.  Every time I have thought to go there, they would be closed by the time I got over there.  I knew that I needed to plan this out!  So, Doctors appointment at Northwestern memorial in the middle of the day......left work early and would still have plenty of time afterwards so I knew that would be my chance.  Trekked over there midday after my appointment.  We noticed that the menu did not have the barbeque fare that we had heard about and inquired with the server.  She said that the lunch menu and the dinner menu were different but if we just waited about ten minutes they were switching things over.  We happily obliged. Oh man, was that food good.  We ordered the special that came with tofu barbeque strips, greens, cornbread and mac and cheese.  Everything was simply delicious.  I really liked that the corn bread was more savory, not super sweet.  Just as it should be when coming with a meal, in my opinion.  We also ordered some hot teas that were really good, as well..Upon leaving, we noticed that up in the front there is a hot bar that you can order take out from.  There was a huge variety of offerings that I know I would just love.  I wish I lived closer to this place.  I am def going to have to plan another southside day very soon!

17.description: Food was awesome! It was delicious and hot when it arrived to our table. It did take a while for it to come but I believe that was because it was cooked fresh. Here's what we got and I would recommend. Collard greens with tomato and onion On top with a fresh slice of cornbread Protein tidbits(yummmm) with Bbq sauceVegetable stir fryJerk wrap sandwich And yummy peach cobbler!!!

10.description: I've been coming here since I was a child and always left satisfied. Over the years they have added more options to an already great quality of food list. Customer service is ok not the best though but the food is pretty good. Let's not forget the deli/cafe bar either which is also good.

5.description: Delicious sausage and tofu scramble... Organic apple juice. Awesome hash browns. Love the vibe of the place.

3.description: Great food well worth the trip all the way from the north side can't believe everything there is vegan wow

35.description: One thing I love about this place is their veggie plate.  You do not have to pick different sides to create one even though that idea is also appreciated!  I have enjoyed in the past the vegan shake it is so good.  I do not eat any ice cream anymore however If you do please enjoy yummy!  It is a good place to take a group or friends and family.  It is a very nice social atmosphere!

19.description: I agree with whoever wrote that this food is so good it makes you want to put it in your pockets! At first I didn't know what they were talking about and I even made fun of reading that on yelp but I realized what they really meant as we left. The food was so yummy that I carried my leftover few bites of dessert in my pocket all across town on public transportation for the rest of the day. So if you don't wanted stuffed pockets maybe bring a side bag with you because you WILL want to take food with you, not just what you ate, but all the grab and go items behind the deli counter look amazing.We would order again:Garvey Burger with friesGreensSide Garden Salad with amazing garlic dressingFried CauliflowerOnion RingsCoconut CakeYellow Cake with Chocolate FrostingWe would pass on:The fried steak and fried tofu that came in the combo basket BUT I can see why some folks would like those flavors, just not our cup of tea!

28.description: It is always such a treat to come here. I like Sundays where you get the preset Sunday dinner, but I also love choosing my own meal. I always hop down here when at the Museum of Science and Industry or near the lake. There are so many vegan options, which is heaven for me. My favorite is the combo fried basket-- the bbq sauce is AMAZING. The fried tofu and cauliflower are also great. I always like the soup. Also, the fresh salads next door are amazing. You can't beat it.

45.description: Greens!! We were visiting Chicago and came here with a friend who's wanted to try it for years and years. Don't even bother considering the vegetarian aspect -- the food is just fabulous. The menu's kind of confusingly organized -- some things are called sides, some entrees, some appetizers, but there's not necessary much difference among them. We were four hungry people and ordered the collards & cornbread entree, the basket of fried mushrooms, cauliflower, onion rings and seitan and also got a side of BBQ "tofu tidbits" which were also deep fried, with BBQ sauce on the side. Then we got yet another order of greens and a side of the mac & cheese, which is almost like a souffle in texture. There were many other specials that probably wouldn't have involved quite as much deep fried food, but someone there is a wizard with the fryer -- light, not greasy. We were there on a Tuesday night and it was pretty much deserted -- hope it's more popular on the weekends. This is a treasure.

33.description: I love their barbecue! They sure know how to cook tofu properly and their ice cream is fantastic! I do wish they had the Mac and cheese all the time. Owner is super friendly

43.description: Great food. This is one of those rare places that the food is so good that you don't even mind the poor service.

2.description: Delicious food!  I ordered the Sloppy Joe and fell in love. It is flavor and very filling. The dining area could use some upgrading. It's BELOW basic. I would recommend going during the week. Service on the weekend is HORRIBLE!  Oh yeah! If you are a mushroom lover....try their breaded mushrooms!  They are outstanding!

18.description: I have wanted to get over here for a long time.  It is not conveniently located for me.  I live way North and work late.  Every time I have thought to go there, they would be closed by the time I got over there.  I knew that I needed to plan this out!  So, Doctors appointment at Northwestern memorial in the middle of the day......left work early and would still have plenty of time afterwards so I knew that would be my chance.  Trekked over there midday after my appointment.  We noticed that the menu did not have the barbeque fare that we had heard about and inquired with the server.  She said that the lunch menu and the dinner menu were different but if we just waited about ten minutes they were switching things over.  We happily obliged. Oh man, was that food good.  We ordered the special that came with tofu barbeque strips, greens, cornbread and mac and cheese.  Everything was simply delicious.  I really liked that the corn bread was more savory, not super sweet.  Just as it should be when coming with a meal, in my opinion.  We also ordered some hot teas that were really good, as well..Upon leaving, we noticed that up in the front there is a hot bar that you can order take out from.  There was a huge variety of offerings that I know I would just love.  I wish I lived closer to this place.  I am def going to have to plan another southside day very soon!

41.description: I.miss.this.place.so.much.I moved to the West Coast and there are no places like this anywhere out here in "the land of vegetarians." Soul Vegetarian East really has a unique take on good food. I dream about this place every time I try to find a veggie friendly restaurant.Their protein bites are delicious. Order these first as an appetizer.Make sure you get their collard greens as one of your sides.Any and all of their sandwiches are delicious.You must leave room for their coconut cake.Sunday nights there is a dinner that they serve and you can't get around it. If you want to order options, make sure you go on a different day.

52.description: I've been eating here since I became a vegetarian and still come here even though I eat fish. I've tried just about everything on the menu, but here are my faves:1. The battered tofu sandwich - it's like a fish fillet, with their homemade mayo and all, really really great2. Small salad with Prince dressing - i have no idea what is in the dressing, but it is AMAZING!!! Too good.3. Fries and Onion Rings - sometimes these are too greasy, but they are delicious4. The live kale salad - ok, i haven't had this is in forever but it was delicious and really good. Raw before raw was cool.5. The dinner special - it changes daily, but has always been good and very filling.The service is what it is, slow. Don't try to come in and out for a quick meal. This is a take your time kind of place. Also be prepared to remind your server of all the things she didn't bring to the table, like condiments, your food, etc. The place has only gotten better, although they use typical iceberg lettuce now instead of alfalfa sprouts, which changes the taste A LOT. They should maybe opt for spinach leaves, which are cheap, last longer than lettuce and is nutritional.A good restaurant on the South Side for folks who like a good vegan ( although not really healthy) meal without having to deal or trek out of the neighborhood.

50.description: The floor space is tight. The food is pretty good, depending on what you order. They seem to handle seasoning well, but personal tastes may require salt. The wait staff was deplorable!!! So very slow to get any type of service in the dining area. The waitress spoke with impatience, did not come to check on us at all, took our food to a different table, was abrupt with other customers (noting the one who knew that it was our food, the waitress insisted that the guy had ordered the Dinner Special, which he did not). Sadly, on the southside of Chicago this is one of the best options for vegetarian or vegan eats. Maybe next time I want to try something there I will get it go and not dine -in. My take home was delicious and I didn't have to put up with the claustrophobic feeling of eating in their dining room. My meat eater friends who ventured out with me seemed to enjoy the black bean burger and the dinner special (after it was recooked - the one that was sent to another table first). Street parking is limited.

4.description: Great food!  Still working my way through the menu but a fan of the garvey burger and I make sure I call ahead.

6.description: Let me start by saying I am not a vegan, so when my sisterfriend told me we were going to a vegan restauarant where they served 'faux meat' (forgive me as I don't know the proper way to phrase it), I experienced two emotional hunger transitions: 1. I was too damned hungry to play and say anything other than ok, although I had come prepared with steak n shake coupons before I knew where we were headed. 2. I don't like these places. I don't like faux meat. Awww man. :/ We arrived and this quaint little spot that sits on a corner in Chicago was black owned and inviting. The chandaliers gave a soulful glam to the dining area and the line of people on the side where the salads and homemade ice cream are served stayed full. I scanned the menu looking for something that did NOT contain the faux meat. I settled on a noodle veggie plate. It was FIYAH! FIRE! GREAT ! As in gooooood! Yes, I was starving which means there was a small possibility that it wasn't as good as I thought it was. But that's not true. It was really quite delicious....there wasn't a 'sauce', but the noodles and veggies (onions, sundried tomatoes, spinach & mushrooms) had been tossed in ginger and probably some type of sesame and olive oil combination. I ate until I could not eat anymore and not to be wasteful, I took the small leftovers home. The plate was huge and anyone can get full from half a serving. I didn't like the flavor of the water. It tasted like it was flavored with lemon but came from a busted up, unfiltered pipe that has an attitude towards clean water. But the food was amazing. I would definitely go back and have this again. I might even try the greens they offered and there was also another veggie plate that read like it would cure my hunger pains as well.  The service was cool, the waitress was friendly and helpful and the hallway that leads to the bathroom is decorated full of vintage photos of famous (and even non-famous) people. It's a welcoming atmosphere. The guests seemed happy and peaceful and by the time we left, my stomach was in agreeance. If you're in the area and want to try something new or if you are looking for a really good vegan spot with  good portions for the price, you definitely need to give Soul Vegetarian a try. I call it a #WIN.

22.description: I agree with whoever wrote that this food is so good it makes you want to put it in your pockets! At first I didn't know what they were talking about and I even made fun of reading that on yelp but I realized what they really meant as we left. The food was so yummy that I carried my leftover few bites of dessert in my pocket all across town on public transportation for the rest of the day. So if you don't wanted stuffed pockets maybe bring a side bag with you because you WILL want to take food with you, not just what you ate, but all the grab and go items behind the deli counter look amazing.We would order again:Garvey Burger with friesGreensSide Garden Salad with amazing garlic dressingFried CauliflowerOnion RingsCoconut CakeYellow Cake with Chocolate FrostingWe would pass on:The fried steak and fried tofu that came in the combo basket BUT I can see why some folks would like those flavors, just not our cup of tea!

15.description: I used to prep and  cook for Soul Veg...even I adore this restaurant.I'LL ALWAYS LOVE YOU SOUL VEGGGG!!! LOLAnyway,  I love to bring my children here on a hot summer's day. We do the same thing each time. We go to their Eternity Juice Bar and order food, then we order hot food from the restaurant to take home.Eternity Juice Bar-soft served vegan ice-cream cones-Raw/Cold salads...chick peas, bean curd, kale, tofu, artichokes, olives, you name it! OMG, DO NOT FORGET the JALAPENO CHEESE  (they put a huge dollop on top of your salad).-bags of honey mustard kettle chips or crackers to dip.***This hits the spot on a hot day when you are hungry but don't want to eat anything heavy***Then, we order food to go from the restaurant.-everyone orders their favorite foods or dinners, a dessert to go, and a yummy ginger brews or drink.***While we wait for our food, we hang around, talk, listen to music, look at all the pictures and artwork on the walls. We always see people we recognize, cool vibes, and positive people from all over Chicago and IL. We leave with our bellies and our souls satisfied and full!***

57.description: I have a special place in my heart for this spot. It's a pretty unique place in terms of atmosphere, and honestly I never would have guessed that there's a place like this on the deep south side. Everything is vegan, the service is really wonderful, and the food is just resplendent; sooo comforting and satisfying. Their brunch is where it's at, but I also like their tofu tidbits, seasoned fries, onion rings, Jerusalem sandwich, BBQ twists, and the down home greens. My only "beef" is that their prices are a little much.

20.description: This is my first time here.   Had the breakfast sandwich and it taste so good & fresh!!! The staff are very helpful & knowledgeable.  Open to answer all your questions. I will come again

36.description: I can't believe I've never written a review on Soul Veg! This restaurant is fantastic. Even if you're not a vegetarian, there's nothing to not love about it other than the location. I'm a carnivore, but my partner is a vegetarian. We're always looking for the next best vegetarian/vegan option out there, but I don't know if we have ever had anything quite like Soul Vegetarian.  This restaurant is completely unique! I'd prefer it to the Chicago Diner or Native Foods any day. If you want real soul food, this is the place to go. Hands down best soul food in Chicago - and the great thing is they manage to do this completely vegetarian. Everything we've ordered (and we've had a lot) is delicious.A huge plus is that they always seem to have a special on Sundays- some kind of dinner like beef tips or meatloaf; always with all the trimmings. We've never been disappointed with portions, quality, flavor, or pricing. You get a lot for what you pay. I swear that if I took another carnivore here and didn't tell them they weren't eating meat, they'd never even know it.I'm pretty sure Soul Veg is distributing food to some of the local Whole Foods and Barnes and Nobles. That's awesome because it can be really difficult to make the trek all the way down south to 75th from where we live on the Northwest side.As I mentioned, the only con is the location. It's sooooo far away and a nice long walk from public transportation. The area itself is fine - but I'm not so sure about surrounding neighborhoods, so just know where you're going. With that being said, it IS worth the journey getting there. I am looking forward to our next visit. I'd highly recommend this place!

14.description: My Girl Friend mentioned that there is a Soul Vegetarian Restaurant that was on the  South Side of Chicago IL. I loved the taste and the flavors of their foods it's  so Delicious we have been coming back for years. We lived in the suburb and  drive about 40 miles to get to  Soul Vegetarian East . Their House dressing is the best I'm  so please and proud that they are here in the Chicago land area.

1.description: In my neighborhood,  have lots of different selections relating to beauty care, wish it was a larger store, recommend to shop at if you're n neighborhood. .unfortunately they have posted on hall wall before u enter the store for everyone to see pics of  "thefts" that happened n their store, is that good or bad?? Maybe for their sake keep pics behind counter, ijs.

0.description: I truly like this place and they are so friendly every time I go.  I am always tickled by their wall of shame(Pictures of people who have stolen stuff and the price).This store and the young lady that helped me find a wig on my brother's big day saved me because even after running all over the city and going to many other wig shops...Nothing seemed to wow me.  I really didn't think that I would find a wig that I liked at this store because they didn't have a large selection, but I was wrong.  The young lady not only helped me find the perfect wig but she also helped me with a few beauty tips.I still have to return and show her the pictures because I received so many compliments from my hair to my make-up that I know where I need to go in a pinch.  The young lady made a stressful moment unstressful...That I will never forget.They may not be the biggest store around but they do seem to care about their customers and they treated us the same rather we spent $1.00 or $100.00.  That right there will have me coming back!Enjoy!

3.description: Used to be a great greasy spoon for a quick inexpensive gut filler... But they recently changed their polishes... Not the same taste at all... Price point Is still about the same... But the taste is gone

1.description: This place is NOT a greasy spoon! It's a hood spot that frankly doesn't provide the type of food you'd expect from a hood spot. I ordered two hotdogs and fries. He asked me if I wanted everything and I replied "yes". By everything I was expecting condiments, relish, peppers etc. being that this is Chicago! Instead I got a low quality dog slathered in mustard with a ton of fried onions on top. If I could describe my food in on word it would be "TERRIBLE"! I didn't even eat half before I threw it away. The fries were hot but dry with no salt or sauce. Every place gives you mild sauce with your fries in Chicago except this place I guess. I was super salty and let down today. I would not recommend this spot for dog food. It's a cash only business which is suspect as well and the cashier is behind welded steel and bulletproof glass which to me is the epitome of a hood spot....not a greasy spoon. Ef this place...it sucked!

2.description: The service was fast and the polish was tasty...what else can you say about a 24 hour greasy spoon after you have a long night of hanging with friends and dancing the night away!

0.description: "I still feel guilty BUT I got a second wind"I would never visit the place during daytime hours, but if I happen to be in the area after a late night.. they just may get my business. It's the epitome of a greasy spoon.. pretty quick and reasonable. They offered me hot fries and overly greasy wings and I ate ALL of it. I can hear my heart going.. NOOOOOOOOOOO.. But alas.. I'd do it over again if the stars aligned the same way.

1.description: I will never be lazy and go to this shop again. First they didn't greet me than I sat in the pedicure chair for 20 mins while they walk and talk. Than the tech cut my foot. She wasn't gentle she kept grabbing and pulling. This was by far the worst experience. The only positives was the product she use to soften my feet

9.description: I will never come here again. I got an infection on my finger because the tech was rushing, cut my cuticle when she was pushing way too hard, and apparently was using dirty tools. Within 24 hours my finger was red, swollen and painful, and I had to go to urgent care to get it drained and get antibiotics. DO NOT COME HERE!

23.description: I debated on writing a review, but had to chime in. I preface my comment with the fact that I 1) got a mani-pedi , 2) went on a Saturday (no appts on Fri and Sat), and 3) had a 1-month old daughter at home albeit being watched by her grandfather. First, the mani-pedi prices are reasonable and competitive; however, the salon definitely prefers servicing fill-ins because they were seen relatively quickly after walking in. I say "relatively" because  I was in that salon for 3.5 hours from the time I walked in until the time I walked out (and I spent less than 5 minutes at the drying station). I thought this place offered convenience because it is my neighborhood, but I will definitely continue to explore other places. My word of advice is to avoid going on Fridays and Saturdays, if you can.

5.description: Right off the bat I can tell this place is cleaner than Fairy Nails. But, of course, there are two men up front doing acrylics and running the place while 11 women are scurrying around handling all the ladies here today. Refer to my Fairy Nails review about the NYT article.My name was fifth on the waiting list but they called me by the time I picked my color. Unexplainably, the bulk of the colors are kept behind the men up front and check-out counter out of reach to get a good look at the color. Maybe people steal polish and this is their solution.I asked them to clean the pedi bowl before putting water in for me. They said they clean after every pedi so I'm waiting to see if that's the case when the next pedi finishes. One plantar's wart was enough. OK, I see a gal cleaning...still playing it safe and not putting my feet down except my heel.I asked the technician to clean the tools before starting. She said she already did but I asked her to do it again. They don't have their tools in disinfectant solution but, rather, just spray the tools with alcohol and wipe them. Ugh.As I look around, this place really is much nicer than Fairy Nails. It's much roomier, there's nice paint on the walls, some spa-like art work and a couple of nice tvs and the smell isn't overwhelming. And, again, it seems to be much, much cleaner. However, the waiting area is very small.The foot/leg massages in places like this are usually short, but my gal did a nice job. Also, they give new toe separaters to reach client. They reuse at Fairy Nails. Gross.This nail place is definitely the lesser of two evils for those wanting mani/pedis in Hyde Park.

25.description: Love love love this place. I have acrylic nails and this place is nothing but consistent and amazing. They are so nice, the place is always clean, and the prices are right. The color selection is fairly small but everything else makes up for it.

12.description: I thought they did a really nice job. They weren't pushy about up selling, which I hate. The only con was that we had to wait a little. It was clear they had no idea that I made an appt, but we weren't in a rush. The massage chairs were good too!

21.description: I really enjoyed my experience at HPNS.  The service was friendly, the place is clean and good looking (huge flatscreen, top of the line massage chairs).  They DISINFECT their tools--a deal breaker for me, and sadly not always the case at some other local spots.  I even let Loi talk me into getting a no chip and I am so glad that I did.  My nails look great and they are totally dry when she finishes the manicure.  I mean totally, like I-could-dig-a-ditch-with-them dry..  The prices are reasonable.  Unlike another reviewer, I saw a wide selection of nail colors.  They even had exactly the color I like, which sometimes is hard to find.

16.description: Just moved to Hyde Park so glad I found this great place for my eyebrow wax! Quick and neat... Was in an out in a jiffy and completely satisfied!

17.description: Tried this place because its close to my home. It's clean and I was very satisfied with my service! I recommend this place. I get gel overlays and I never have any compliants. The lady that does my nails is very friendly. Her name is Lori.  Check her out!

10.description: I said to myself "Hey try them out again." Why and the hell did I do that?? I came in and was told that it would be a 20 minute wait!! I looked around and saw at least three nail techs reading magazines!! They could have been on break! If that was the case they should have been in the back. Workers just chilling shouldn't be seen especially if there is a lot of people waiting to be serviced!!!!!!!!!!! I waited the twenty minutes and got frustrated and left!!! Two times is a charm for me!! Neverrr again!!!!

11.description: This place was awesome for a French mani-pedi.  I made an appointment the day prior, just a day before our engagement photos were scheduled to be shot, and it was one of the most clean-lined mani-pedi's I've ever enjoyed.The place does bustle, though (I assume word has spread!), so I do recommend calling ahead to make an appointment so that you're not disappointed at the door if they ask you to wait.

26.description: The service was great. I was seen right away. I just love this place.

27.description: i was so happy to see a new nail shop in the laundry mat strip mall. i generally get mani/pedis from who ever is offering a $20 daily deal so i have been to a lot of places. there pedicure chair and big and comfy and have nice massage settings, arm  rest and a little desk, they also have free wifi. the manicure chairs are office style and also comfortable i jus dont llike how the kinda roll all over the place. they have a large selection of the latest colors from essie and opi and my polish lasts for at least a week. a mani/ pedi is $30 polish change for hands and feet is $13. welcome addition to the neighborhood

0.description: I like this place.  I come here regularly for a mani/pedi.  The no chip actually lasts for 2 weeks if not more (which isn't true for other salons in the area).  The staff are friendly and always take care of me. I rarely have to wait. Although I come in during the week.  The scrub and hot towels are a nice touch.  I gave this place 4 stars and not 5 because while it's not a lavish Spa it provides a reliable service for a great price.

20.description: Ok, I was skeptical because the first time i walked in, there was a 2 hour wait because they only had one person doing acrylic nails.  I waited another week to go back because i didn't have time and when I did I only had to wait about 15 minutes.  The shop looked clean and they put on the acrylics in a snap.  I was pleased with the shape and the color (although the lady seemed a little annoyed that i didn't pick my color right before sitting down lol - but i hadn't had my nails done in so long i forgot that was the protocol).  At any rate, I'm going back again but I suggest getting there as early as possible because it is a walk-in shop.  I LOVED the price as well!! Overall, good place to get your nails done, but they do need more staff that can do fill-ins/acrylics/gel nails.

19.description: I really enjoyed my experience at HPNS.  The service was friendly, the place is clean and good looking (huge flatscreen, top of the line massage chairs).  They DISINFECT their tools--a deal breaker for me, and sadly not always the case at some other local spots.  I even let Loi talk me into getting a no chip and I am so glad that I did.  My nails look great and they are totally dry when she finishes the manicure.  I mean totally, like I-could-dig-a-ditch-with-them dry..  The prices are reasonable.  Unlike another reviewer, I saw a wide selection of nail colors.  They even had exactly the color I like, which sometimes is hard to find.

2.description: Not great, not especially good either, but if you have nowhere else to go, this will technically do.

18.description: Just left and had a great experience. Very thorough mani / pedi for a reasonable $30. My feet feel the smoothest they've felt in quite some time. I even messed up one of my nails being a busy body while wrapping up. The woman doing my nails re-painted my mistake with no issue. Overall, pleasant experience and I'd return.

13.description: This place is terrible. I've gotten my nails done twice here. The first time I hated the service, I was one of the last people and since they were ready to go they rushed me out with out my nail NOR my feet were dry. They all were smudged. I decided to give them a second chance. The second time the old man was VERY rude and he RUSHED doing my nails. He dug into my nails way too deep with the drill. Not only did I get my nails done about a week ago THREE nails came off. Within a week?!?! I think NOT!! Their service of HORRIFYING!! You would because we are in Hyde park it would b better but no. Try again. They do very nice pedicures tho

4.description: Great first experience, especially after trying Fairy Nail. 10-20 min wait, not bad, and decent customer service. I will be returning. Only con is the dried up acrylic and nail polish left on my fingers (See picture)

24.description: Tried this place because its close to my home. It's clean and I was very satisfied with my service! I recommend this place. I get gel overlays and I never have any compliants. The lady that does my nails is very friendly. Her name is Lori.  Check her out!

6.description: The workers come in late. Water for pedicure gets cold too easily. Their polish is old and dried out. The overall customer service and quality of work is lacking.

22.description: I stumbled upon this place several months ago because it was close to my weekend chores. The first time I went here, I thought the decor was nice, pedicure chairs lovely and friendly staff. However, I didn't like the quality of the gel fill-in I received. The man was a sweet heart, but he laid the gel extremely thick on my nails and didn't file them down correctly. Last week, while in a bind I decided to go back. The service was drastically different. The man gave me an even sloppier fill-in and didn't want to fix his mistakes while polishing my nails. He also rushed me which was weird considering there was no one behind me. Also, the lady servicing a client next me was even more rude that my person. Although I like the convenience of Hyde Park, I'd rather not patron this place again.

15.description: Look. I've been avoiding creating a yelp page for years, but if that's my only way to get the word out, then it shall be done. I have been to this salon 4 times now, including this one. I have only had my nails done 2/4 of those times. This is because the wait is always incredibly long no matter what time of day.First, I was never greeted when I walked into the establishment. I'm willing to let that slide as long as I receive proper service afterwards. Okay, I understand that during regular nail hours, everyone is here & the wait is long. Fine. But I showed up at 10am (opening) to get my nails done. There is one man here. What does this mean? That even though I showed up early, I'm still waiting 45 freaking minutes to even have someone look at my nails.To add insult to injury, the establishment does not give the appearance if a prestigious and clean nail salon. The window sills are dusty. The paint is chipped and faded. I turned my head and there's a thick black spider crawling by the front desk. I nearly died.I have all of this to say, and I haven't even gotten to the actual nail experience yet. After waiting 30 minutes, I said forget the manicure, I'll just get a pedicure once it's my turn. At last, another woman strolls in and I'm hoping I will FINALLY have my toes done. Now. Even though I signed the sign in sheet, the woman goes to the lady who entered AFTER me (and was seated behind me) and asks HER what she wants. Why the hell did she skip over me?I go to pick my color, there aren't even that many options. I wanted a dark blue, there isn't one. Maybe the woman before me took the only one? Idk. Fine. Dark purple is fine.But then the woman makes me bleed, because she picked off too much "dead" skin. She came out with her ear piece in. I ignorantly assumed she would listen to music. No. She was on her phone. But whatever, I guess. I wasn't really in the mood for small talk ANYWAY.Did my nails look nice? Sure. I wonder if that's what keeps people coming back here for despite the terrible service and horribly long wait. But my toe hurt where she cut me, so I'm marking points off for that. And I was in there 1 hour & 45 minutes. So that horrible assault of my free time was actually not worth it.

7.description: I've been waiting for a fill in for over an hour. Other people have come and gone and I'm still waiting. I came here a couple of times before, on the fence about the services. This will be my last time.

8.description: I've only ever gotten pedicures here (it's the only salon service I ever really get, since I paint my fingernails and shape my eyebrows at home). The price is FABULOUS--I think it was only $22 or $23? I definitely paid less than $30 including tip. The nail techs sanitize their equipment right in front of you. One tip though: if you walk in and HAD made a reservation, be vocal about it. If it's busy, they have a sign-in sheet for customers and take care of each person in order (without cross-checking to prioritize reservations). I don't think they're being rude, it's just a disorganized system they use (and I went during prom season, when every nail salon is in a panic). Don't be shy--just be clear, and alert a nail tech you have a reservation and they will bump up your priority. Best pedicure I've ever had? No, but it was really nice, and worth it. They added a few details to make the pedicure better than average, like a hot towel and stones.

3.description: I love this place! The staff is super friendly and they do a great job. They are always available. They don't close often.

14.description: Walked in and walked out; this place has the same air quality issues as Fairy Nails down on Harper.  Went with a friend around 4:00 pm on Saturday and it looked busy, so we certainly would have had to wait.  The moment we stepped through the door, the noxious manicure fumes enveloped us, so we left right away.  Maybe the air would be cleaner if going on a weekday when business is slower?(I give HP Nails two stars for the benefit of the doubt - maybe their product is good!)

1.description: Rude service and bad business.  This place takes plastic for drinks but cash only for food. Also the cash has to be the exact amount. It's the most backward ish ever. I had a bartender literally nag me with her ghetto attitude to get a drink right when I came in the door on a Tuesday simply to check out the dance lessons and jazz band. There was only eight people in the place including my friend and me. Only two people There are three bars and forty or so seats at the bar. No one was sitting at the bar. No one was dancing. The rude bartender told me I couldn't sit at the bar of forty something empty seats because I hadn't ordered a drink and she was really acting like she owned this empty bar...but she didn't. No customer service skills whatsoever.

0.description: 14 dollars for a rum and coke!!!! Plain old Barcadi!!!???  That alone turned me completely off! There is no way that this club can justify the outrageous drink prices. For 14 bucks I should at least taste the liquor and there was not even that much soda added which leads me to believe that it might have been watered down.The womens bathroom needs to be totally remodeled. It smells like mildew. There is a great Live jazz open Jam on Tuesday nights. If I was rating the Jazz jam alone  I would give it 5 stars. I would even feel better paying a cover for the jam versus feeling like I had been ripped off at the bar.

58.description: I'm sorry but I have tried to like their baked goods but I simply do not.  I like Give Me Some Sugah much better.  I must admit they are known for their caramel cake & I don't eat those.

56.description: This is really 2.5 stars, because I like the caramel icing. That being said, the biggest turn-off about Brown Sugar, for me, is not the mediocre, lackadaisical service that many others have mentioned. Service experiences vary from day to day. Besides, when I have a sweet tooth, chocolate cake takes precedence!The problem I have with BSB is that most of the cakes I've tasted are lacking the homemade nuances I expect from a quality bakery cake. It is definitely a step up from Jewel, but not even as good as Angelica's. Now that I think about it, I don't recall there being much brown sugar/molasses flavor to the caramel icing... Don't get me wrong; they are tasty. It's just that it's a Duncan-Hines-Butter-Recipe-Mix tasty, rather than a we-creamed-the-butter-and-sugar-then-added-the-flour-and-buttermilk-alternately kind of tasty. But, hey, that's what I get for being too lazy to make my own, huh?

29.description: Ordered the 4 layer Caramel Cake for a graduation yesterday. Stopped by to pick it up and the place was hopping! Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful and I have to say the cake looked amazing. The owner said it would taste even better than it looked and she was right. It was delicious. This place is a gem and I'll definitely go back.

42.description: Service was quick and polite on Wednesday afternoon. Prices are ok. I purchased pound cake. It was ok. Nothing so special tho. They have a generous portion of flavors to choose from when ordering cupcakes and cake slices. I'll return again and give them another try for a different desert.

23.description: Not that great don't taste the love in the cake or cup cakes it's ight nothing to say i would go back too

47.description: Hands down...one of the best cupcake places in Chicago!! Favorites are the Carmel and Red Velvet cupcakes!! Yummy! For those with a sweet tooth like me...the cake is moist and frosting is on point! Very hard to find both things at any bakery in Chicago. The sherbet and strawberry cake are also very tasty. However, I personally prefer the cupcakes over the cake slices.  This little bakery has a little something for everyone, from cupcakes to pies,cookies, banana pudding, cobblers...etc, and everything is reasonably priced. You will definitely leave out of this place with a big smile, and with great anticipation of sinking your teeth into your brown sugar treat!  :)

8.description: I really had high hopes before coming here. My birthday is coming up and I was in search of a cake bakery. I heard about the unfortunate Carmel cake robbery here from 2 weeks ago. I instantly thought, wow the cakes must be really good. I made it a special trip to go, bringing my mom and sister with me. Upon walking in, the place reminded me of an old dingy bar that need serious updating. I noticed the cakes and pastries in the cases down below. They looked pretty good too. There were to women working behind the counter, one looking like the owner, and the other a young dark brown skinned girl.there were 3 people in the line ahead. When a customer had a question, the young lady demonstrated and explained with one glove on, with her other glove free-hand she wiped her nose with the back of her hand. Instantly my siblings and I didn't want a slice of cake. As we looked for the cupcakes, the older women helping other people and she was moving so fast with the cakes, the slices were falling on the wrack that was holding the cake up in the case. When I and others tried to let her know, she simply said "that's not going to stop the party." She didn't pick them off the deep freezer like racks. My sibling and I work in health careers and this was very offsetting. When my family and I tried to order our cupcakes and engage in conversation, the older women was dismissive and short, and she told the other young lady to help us. The young lady was very helpful and nice, but you couldn't help but notice the slight attitude. In all I did not want to write a review like this, I wanted this to be a great experience. I love to support small businesses such as this one and I'm just disappointed in what I experienced. I will not be coming here again and I don't recommend it. I highly advise this business to work on their cleanliness, to promote good health and product for their customers.

31.description: First thanks ladies for making my son's grad dinner fabulous!  The carmel cake is the best.  I also enjoyed the bread pudding.  The deserts are the bomb.  I have not had anything that was not good.  Also a nice quiet place to have a seat and chill.  I wish them continued success.

34.description: I had the Carmel cheesecake! Oh my goodness such deliciousness. I wish I could eat a slice everyday and stay skinny or rather become skinny. Anywho the staff was friendly and I can't wait to try the Carmel cake it looked so yummy!!!

16.description: I placed an order this week but had to leave a message based on the voice mail instructions stating to do so and within 24 hours you would get a call back. I did not get a call back. So I called was put on hold twice and when I told the worker I left a message of my order she snapped at me in a tone that was unprofessional saying they cannot take orders from messages yet not acknowledging I did not get a call back.  I have placed an order for pickup next Saturday. The order is sizeable. Based on the outcome I may or may not be back. This order is for a friend who I raved to about this Black owned business.  The times I've been here I've looked pass the rude service but my limit has been met.  I'm hoping my order is ready next week without delay and I'm not met with rudeness. If so, that's it for me with Brown sugar

13.description: I must say that the bakery goods are really really good here however I did have a piece of pound cake that appear to be stale and when I took it back instead of listening to my comment they offered too many excuses I didn't really like  that but for the most it's a great experience.As a member of the hospitality community it's very important that your employees represent you in a positive way some of the girls have a slight attitude and aren't as friendly so the customer service is inconsistent as it should be.

11.description: Well,  where should I start?? Brown Sugar Bakery is full of it. I had a preorder of 3 sweet potato pies and one Carmel Cake? First they said come after 1:30pm, my husband went around 2:00pm they said come back at 4:30pm my  husband did , not ready they gave him the cake and said come back before 9:00pm for the pies. No apologies .Still no piesThey were totally rude to their customers. Unprofessional.So my question, When do we stop patronizing black business ??No  matter how good the food when the customer service is less than average at best.

39.description: I've had great experiences at the bakery! All the cakes I've had were all delicious. The only reason I'm not rating it 5 stars, is simply because I ordered my 26th birthday cake from them...which ended up looking more like a wedding cake and not how I explained.

37.description: I visited this bakery for the first time yesterday and I was not disappointed. I bought the caramel, turtle and lemon cupcakes. The cupcakes are delicious (I'm a Sweet Mandy B's snob). The service was first rate. I've read the comments about the service and it looks like maybe the owner and staff are reading them as well and taking heed. Excellent product, excellent customer service. I will be back!

0.description: I LOVE this place! The owner Stephanie Hart is a wonderful woman who has been blessed with a GIFT and she shares it with us!  Her caramel is ADDICTIVE!  My favorite is the caramel pound cake, which I call the caramel dipped pound cake.   Perfect balance of sweet from the caramel and butter from the cake. *eyes roll to the back of my head thinking about it*You can't go wrong with the cupcakes here either. Every flavor that I have tried over the years have been good, very good, and great.  My only complaint (if you can call it that) is that on the 4 layer cake slices there just isn't enough frosting between the layers of melt-in-your-mouth cake.  Our out of town friends and family always tell us before they arrive that we need to make this stop for sweet treats.  They are addicted as well!For those who believe the city ends at Roosevelt Road (12th street) you need to make the drive to 75th and Eberhart.  Its so totally worth it.

38.description: It's unfortunate that I'm unable to continue supporting a black business because of the owner's lack of professionalism. I downloaded the yelp app just to write this review. I got turned onto the bakery a year or so ago and have been patronizing ever since. I was warned about bad attitudes and mistakes, but never experienced it myself. Today that changed! I inquired about the caramel frosting seeming to have changed in its taste and consistency over the past month, only to be disregarded by the "store clerk manager" and the owner. The "nice nasty" disposition they have is very unappealing! To make this short, the cake looks and tastes different, yet the recipe and methods are the same? Ok. The owner was on a call so she couldn't get up from her seat to properly address me, yet continued to shout out questions about my job from across the room. Where's the phone? Anyway, just sent a mass text to all friends and family about my experience to ensure they won't be purchasing either. Sad, but lack of professionalism may keep "Chicago's Best" just that. Right here in Chicago.

51.description: Brown Sugar Bakery made my baby shower cake for this weekend. They messed up my order (not cut into right shape) BUT made up for it by providing a HUGE , delicious alternative and even drew the onesie shape on the cake for me. It was BEAUTIFUL & matched my color scheme perfectly.  Thank you SO much to Ms. Stephanie.

27.description: This is THE place for GOOD desserts. I tell my daughter all the time when she ask me to take her to Sprinkles and all those other places they sale PRETTY cupcakes that taste like a dressed up cornbread muffin. They have all kinds of flavors and different verities of cakes, pies and cobblers. For that sweet tooth this is IT! The only drawback I could think of is they close a little too early. Once you get in from work and pickup your spoiled child they are closed. The gift in that curse is I don't have to worry about the extra pounds I'd put on if I knew they were opened later.

32.description: I have never ordered anything by phone from this bakery until today one thing I can say is that they lack on friendliness they are very abrupt and short. No matter how busy you are you must not let the potential customer know that through attitude. I can say that they have delicious caramel cake I will continue to patronize this business but you really need to improve on customer service.

54.description: This place has great deserts. But neighborhood looks a bit sketchy. I wouldn't hang around to long.

48.description: Today we tried Brown sugar bakery. Although I didn't go. My resources is very trust worthy! She says that the owner was very nice but her help was rude! Hmm rude service well remember u don't have to tip rudeness. Now to the cake. The chocolate cake although good taste like a box cake. The Carmel cake was also just ok. wasn't impressed with this place at all. my wife got a strawberry cupcake. the icing was  good BUT the cake was awful.

44.description: I enjoyed the Carmel cake, and the staff were fairly pleasant & friendly.

24.description: No complaints here. Theres a nice variety of pastries very good quality. I had their double chocolate four layer cake which satisfied my bourgeois chocolate tooth, lol. Today I also got the bread pudding which was thick and super sweet. It was mixed/baked well such the texture was cohesive unlike some bread puddings whose ingredients are characteristically dissociated; you can differentiate the bread from pudding, sugar cinnamon etc.One day I'll sit in and try the dining area where I saw the owner lounging, feet up, probably pooped from all the baking, lol. I know its hard work. A bit pricey but if you're too lazy for diy, then try Brown Sugar Bakery. I still think i bake a better chocolate cake lbvs :-*

7.description: Wow.  Just had a slice of carmel cake that sent me into a complete tail spin.  Simply put....The Best Carmel Cake I have ever tasted. Amazing! !!!

49.description: Have you had the cookies.  Make you want to slap your moma.  My company buys for events and whenever we use them people rave.  The service for me has not been a problem they have helped me to my car even during busy times .

40.description: Well. I'm going to have to thank my coworker Carolyn for referring me to this heaven. I've never had anything as delicious as that cream cheese and caramel cake. It was so delicious, in fact, we just ordered one for our baby shower next week. Whew. I will be back, for sure.

53.description: I must say, this bakery is a must! I loved the orange dream 4 layer cake and the caramel pound cake.  The slices are huge and as a out of towner I will definitely keep this on my places to visit when in Chicago.I have to say the owner is so sweet, I truly enjoyed my experience!

30.description: Butter cookies butter pecan lemon bars lime bars German chocolate cake and she's sweetheart but I'm damn butter cookies in my booty

46.description: The place was quite popular for a small bakery, and rightfully so. The smells inside this place are amazing. I could just sit in there and enjoy the smell of the sugary treats.I had some chocolate chip cookies and a red velvet cupcake, and was not disappointed. The cupcake was rich and moist but the frosting was decadent. Those cookies were some of the best cookies I've ever had!5/5 would return again

1.description: Found this place and bookmarked through one of the food or cooking channels (wife and I watch a lot of tv while holding the newborn.)Glad we found this place as the cake slices we had were great, especially the Pogy and Bess (or however it's called.) The caramel is honestly like crack. The owner Stephanie was there, but was on the phone at a table and even when we made eye contact didn't even nod or acknowledge us. Thankfully, the girl at the counter was nice. I don't know. I want to give a higher rating, but although the cakes we got were good I don't think it's hit the level of some other places. Maybe it's a 3.5 star overall, but the lack of warmth from the face of the bakery leads me to choose 3 instead of 4 stars. Will we be back? Maybe, but really it is a detour to get out there and we left a bit disheartened after spending quite a bit here.

55.description: I was nervous at first that the cake wouldn't turnout right. I had sent a photo of Betty Boop and wanted it designed on buttercream.  They nailed it! I was so happy with the cake and my sister loved it. It was her 40th birthday.  My own recommendation is that the bakery provide idiot proof instructions for transporting the cake.

9.description: Went in yesterday right before closing maybe 6:58. I figured they were still open since the sign on the door still said open.  The cashier then expressed that she was about to close. I asked about a slice of cheesecake and was told they didn't have any.  I then looked at the variety of cakes in the display (at least 9) and then I was told they didn't really have anything. It was obvious they were ready to go home and didn't want my business. I then asked "Do you want me to leave?"  I try and support local businesses but it saddens me when I get poor service. I won't be returning to this bakery as I drove too far to get there and feel unwelcome.  I've worked in the restaurant industry and we would still service customers until the time we close. Not  before. If you close before 7pm change your hours on Google because that is very misleading.

26.description: If u get a cake made here, dont expect it to look professional like it should. The layers are leaning, the decorations look like something a kindergartner would do, etc. If they would invest in themselves some better cake decorating skills the way they do with their bad attitudes then this business would actually be worth patronizing.  This woman's staff is why there's a stereotype in the black community now. Get it together brown sugar

25.description: My experience at Brown sugar bakery was good.  I called on Wednesday to place an order for 1/2 caramel cake for pick up on Saturday.  I picked the cake up, yes I waited patiently while they handled another customer.  When my cake came out I was surprised to see it the lettering on the cake was in blue icing, however i didn't make a big deal out of it but one of the names were spelled incorrectly, this even after I spelled it out when I ordered the cake. The misspelling wasn't to obvious and they offered to correct it, however I refused some saying it was ok.  The cake was the best damn caramel cake I have ever tasted.  All the guests at the engagement party raved about it.

12.description: Cheesecake, caramel, german chocolate and lemon cupcakes are to die for.  If you are watching your figure, this is not the place for you.  Friendly service and tasty treats.

59.description: How does one forget to order a cake for her wedding reception and at the last minute expect to have one? Thats Moi.. I drove all the way to this bakery because I had seen a Facebook page. No I had never tried any of their goods but I am all for supporting small businesses. My appointment was at 11:30 on Tuesday for a reception on saturday, 4 days Later! The owner spoke to me during her lunch moment and i will Forever be grateful.I didn't look at any cakes and didn't even know where to begin. I told the owner Stephanie that We were having our reception at our home (a restored 1895 victorian) and lights were hanging around trees with paper lanterns.. Told her how we were going to marry and said that I needed a cute cake for the table. Just Something! She asked what type of cake I like. I gave her 2 flavors and she said that she knows what to doMy GOD Did she!!! This cake was Unbelievable Beautiful.. A little Vintage and fit me and our home to a T!! People do not eat the cake typically but our guest were looking for seconds. There is NOTHING Left! Not one piece thrown in the garbage and this cake was about $100 (SAY WHAT?!!!!) this was better than those huge cakes at the cheesecake factory.. I know this is a rambling review but I am Overly grateful for the Owner coming through for me. Such a great memory.

21.description: I had the pleasure of meeting the owner of the bakery yesterday she is a very nice lady and gave me a very warm welcome upon entering the establishment .The atmosphere is very friendly and the employees make you feel like you're right at home . The strawberry cheesecake and the red velvet cupcake are both phenomenal!!!! I also purchased 1 lemon cupcake 1 slice of the turtle cheesecake as well as 2 turtle cupcakes they were all good as well.                                All items are reasonably priced and everything is well worth it. There's still a number of items I haven't tried yet and I can't wait to go back to do so Thanks for reading

17.description: This place is great.  The cake is moist.  I had the turtle cupcake real good.  The german chocolate frosting was good cake itself not so.  The price is not too bad

10.description: I had the pleasure of meeting the owner of the bakery yesterday she is a very nice lady and gave me a very warm welcome upon entering the establishment .The atmosphere is very friendly and the employees make you feel like you're right at home . The strawberry cheesecake and the red velvet cupcake are both phenomenal!!!! I also purchased 1 lemon cupcake 1 slice of the turtle cheesecake as well as 2 turtle cupcakes they were all good as well.                                All items are reasonably priced and everything is well worth it. There's still a number of items I haven't tried yet and I can't wait to go back to do so Thanks for reading

5.description: I would give 10 stars if I could! My childhood memories of my grandmothers baking cakes from scratch from memory with scents of cake batter wafting through the house rushed back in full force when I stepped through the door. I must warn you...the cake display with 10 inch 3 layer old fashioned cakes will obliterate any semblance of diets or willpower. These are the moistest  (is that even a word) cakes in the history of cakes. Butter and vanilla-real vanilla add richness and depth of flavor. Did I mention how moist the cakes are???? The frosting  (yes I've tried more than my fair share) are divine. The consistency is smooth and not overly sweet. Porgy and Bess offer the best of both worlds with caramel and chocolate frosting.  Cakes this good should be illegal!

3.description: I love this bakery.  The caramel cake is to die for.  I finally was able to snag a slice of the german chocolte cake.  it is delicious.have yet to try their German Chocolate cake.  I'm on the quest to find one.  The owner is beyond nice and personable.

35.description: I received nothing but smiling and polite service when I stopped by last Saturday afternoon. I ended up buying vanilla cupcakes that I shared later that night over dinner with friends - they were a huge hit, especially with me. I normally don't even like cupcakes, since they often seem to lack in flavor and texture what they're supposed to make up in cuteness and convenience. But these were exceptional - spongy, dense, sweet and rich without feeling greasy.I also just ordered an Obama cake as a birthday treat for my mom. (I never even tried a sample, but I'm sure it'll be outstanding.)

19.description: Not that great don't taste the love in the cake or cup cakes it's ight nothing to say i would go back too

28.description: Careful-Owner uses Benton products! Aldi's! I love Aldi's and I can make the same thing at home.

45.description: I stopped in with my sister in law and friend and we tried the Carmel cream cheese cake and other items. The portions were huge and prices were right. So I began telling family and friends how great the cakes were. This past Monday I stopped by with a few friends and a list of orders. I asked about the Obama cake but wasn't sure if I'd like it so I just continued to read off the orders on my list. One of 2 ladies seated in the seating area asked if I would like to sample the Obama cake and I said yes. Right then the other woman who fit the description of the owner hushed the woman up and told her we don't have samples. That was it. No "I'm sorry". Neither of these ladies even addressed me further. They just kept talking to each other as if the offer of a sample had never happened. Also the cake was right there in the shop on display. So how was there not enough to provide a sample to a potential buyer???We spent over $40 and that's on top of the multiple orders my large family and friends have placed here in the last month. The holidays and my baby shower is coming up. Guess which bakery wont be getting that business??? As a black woman from the south side of Chicago I try to support minority businesses and even give places with known histories of bad service a chance. I have worked in customer service and I know it can be challenging but if you make an offer stick to it. If its a mistake apologize and own up to it. Don't simply ignore the customer hoping they won't push the issue. PS don't waste your money on the cheesecakes. They haven't mastered it yet. Stick to the cupcakes and cakes if you MUST shop here.

33.description: I must say that the bakery goods are really really good here however I did have a piece of pound cake that appear to be stale and when I took it back instead of listening to my comment they offered too many excuses I didn't really like  that but for the most it's a great experience.As a member of the hospitality community it's very important that your employees represent you in a positive way some of the girls have a slight attitude and aren't as friendly so the customer service is inconsistent as it should be.

43.description: I go for the carmel cupcakes. I am tempted to try the peanut butter & jelly cake but I always get the cupcake. Nice decor but they need to fix the display case. I will always come back for the carmel cupcakes. Please do not change the receipe! Did I saw carmel cupcakes!!! Yum!

2.description: Real good cupcakes.  I love cake with lemon frosting, and theirs was really good.  Love seeing a good local bakery, and I'd definitely come back.  I was hoping for red velvet cupcakes as well, but they didn't have those when I came in.

18.description: We first discovered Brown Sugar Bakery when it first opened.  After one free taste of the caramel cake....we were hooked and have been going ever since. I think she makes the absolute best caramel frosting EVER and the cakes are always moist.  They would last for days if we didn't eat them up---nearly before we even get them home!  Please support this business...it is a gem!

41.description: I was nervous going here because of the reviews about surly attitudes from staff. My first visit was on Saturday, January 17, 2015. The second my family and I entered the door with huge smiles, we were greeted with warm smiles from the two ladies working the counter. They attended to us immediately. My eyes grew big from seeing the HUGE cakes on display! One of the ladies smiled wide and told to take my time and take the sights all in. These cakes looked heavenly! Unfortunately, they were out of the Obama cake I've been hearing about. My family and I chose a regular slices (4-layer) of Carmel cake (of course), strawberry frosted yellow, double chocolate; a cheesecake butter cream carmel drizzled cupcake, one chocolate frosted brownie, and one vanilla cream frosted brownie. As our slices were packed, Stephanie Hart came to the counter, and I turned into a little girl! She smiled and said hello, and complimented me on my hair. There was an event going on inside the store but I loved that she stopped to say hello.Now, as for the cakes, I docked one star because I do have to agree with the reviews that say that the cakes seem to be missing that decadent homemade flavor. They are not quite rich and buttery. The carmel frosting, however, IS delicious! It has a true, buttery, rich caramel flavor. The Carmel Cake was the winner out of the other flavors. But, wait...the chocolate frosted brownie...now THAT was to die for! Oh my god! This brownie is dense, rich-deep, sinful chocolate heaven! It's perfectly sweet with dark chocolate flavor. There was pecans inside and then chocolate chips inside. It was so rich that it's STILL sitting in the fridge. We can only eat one tiny square at a time. No worries, though, it WILL be all gone by tonight!We will definitely be back! It was worth the 40 minute drive.

52.description: I had previously tried their caramel cake at Robust on 63rd, so I had to see what all they had in store. The turtle cheesecake was AMAZING - not too sweet and very flavorful. My friend said it was the best cheesecake she had ever had (although the crust could use a little more flavor). The white frosting on the yellow cake was definitely very sweet. Even so, we'll definitely be back for more cheesecake and to try more cupcakes!

50.description: Best carmel cake ever! If I'm bringing cake to a party, this is what I bring.  It always disappears quickly with rave reviews. I call ahead, pick it up, say hello to the owner and I'm out. No complaints here.

4.description: I've seen reviews on Brown Sugar Bakery and kept telling myself to go check it out. I finally made it this past weekend (I was too lazy to bake a cake for my sisters birthday), and OMG, the sweets are DELICIOUS! I bought cupcakes instead of a cake and EVERYONE raved about how good they are. I bought a 'quick sale' slice of caramel cake, and I can't remember ever tasting a cake so light and fluffy. The staff was very helpful and very friendly! Thank goodness it's not close to my house, otherwise I would be there everyday! My only recommendation would be for the bakery to invest in Actual cupcake boxes instead of styrofoam containers. Since the containers have nothing to do with the taste and quality of the cupcakes, I'm still giving this bakery 5 stars!
