6.description: Excellent cakes! The caramel cake is to die for!!!loved it! I also ordered the banana pudding and its the best banana pudding I've ever had!!! Definitely going back!

22.description: 1st off cheers for supporting a female black owned business.  I must say every time I've gone in the bakery I always see the owner Stephanie Hart.  It's a good feeling to see that the owner is present in her business.  We tried 4 different types of cupcakes and they were all delicious.  The one I remember the most is the caramel cream cheese cupcake.  Yummy!   I've always wanted to order a custom cake from her and I finally got my chance.  I ordered a 40th Purple and Gold birthday day cake with buttercream frosting, filled with one half strawberry and the other half pineapple. Oh, it had bling on it as well.  It was a pretty cake.  But, decoratively it's not what I expected.  I wanted a darker purple and gold with plenty of bling.  I received a lilac purple color with a gold outlining and rhinestones outlined the "40" and the bottom tier of the cake.  Oh! It was a 2 tier cake.  I noticed the rhinestone wrap coming off, but they added more buttercream frosting to attach it back.  Cool!   Customer service was good and an employee helped me to my car with the car.  Once I arrived to my venue with cake, I noticed it had a crack in the bottom layer.  This was probably due to the city streets and the weight of the cake.  I tried to drive as easy as possible.  But, you know Chi-town streets.   I'd recommend delivery depending on distance and the weight of your cake.  Anyhow, fast forwarding this review.  Once we sang Happy Birthday, cut the cake and started eating it.  My goodness.  This cake was delicious. But, I do wish it had more strawberry and pineapple filling.  It's been a week since my party and people are still raving about the taste of my cake.  Since, I had 2 tiers I had a lot of cake left.  So, I shared it with family and I froze my number "4" to have in a month with a little dessert wine or tea. LOL      In closing, the decorating of the cake wasn't the best, but the taste definitely made up for it.  I'll definitely go back again and order another custom cake. Everyone deserves a 2nd chance.    For all you BSB fans: They have a Groupon out there right now.  Enjoy!!!

15.description: I have really tried for the past 3-4 years to make this my bakery of choice.  However, they do not seem to realize that no matter how goody heir product may be, there is always somewhere else that is comparable or better.  My problem is not so much with the product but with the lack of professional and customer service.  This pass Thanksgiving, I go to the store only to be greeted with "what do you want?";" did you preorder?".  Just rough and raw.  The saddest pRt is that the owner is usually in house and seems goth ink there is nothing wrong with the behavior of her staff.  I truly want to support black owned businesses but we have to do better in regards to the treatment of the customers.

57.description: I'm a baked goods fanatic and was raised with some amazing pies, breads and sweets thanks to my Eastern European Grandmother, Mom and assorted aunties. I happened to be passing along 75th while on a Lem's mission (they were closed which made me very sad) but slammed on the brakes when I saw Brown Sugar. Having heard Stephanie interviewed on "Afternoon Shift" on WBEZ and being a native Chicagoan who tries to support indie businesses, I popped on in to get my sweet on.  I bought a variety of individual servings of sweet potato pie, pecan pie and red velvet cake and they were all delicious and made with love. I would really have liked the staff (especially the owner) to be a bit more enthusiastic about a first time visitor. I wanted to say hello and mention the WBEZ thing to Stephanie assuming she would be happy to chat and talk about her business but she seemed a bit put out. I did, however, get a great recommendation for the Soul Vegetarian restaurant just down the block. All in all, this is a gem of a business but some warmth and enthusiasm at the counter and especially from the owner would elevate Brown Sugar to rock star status.

20.description: I just saw the owner on the Steve Harvey show and I looked at her video on YouTube, seem like a very nice lady I will be paying her establishment a visit real soon and I will let you guys know what I thought, How about that!! I selected one star for now only because I haven't been their yet.

36.description: love the whole menu!!! carmel cake heaven. I met the owner Stephanie she is as sweet as her cakes .

14.description: I had tasted a few of Brown sugar bakery cakes and decided to order for Christmas Eve. I ordered a Pineapple upside down cake, a Turtle cake and a banana pudding.  I informed the order taker(the owner Stephanie) that this was my first time ordering and she gave me a first time customer discount and a time to pick up.  She advised me to be patient when I pick up because it would be crowded.  I totally understood because her bakery is popular. I sent my daughter to pick up at my designated pick up time (1 o'clock). First problem: they couldn't find my order, smh... then they found it (my name was spelled wrong) but my daughter was told that I couldn't have the pineapple upside down cake, no explanation other than sorry a mistake was made. Either I could pick another cake or have my money back. I find/found  that unacceptable!! I placed and paid for an order in advance only to be disappointed and let down without what appears any accountability.  No explanation,  nothing!!! As if this has happened before. I am really disappointed!  Good Service means EVERYTHING in the success of a business. I would assume that  a check and balance would be in place in efforts to ensure that errors such as this wouldn't occur.  I gave 3 stars because the cakes I've tasted by brown sugar bakery have been good but my experience as a first time customer has been disappointing...

1.description: The hunt is over! I found out about Karen's from the cashier at Anita's Gumbo- they'd recently discontinued their delicious peach cobbler & I had to know the bakery that supplied it! Karen's is right along the Dan Ryan Expressway in a cute pink storefront- the interior is small with no seating & just a walk-up & order window. But what the bakery lacks in comfortability- Karen more than makes up for with her warm personality & to die for desserts. Upon entering I went right to the display case and immediately knew I was in the right place- there sat 4 containers of the words best peach cobbler that I had discovered at Anita's. I kept my composure & only bought 2, also chocolate chip cookies, butter cookies & a red velvet cupcake. When I got home the peach cobbler was just as I'd remembered it- everything else was great too. If you love peach cobbler- GET TO KAREN'S!

0.description: Miss Karen's smile represents the 5 star rating her bakery goods will tantalize your taste buds with.It must be easy for her to do the magic that she does with her bakery goods because she is such a sweet and warm person herself.The peach cobbler is to die for the brownies are the same. Her butter cookies remind me of when I was a kid in public school and the lunchroom made the butter cookies.I am so thankful that Miss Karen does not be stingy with the butter in her products I would rather pay a little more money for a high quality product and that is Karen knows how to deliver.Her buttermilk pound cake is heavenly so if you want to treat yourself or treat your sweet to a sweet go see Miss Karen you owe it to yourself and your taste buds.Thank you Ms Karen. You are a treat of sweets kudos!Executive Chef- Bruce A. Belisle

I have purchased flowers twice from Rhodes Florist for my girlfriend.  Both times she absolutely loved them.  They were fresh and beautifully arranged (so she said) and their delivery service is prompt.I have to give them extra kudos for providing great customer service.  I realized on the Thursday morning before Valentine's Day that I ordered flowers to be sent on Friday.  The problem was that I discovered that my girlfriend's place of work was not even open on Friday...yikes!  I called immediately to ask if the delivery could be changed to that day and they said no problem.  The flowers made it by early afternoon and I was saved a major headache!

I have been to this grocery store a few times since I have been here and it isn't bad for a corner grocery store, but it isn't my first choice.This store is also not as big as Jewels or Food 4 less but since there are not any close grocery stores it comes in handy if you need something close and last minute.I have never gotten any of the meat at this location but I plan on trying it out because they seem to have a good selection but you do need to pay close attention like any grocery stores these day that the meat is fresh.There was only one time that I went too this location and had a cashier seem less than pleased to be at work but she could have just had a bad day.  For the most part I believe they employ people from the neighborhood and they have been very friendly.As far as price goes it's reasonable on some items and I have seen other items that was a bit overpriced but again that's normal of any store.I still don't understand the checking of my bags at any store, because when people want to steal they find away rather you have my bag in the back of the counter or not.All in All its a pretty okay store and I will be back again.Enjoy!

I remember when I first saw this place I walked in and I walked out.  It wasn't until the liquor store that I would normally go to was closed that I took a deep breath and decided to try this place out.I'm not use to going to the liquor store and all the liquor is behind the counter so it was a new experience for me to ask the cashier the prices, the ingredients of a new product, etc.  I basically couldn't do comparison shopping without the cashiers help and the other customers were not that pleased with me but hey I had to see what was the better buy and what I wanted to drink at the time.This isn't just a liquor store either it has a mini mart in it as well...I haven't gone through the store but I have picked up some chips, juice and soda.  I have also gotten food off the clearance table but you have to make sure you check the dates because I saw some things that had a sale by date in 6/2012 and even on clearance that was to old to buy so BEWARE!The cashiers have always been patient with me and I think by now they are even use to me on the days that I may not know what I want to buy.I still don't like the fact that there are so many people who hang out around the stores on this strip but I have learned to just get what I want and go.  I like the fact that they are open late and if we decide to have an impromptu party the likelihood of them being open is great.So, now I walk in and walk out but usually with a purchase...I will be back!P.S. They take Debit but not Credit!!!Enjoy!!!

3.description: I was visiting Chicago and was meeting my elderly godmother for the weekend. I realized she would not be able to walk everywhere we wanted to go and asked the front desk for a wheelchair rental. They gave me Angelcare's phone number and they delivered a wheelchair within 2 hours!! We used the chair all weekend and they picked up on a Sunday am...incredible service and quite affordable. Definitely use them!!!

1.description: The service I received from Angelcare & Medical Equipment Supply Co. in Chicago was outstanding.  The wheelchair I reserved was there on time; when I experienced a problem with it after a few days, it was promptly exchanged for a new one.  The personnel I spoke with, especially, Maria, were always pleasant and courteous.  They were responsive and and responsible professionals and I highly recommend this service!!! I would use them again without hesitation.  BRAVO!!!!Claire G.

2.description: Was absolutely no help to me.  Needed a large,  manual wheelchair for a visiting family member for the weekend.  Called 4 days ahead and left a message, no one called me back.  Called back two days ahead, got a person. They spoke slow and slurred and had to ask them to repeat several times.  Could not provide us a manual wheelchair.

5.description: I recently returned from visiting my sisters in Chicago, one whose debilitating medical condition makes it difficult for her to walk. Angelcare gave me a great price, delivered on their promises for delivery and pickup, answered our questions, and worked to meet our needs. The wheelchair was in excellent condition. The customer service was superb. Everyone we came in contact with were professional and congenial. I just can't express enough how blessed I feel for Angelcare's service to us. I am so glad I discovered them. It will definitely be my choice when I return to Chicago.

0.description: A few days ago I desperately needed a wheelchair and the owner answered the phone when I called. He was very cordial and helpful. Because I could not complete the order at that moment, one of his staff followed up by calling me. She was very cordial and helpful as well. Once I got to the store, I felt even more impressed by her continued customer service. I had never purchased a chair before and she took the time to show me a variety of options while answering all my questions. The process was simply painless and positive overall. I will definitely return and recommend to others!

4.description: The responsiveness and service at Angelcare went well beyond my expectations.  We needed a folding, lightweight wheelchair for the visit of a disabled friend.  Not only was the price affordable but the representative offered to deliver it on a Sunday - personally - so to better accommodate our needs. Unfortunately, on the day  prior to delivery, our friend called to tell us she had fallen and broken her arm and would need to cancel her visit entirely.  I emailed Angelcare and left a message.  That night I received a reply informing me that I would receive a full refund on my credit card.  Not only responsive, reasonably priced, but extremely fair.  Will absolutely call them the next time we need a chair or medical equipment.

3.description: Doug is a very knowledgeable and reliable. He has educated me alot about my hair and given me very useful tips on how to take care of natural hair. He does not just do hair, he educates about your hair, which is the most important thing. Your service is fast, you will not be in here all day. The prices are great and fair. The styles are incredible. I highly recommend the salon for great hair care.

1.description: Lo and Doug are knowledgeable about hair care. They are flexible when I call last minute for a wash and locstitch and are reasonably. They are down to earth people and I enjoy my time in the shop because I used to hate beauty salons. I don't spend all day getting my hair done, which I greatly appreciate. I am comfortable coming here and will keep coming back!

2.description: Fantastic service and excellent hair care! Doug has been doing my hair for over three years. I transitioned from processed hair to natural hair by allowing him to do a HUGE (much more drastic than big) chop! I had less than 1/2 an inch of hair in April 2010. My hair is now 1/2 way down my back --and HEALTHY!

0.description: I just started the loc process today, and i left this salon satisfied. I definitely will recommend this shop for people thats starting locs or have locs. I went to Delores, but a few people that i ran into that had locs, and been to that shop before said that Doug was the person to see & that my locs would have been flawless if i would of went to him.But everyone said Delores still did a decent job, but doug would of laid it out for me. I wish i would of knew that in advance because i want my dreads to look really good... But we will see how it grows out, and delores was really nice, and knowledgeable on doing dreads so will see. I'll post some update pictures in 3months.If i would of known about the great reputation doug had i would of preferred him though.

4.description: I had an appointment for a two strand dry twist with Deloris. I have very thick hair so I tried to explain that over the phone. She said she would charge me an extra $15. I was fine with that. During my appointment, she was very polite, professional and asked a lot of questions about how I wanted my hair done. I appreciated her wanting to give me what I wanted. It took a long time for her to finish and at the end, she increased the price by $40! If she wanted to see my hair for a consultation in advance, she should have mentioned that. When I arrived for my appointment and she saw how much hair I had, she could have informed me that she would have to charge more before she started. The fact that she did not do either of these and upped the price SO much at the end because it took her a long time ruined the experience for me. On top of that, she didn't twist my hair from the root, made very boxy parts and broke some of my hair off when she blow dried it so I wasn't happy with the way my hair looked. I think that Deloris usually does treated hair styles and not natural styles. I also wish this was also better communicated.
